title: appologize japan for atomic bombings in 1945 and destroy all nuklear warheads.
body: In this 70th year since the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, we are reminded of the catastrophic humanitarian consequences of nuclear weapons use.As we mark the 70th anniversary of the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, it is vital that we learn from the past to help ensure a more peaceful future.so we ask Obama administration to apologize japan for atomic bombings and destroy all nuclear warheads in the United States.

title: eradicate the notion of the child prostitute, in language and law.
body: There are estimated to be at least 100,000 American children trafficked for sex each year.They are routinely raped, beaten into submission, and when they try to run away, the traffickers will often torture or gang rape them, Or both.more than 1,000 children every year are arrested for prostitution and According to the FBI, for prostitution arrests under the age of 18, African-American children comprise 59% of all prostitution-related arrests in the United States, even though many of them are not legally old enough to consent to sex.They are not child prostitutes. they are victims of child rape, and deserve all the legal protections and services afforded to other child victims of abuse.we ask Obama Administration to eradicate the notion of the child prostitute, in language and law.
issues: c(321, 311) c("Criminal Justice Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Formally Investigate the Transphobic Violence Leading to the Rising Death Toll of Transgender Women of Color in the U.S.
body: Since January 9, 2015, twelve (12) Transgender women, mostly women of color, have lost their lives due to hate and Transphobia.  Eight of these beautiful lives were lost in the first two months of the year.   With such a high death toll, something must be done to raise awareness and end the senseless killings of a targeted, vulnerable community.For Transgender women of color, safety is a real and warranted concern.  We are asking the administration to raise awareness and take action to keep this community safe, by conducting a formal investigation of these deaths occurring across the county to the targeted community of Transgender women, particularly women of color. Please take action to ensure this community does not have to live in fear of losing their lives to hate and violence.
issues: c(321, 311) c("Criminal Justice Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Change your policies toward Saudi Arabia, since it is a nondemocratic country!

It is where Al-Qaeda came from. it is the country which mostly supports Jihadist ideology and so on.We ask upon Obama Administration to Change his policies toward Saudi Arabia, since it is a nondemocratic country!

title: A disability tax credit of $10,000 for parents of children and adults with autism staying at home.
body: We request a disability tax credit of $10,000 for parents of children and adults with autism and other disabilities staying at home to cover costs incurred on account of  delay or denial of services by the Department of Developmental Disabilities and the School system. This delay or denial causes financial stress in addition to the emotional and life stresses caused by the disability on the family. We petition the government to create this and other such tax credits so that parents have additional resources to assist the disabled individual.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Send Aid to The Commonwealth of Puerto Rico's drought relief
body: Within the last 3 months the drought that the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico has been enduring for the past 2 years has worsened. The resevoir is at the lowest levels it has been for decades. The government is trying the best they can with the resources they have and in some parts the water is turned off for five days at a time (meaning no showers, no handwashing, no dishes, no plumbing.) And yet the US has done nothing to acknowledge their struggle. We petition the Obama administration to send aid to the island of Puerto Rico such as bottled water for the poor who cannot afford to buy bottled water and providing food for disadvantaged school children who have had their school days cut short (including lunch programs that they relied on for steady meals)
issues: c(296, 311) c("Energy & Environment", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Force Gates Chili to honor the DOJ's ruling and allow Devyn's Aide to get training for service dog.
body: Seven year old Devyn Rose Pereira has Angelmans, a rare genetic condition presenting as an extreme case of Epilepsy and Autism.  Her service dog detects and disrupts life threatening seizures, helps her walk and stay on task to learn.  Without cause, the Gates Chili School District disregarded medical recommendations and illegally removed the service dog from Devynxs individualized education plan (IEP).  The district maintains that if Ms. Pereira is unable to pay for a separate dog handler, Devynxs service dog would be denied access to school.  It also took the additional step of barring all school employees from assisting Devyn with her service dog.  The Department of Justice ruled the Gates Chili is in violation of the Americans with Disability Act (ADA).
issues: c(311, 18, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Abolish the Federal Death Penalty
body: We ask the United States government to abolish the Federal Death Penalty. While we recognize the rights of individual states to determine within their borders the limits of punishment, the United States remains one of an increasingly small number of countries who endorse this archaic practice as a nation. The cost of housing DP inmates is a tremendous burden to taxpayers. Recently botched lethal injections have caused torturous, cruel & inhumane deaths for a # of inmates thus violating their 8th Amendment Constitutional Rights. Public support for the sentence is currently at an all time low.  Innocent people have been put to death & such situations highlight the fallibility of the practice. This would be an admirable first step to correctional reform.  Please set this much needed example.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: We the people demand that the city of Winter Park, Florida charge George Allan Burdock for animal cruelty.
body: We the people of the United States demand that George Allan Burdock be charged with animal cruelty for is gross sordid & deplorable actions. On Thursday August 13th around 8:30pm according to the witness George Burdock of Winter Park,Florida shot his neighbors harmless beautiful dog named "Lilly" with a loaded 38 pistol. Allegedly on the evening of the 13th Mr. Burdock was walking the neighborhood with a gun allegedly scaring the neighbors. Allegedly Allan Burdock claims he thought his safety was in jeopardy by Lilly whome was a neighborhood favorite pet for the past 14 years according to the witness. The witness alleges lilly is a great dog and harmless. This was a hanice act of aanimal cruelty. The Winter Park police department have not charged George Allen Brdock and we demand justice!
issues: c(311, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: work with Congress on a solution to fix the marriage penalties against people with disabilities.
body: People with disabilities need to have the right to marry and have security for their families. Right now, many people with disabilities are penalized because they require services to survive. These services are through both federal and state programs.These programs include (but are not limited to) Medicaid, SSDI/SSI, and even section 8 or food stamps. They are often the only programs to offer what can be life-saving services. For example, only state Medicaid will pay for PCA based home healthcare. No private insurances will cover this.We would like the president to work with Congress and states to raise the income threshold for these programs, so people with disabilities can get the services they need  and still have access to what the Supreme Court recently  called a civil right.
issues: c(311, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: seek peaceful solutions on international conflicts in order to decrease world immigration
body: The world has experienced many wars in the past decades, in many of them United States had a key role.these sorts of wars caused unrest in many of countries especially in Middle East, forcing millions of people to take refuge.If we change our foreign policy and approach peaceful solutions on international conflicts, then we can make sure more people live in their own countries and decrease number of immigrants.
issues: c(24, 311, 29) c("Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Immigration")

title: To recognize Ehler Danlos Syndrome (EDS) as a disability.
body: Ehler Danlos Syndrome is an often debilitating genetic disorder caused by defects in collagen. This affects the body's connective tissue throughout the vasculature, joints, and skin. Depending on the type of EDS that is inherited, symptoms may vary from joint laxity and hyper mobility to postural orthostatic tachycardia and aortic dissection. Skin may be fragile, prone to bruising, and wound healing is poor. Joints may be predisposed to early onset arthritis, painful dislocations and subluxations, and many sufferers require multiple surgical interventions. Coexisting diseases prevalent in EDS patients include Dysautonomia, celiac disease, autoimmune disorders such as Raynaud's, osteopenia, and mast cell disorder. More information can be found on www.ednf.org
issues: c(311, 25, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Put an end to the most embarrassing act of injustice, The Guantanamo

It would absolutely embarrassing  for this administration if this promise which was made by a high ranking official of this great country, is not fulfilled as expected!It only reminds me that once a Gitmo detainee sets foot in the US, he is going to acquire some rights!

title: Make the CDC explain why their position on circumcision is so different from other developed nations
body: On a daily basis parents are making the decision to cut their son's penis, based on the policies of the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), which seem to promote circumcision. However, both the CDC and AAP ignore the human rights issues at play, and don't even mention the long-term harms associated with amputating an integral part of the male genitalia. Please make the CDC review their policy, and respond to the many questions being asked, such as: Why is our policy so different from that of other developed nations? Why are the long-term harms overlooked? How can it be ethical to promote unnecessary surgery on infants? Is it not irresponsible to tell people that circumcision can reduce the risk of STD contraction? And many more...

title: Make September Dystonia Awareness Month
body: Despite being the third most common movement disorder, most have never heard of dystonia. Affecting an estimated 500,000 people in North America, dystonia causes the brain to send improper signals to muscles, resulting in awkward, often painful, movements and postures. Dystonia affects people of all ages and can make it difficult to perform even simple tasks like walking, talking, eating, drinking, and even breathing. There is currently no cure for dystonia and it is not unusual for people to wait years to decades for a diagnosis. Having an officially recognized awareness month will bring much needed attention to this disorder and hopefully lead to prompter diagnoses, better treatments, and some day a cure.Please take a minute to add your signature. You could be changing someone's life.
issues: c(311, 316, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Health Care")

title: AWARD C.O. SIMPKINS, SR, THE PRESIDENTIAL CITIZENSHIP MEDAL FOR HIS LEADERSHIP IN ADVANCING CIVIL RIGHTS AND EDUCATION
body: Cuthbert "C.O." Simpkins, Sr., DDS, of Shreveport, Louisiana, is a civil rights champion who challenged discriminatory voting practices that disenfranchised thousands of citizens. An Air Force veteran, Simpkins co-founded the Southern Christian Leadership Conference with the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and led voter registration drives during the 1950s and 1960s. Threats against his family and the burning of his homes forced him to move. In New York he helped establish York College of CUNY, making higher education accessible to more students. He returned to Louisiana 26 years later and was elected to the state legislature, continuing a life of service. His efforts strengthened communities across America. Dr. Simpkins deserves special recognition and thanks from a grateful nation.
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: Help Bert "Buddy" Melvin Get His Purple Heart Medal
body: Bertram (Buddy) Melvin  joined the Navy in Boston, MA in 1942.  He was shipped out to the Pacific Theater and served aboard three different ships and was in 10 major naval battles throughout the war. A 5" gun he was next to exploded on the USS Wichita CA-45 and he was hit in the head with a piece of shrapnel, which knocked him unconscious. Still has the dent in his head.At the end of the War when they lined up to receive their medals, Buddy was supposed to receive the Purple Heart. The Captain apologized to him and said they had run out of medals but he would get one when he got back to home.In Boston he told the officer in charge that he was supposed to receive the Purple Heart. The officer said that he would need to get a letter from the Captain who was still in Japan.

title: help bring down the Great Fire Wall of China, who's shutting down the VPN services nationwide.
body: Since 1990s', Beijing has been spending on building the Great FireWall, or GFW, legislation and projects initiated by the government, to attempt to regulate the Internet in Mainland China. Meanwhile, programmers have written codes to help Chinese Internet users to access sites blocked by GFW. For a moment, Chinese people seemed to be able to use VPN services to access the outside world, if they bother to try.However, Beijing has tightened the grip by shutting down many, if not all, VPN services in China. Secret Polices were even sent to coerce VPN developers to stop updating the services. Mainland China is currently an island, walled from the currents of free Internet.But NO ONE is an island and NO ONE should be. We hereby petition the Obama administration to help tear down the GFW!

title: Publicly address the killings of six law enforcement officers in one week.
body: The week of August 23rd, 2015, saw the deaths of six law enforcement officers across our country, three of which have been attributed to gunfire. As of September 1st, 2015, the Obama administration has made no public acknowledgment of these murders, unlike the deaths of Michael Brown and Freddie Grey. Condemning the actions of law enforcement officers in these two incidents to the entire nation, President Obama requested White House Officals be sent to the funerals of these individuals to honor their deaths.We as a nation request that the Commander in Chief of this  nation stop condoning the actions lawless, and support those that uphold the very statutes that you set for it's citizens. All data contained herein was obtained from "The Officer Down Memorial Page"

title: Award a posthumous Presidential Medal of Freedom in recognition of jazz composer, arranger and pianist Billy Strayhorn.
body: In honor of the Billy Strayhorn Centennial, we his heirs along with a host of professional musicians, entertainment insiders, educators, and the general public seek a posthumous Presidential Medal of Freedom in recognition of his contribution as a great American composer, his involvement in social justice (worked with Martin Luther King Jr.) and his support of those in need. Duke Ellington received the Medal of Freedom from President Richard Nixon in 1969. In accepting the award, Ellington did so in deference to his collaborator, Billy Strayhorn. Strayhorn is famous for his lack of fame, given his accomplishments. One of the reasons his legacy has been overlooked is due to his commitment to live openly as a gay black male in the 1940's. Strayhorn's life personifies the meaning of freedom.

title: Raise the refugee ceiling from 70,000 to 140,000
body: The United States is a nation of immigrants- our own ancestors were once the tired, the hungry, the worldxs dreamers and adventurers yearning to breathe free. Our economy and culture have been built by the millions of people who migrated to this country to escape poverty, war and political or religious persecution. Each year, the President and Congress put a ceiling on the number of refugees we accept. This year that number stands at only 70,000. Meanwhile, the global refugee crisis grows worse with every passing day. The U.S. has the capacity to help many more refugees than it currently does. We the undersigned call on the White House to take action and double the refugee ceiling for next year x from 70,000 to 140,000.For more info: givemeyourtired.squarespace.com
issues: c(311, 29) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Immigration")

title: Recognize Hunger-Striking U.S. Resident Surat Singh Khalsa & His Peaceful Struggle for Human Rights
body: Surat Singh Khalsa, a U.S. resident since 1988 who lives in Lathrop, CA, has been on hunger-strike in Punjab, India since January 16, 2015 to demand release of political prisoners.83-year-old Khalsa has been arrested and force-fed three times for exercising his right to peacefully protest. His hunger-strike has inspired thousands around the globe to demonstrate in support. Canadian and British Parliament members and poltical parties have formally recognized him.Nine CA congressional reps have appealed for Khalsa, telling Secretary Kerry: "We are seriously concerned about the repressive actions that have been taken against him for continuing to peacefully exercise his right to free speech."Please take a moment to recognize the world's oldest hunger-striker, a resident of California. ~AV
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: Repeal Executive Order 13685 of December 19, 2014
body: On December 19th 2014 President BARACK OBAMA signed Executive Order 13685 "Blocking Property of Certain Persons and Prohibiting Certain Transactions With Respect to the Crimea Region"According to the Act the following are prohibited:- new investment in the Crimea region by a United States person, wherever located- the importation into the United States, directly or indirectly, of any goods, services, or technology from the Crimea region- the exportation, reexportation, sale, or supply, directly or indirectly, from the United States, or by a United States person, wherever located, of any goods, services, or technology to the Crimea regionIndeed Sebastopol and Crimea are both quite export oriented. Thanks to the Act our region is dying now. We belive it violates our right to live.
issues: c(311, 24, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Remove federal barriers for Veterans seeking to medicate with Cannabis as an alternative to pharmaceutical cocktails.
body: The Weed for Warriors Projectxs principle focus is ensuring veterans have legal access to cannabis in whichever state they reside. Cannabis is recognized as an alternative to many dangerous pharmaceuticals commonly prescribed by the VA. The VA acknowledges 22 veteran suicides occur per day, equating to over 8,000 deaths per year.  With 29 States not providing data, including California and Texas, we fear an accurate number will easily surpass 16,000 deaths per year.Mr. President, as federal patients we need you to grant us access to cannabis.  We require this without discrimination or unjust action taken against us.  Our military families have earned the right to heal.  Please listen to those fighting this daily battle.  Cannabis heals.
issues: c(311, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Veterans & Military")

title: Mandate All Insurance to Cover Infertility as Basic Healthcare. Acknowledge Infertility as a Disease, not a Choice.
body: No one expects to receive a diagnosis of infertility, or even worse, unexplained infertility, but when it happens, patients reach out to insurance companies for help, not expecting to be turned away. Infertility is a disease that men and women do not choose, nor do we welcome the depression, shame, and anxiety that accompany it.It is referred to as a "pre-existing condition" that requires months, even years, of care. How is being diagnosed with the inability to do what you were BORN to do, different than someone who has diabetes & seeks possible lifetime assistance through their insurance?Mandate infertility coverage on a state level so those who suffer do not have to incur massive debt in order to be parents.Infertility is a disease, and treatment should not be viewed as elective.
issues: c(316, 25, 311) c("Economy & Jobs", "Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Change Columbus Day to Indigenous Peoples' Day
body: October 12th, 1492 is the day that Christopher Columbus hit land in the Americas. However, he did not discover anything. There were millions of inhabitants living in the Americas, and they had been inhabiting the continent for thousands of years. Columbus committed atrocities against humanity towards the Indigenous people and set the stage for the genocide of 100 million Indigenous people all throughout North, South and Central America.Columbus Day was made a federal holiday in 1934, and it is time to do away with this backwards holiday. While Native Americans were against the celebration of Columbus in 1934, we had no voice to oppose this holiday. We are asking the US Government to revoke the federal celebration of this holiday, and instead to celebrate Indigenous Peoples' Day.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

Then they restricted to born more then two child. 1982 to 2015, they are not allowed to move free, huge restrictions to visit doctors and sometimes given false medicine. title: Your policy "to aggressively investigate and prosecute the stealing of secrets" has been abused by DOJ
body: Dear President Obama:We agree with your decision to aggressively investigate and prosecute stealing of government and corporate secrets. However, judging from the injustice and harm done to Sherry Chen and Professor Xiaoxing Xi, your policy apparently has been abused. Aggressiveness has been mis-interpreted as permission to be careless, or worse to use race and national origin for profiling x practices rejected even at the height of anti-terrorist investigations after 9/11. We respectfully request that you instruct the Department of Justice that due diligence and process must be followed, and that racial or national origin profiling is not permitted.We also feel strongly that there ought to be apologies to and compensations for the victims to make them whole.Respectfully,The undersigned

body: The present set of Conditions Accepted for applying for Social Security Disability, (SSD) or (SSDI), aka Disability Benefits or full Social Security Monthly Benefits, is Outdated and MUST be revised to include:   Internal Conditions were discovered in the 1800's or earlier; recent advances in MRI imaging Electronic Nerve Testing, other Diagnostic testing, are bringing these severe, life-altering Disabilities to light. Physicians, Researchers, Clinics and Support Groups concur; numbers of disabled patients with no category for their Diseases continue to grow, an estimate of 1:1000 are likely affected!   These Conditions Include: Chiari 1 Cerebral Malformations, Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Mixed Connective Tissue/ Mast Cell Disorders, Neuropathy; Neurological Disorders, Rheumatology, and More.

Her efforts are one that clearly favors a specific candidate and THAT is not democracy as establish by our forefathers.

title: College Student Receives Failing Grade For Tutoring Peers Better Then Professor
body: This is a petition for Cameron Miles a fellow student at the University of Houston who also proudly served this country. Cameron is an honest man who provided help and tutorial videos on how to complete homework assignments for a Statistics course that he shares with nearly 300+ students.But recently he was removed from the course and given a failing grade for helping his peers.His tutorials helped us by providing, a greater knowledge on how to use certain formulas, and the interpretations of questions. He provided us, "The Students" an alternative to the overcrowded tutorial sessions the university provides.This is a heavy disciplinary action UH has taken against Cameron Miles. And we as a student body believe this action should be revoked.Thank You, A Distressed Coog
issues: c(311, 18, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Veterans & Military")

title: Mandate Paid Maternity Leave
body: Did you know that the U.S. is the only industrialized nation to NOT require paid leave for parents of newborns?New parents in the U.S. are guaranteed their jobs for 12 weeks after the arrival of a new baby, per the Family Medical Leave Act of 1993. However, financial assistance  is not guaranteed during this time and exemptions to FMLA apply for small companies.Since the 1970s, the proportion of working-mothers has climbed to nearly 50% from 25%. Without women in the workforce, the economy would be about 15% smaller, equating to about $2.5 trillion in lost economic output.Clearly, both women and men are critical to maintaining this Country's high economic stature. It's time to provide working parents with the means and support to adequately care for our next generation
issues: c(316, 311) c("Economy & Jobs", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Overturn the Defund Planned Parenthood Bill
body: The US House of Representatives have just passed a bill that would ban federal funding of planned parenthood for a year. This is not okay. Planned Parenthood does so much more for people than provide abortions. They educate, provide several health care services, STD testing, and provide safe spaces for individuals. Plus, if people can't receive abortions due to lack of federal funding, that won't stop abortions from happening, it will only stop SAFE abortions. Something needs to be done about this. Are you willing to speak out against this injustice? Sign if you are in favor of this. Thank you for your support!
issues: c(25, 311) c("Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality")

They had two secret trials, with no lawyers, and his family was not informed of these trials.   They could not mount any defense.  This week the Saudi Supreme court upheld his execution by crucifixion.   We should put pressure on Saudi Arabia to release him from prison, pardon him.   If they refuse to do this, we should enact sanctions.   This is a travesty in this day and age!http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/sep/18/saudi-prisoner-arrested-at-age-17-faces-death-by-c/

title: Actively Promote Revising the Tax Code to Protect Children from Sexual Abuse
body: Honorable President Obama, We petition your Administration to fully support a bill to revise the Tax Code for tax-exempt organizations so that such organizations must pro-actively protect children from sexual abuse, and encourage members of Congress to sponsor or co-sponsor it.  A proposed legislative overview and draft of an acceptable bill are available at https://www.dropbox.com/sh/lbrkte086omivtt/AADN7PQHNylsdKwbltjHxBUea?dl=0 .It is time to change the law(s).  The causes of child sexual abuse are known.  The statistics are known.  It is time for the Government to enact common sense law(s)  to pro-actively protect children instead of study abuse or just prosecute pedophiles.

title: Make March Stiff Person Syndrome (SPS) Awareness Month
body: Despite being underdiagnosed or misdiagnosed, most have never heard of SPS. SPS affects an estimated 330 people (1 in 1 million) in America causing gait disorders leading to stiffness then spasms or seizures of the entire body. SPS affects people of all ages and can make it difficult to perform simple tasks such as walking, talking, eating, drinking, and even breathing. There is currently no cure for SPS and it is not unusual for people to wait at least 7 years for a diagnosis. Having an officially recognized awareness month will bring much needed attention to this syndrome and hopefully lead to a quicker diagnosis, more research, better treatments, and some day a cure allowing for a better quality of life.Please take a minute to add your signature. You could be saving someone's life.
issues: c(311, 316, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Health Care")

title: Stop Medicare from Making Inappropriate Cuts to Complex Wheelchair Accessories
body: Despite past legislation & recent congressional action, Medicare is diminishing reimbursement rates for complex rehab wheelchair accessories & seating systems in January 2016. This will have a devastating impact on severely disabled people across the U.S.People with significant disabilities such as ALS, cerebral palsy, multiple sclerosis, muscular dystrophy & spinal cord injuries rely on these items to meet their medical & independence needs.  No clinical or medical evidence has been provided as to why these changes are necessary. If this policy is not rescinded, major decreases in availability (or outright elimination) of individually configured complex rehab wheelchair systems will occur.To protect access for people with severe disabilities, this policy must be rescinded.
issues: c(311, 25, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: grant multiple entry visas to Iranian applicants for a work visa.
body: Iranian people who hold a work visa in the U.S. are unfairly deprived from the right to travel freely to Iran to visit their family simply because they are Iranian and because there is no reciprocity in Iran for U.S. Citizens. This reason could not be more wrong or unfair. Iranian citizens who come to the United States are people whose hopes, dreams and aspirations have been stifled by the government of Iran. They are the silent critics of the Iranian government and by seeking the highest degrees of education and training, they are the hope for a better future in Iran. Yet, they are being unfairly punished for a policy of their government I which they have no say. They cannot travel home on holidays, vacations or emergencies out of the fear of being refused a return visa.

title: Advocate forcefully for the release of Sandy Phan-Gillis from Chinese custody.  She needs your help.
body: Sandy Phan-Gillis is an American citizen who has been detained by China's spy agency, the Ministry of State Security, for over 6 months.  She is being investigated under the political charges of Spying and Stealing State Secrets.  She is jailed and in solitary confinement.Sandy was part of a simple trade delegation with the Mayor Pro-Tem of Houston Ed Gonzalez and businessmen, and was detained while attempting to cross into Macau.Sandy is not a spy or a thief.  However, nothing short of a direct appeal to President Xi Jinping is likely to gain her freedom, since she is detained by State Security.  We ask that you advocate vigorously for her release.  Previous Americans detained on these charges always received vigorous advocacy from their leaders, and Sandy deserves it as well.
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: enforce Indonesia government to accept international aid in putting out the current forest fire within a limited time.
body: The current annual forest fire in Indonesia is disastrously threatening environment quality and human beings' life, in not only its local areas but also its neighbours Malaysia and Singapore. With PSI around 200 in Singapore and over 2000 in Indonesia, haze is leading to great unhealthy living for involved residents. Respiratory illness and eyesight harm are now common illness. Death cases have already been covered in Indo. In the long run, acid rain and more hidden dangers are to appear.Indonesia has rejected any other countries' offer to put out the fire, and takes its time in trying to solve the problem itself. Indonesia authority has also indicated that nothing much can be done except to wait until the rainy season (end of Sep)We petition that international aid to be enforced.

title: REQUIRE SEX-ED CLASSES TEACH SECTIONS ON CONSENT
body: Consent seems like an easy thing to understand, but the truth is many people, especially teenagers, don't understand consent, and grow up not understanding it which results in sexual abuse, rape, and a one sided story to how sexual abuse happens. Let's require sex-ed classes to teach students about consent, and exactly what it is, so that we all understand our right to say no, and understand when to stop. This is a vital issue that can help stop sexual abuse from happening. Sign this petition to help victims from becoming victims, by stopping abusers from becoming abusers.
issues: c(326, 311) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Ban Solitary Confinement for Minors Held in Federal Custody
body: Our juvenile justice system is broken. The facts show it: - Of all developed nations, the US is #1 in incarcerating kids- We even lock kids up for skipping school and running away  Whatxs worse is that despite data proving solitary confinement can result in serious neurological and psychological damage, we routinely submit thousands of kids, some as young as 11 years old, to this isolation.    Recently President Obama called the practice into question asking: xDo we really think it makes sense to lock so many people alone in tiny cells for 23 hours a day?x With over 12 states considering actions to limit solitary confinement, momentum is building. Sign today to tell the White House to end this damaging practice unless itxs a temporary way to prevent injuries to the child or others.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Clean Safe Water for Flint Michigan is needed immediately. Children have lead poisoning & infrastructure is contaminated
body: Flint Michigan residents need CLEAN SAFE WATER NOW!  Levels of lead are so high that children have lead poisoning. It is unsafe for anyone to drink.  Residents, schools, hospitals and businesses are having to buy bottled water. Michigan's governor appointed an emergency manager who switched from buying water from Detroit to using water from the Holloway Resevoir & the Flint River. More chemicals had to be used to treat the water. This led to cancer causing by- products & corrosive agents that are destroying the infrastructure and causing the pipes to leach lead. This needs to stop immediately & Flint needs to be switched back to buying safe water from Detroit.

title: BAN TOXIC CHINESE DRYWALL PROVIDE MEDICAL MONITORING,STUDIES HEALTH EFFECTS,INJUNCTIVE EQUITABLE RELIEF PUBLIC AWARENESS
body: After Hurricane Katrina, our Family moved from Louisiana to Florida. We bought a new house and were thrilled to be getting a fresh start. Soon, the entire familyxs health, and our housexs appliances, air conditioning unit, and wiring all began failing. It was a bizarre nightmare.What we learned later was that our walls were literally made from poison. We brought in a forensic toxic specialist. Our drywall had been shipped in from China and was made with toxins hydra sulfide, carbon dioxide, disulfide, sulfur, methane   Our builder had gone out of business insurance had a pollution exclusion, and our mortgage company wouldn't assist w payments so I lost the home to the bank it was condemned . Home had to be gutted to the studs  Clickhttps://www.change.org/p/stop-toxic-chinese-drywall

title: Re-name Columbus Day as Indigenous People's Day
body: Changing the name from Columbus Day to Indigenous Peoples' Day will provide the opportunity to recognize and celebrate each other's strengths, cultures, and history. We propose to change the name of this holiday to honor the memories and ancestors of his victims and survivors. Let Oklahoma join other states like Alaska, Hawaii, Oregon, and South Dakota in making this change! This terrible man wrote in his journal about how easily he could conquer and govern the native peoples of the New World. He maimed them, murdered them, and enslaved them. He used girls as young as 9 &10 years old as sex slaves. No form of slavery or genocide should be accepted or promoted by our government. It is time to dispel the illusions of the past and progress towards a more educated future.

title: Ban ALL forms of nonconsensual genital mutilation
body: Genital mutilation is something that should never be forced upon anyone. While female genital mutilation is banned in the US, male circumcision is highly prevalent. The procedure has very few positive effects, and also has many negative effects as many sensitive nerve endings are removed without the child's consent.Most benefits of circumcision can be gained also by using a condom and having good hygiene.If a boy vitally needs the procedure done medically or has reached an age where he can understand the surgery, its pros and its cons to opt to be circumcised, only then it should still be allowed for medical purposes only. (In the way the law currently works for women: law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/18/116)Women are already safe from this horror. His body, his choice.Thank you.

Instead, Pakistan has been playing double standards by providing safe houses to those who are responsible for the death of thousands Afghans and Americans! :(  Therefore, it is time for the U.S.A to STOP providing Pakistan with this generosity assistance and make Pakistan accountable for the funds that PAKISTAN ALREADY RECEIVED TO DATE!!

title: institute a National Firearm Operator's License with required training and insurance.

title: Allocate funding to the States for the construction of long-term psychiatric inpatient care for the seriously ill.
body: One of the common denominators in mass shootings is clearly mental illness.  In most cases, there were signs and failure to treat the known mental illnesses of the shooters. We as healthcare providers and allies of the mentally ill choose to highlight the failure of the healthcare system to supply even basic care to our citizens. Deinstitutionalization and deficiencies in mental health care treatment have created a monumental mental health care crisis. Our lack of adequate care for those suffering from addiction has wasted unbelievable potential, caused crime, and destroyed valuable lives. We must have enough inpatient beds for this underserved patient population. We do not treat patients with cancer by abandoning them to the streets and no support system. Let us have the same diligence.
issues: c(25, 311, 316) c("Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Urge Congress to pass legislation that fines gun manufacturers proportional to the use of their guns in violent crimes.
body: Congress should (1) fine each gun manufacturer proportional to the use of its guns by violent criminals and (2) allocate the resulting revenue to provide for social services including mental health, education, and rehabilitation services.This law would not infringe the Second Amendment right of gun owners.This law would be enforceable as the number of gun manufacturers is small.This law would help provide for services that federal, state, and local governments fund insufficiently.This law would target the guns most often used by criminals - unlike the Federal Fire Arms and Ammunitions Excise Tax.This law would provide an incentive to gun manufacturers to provide more oversight to the buying and selling of firearms.
issues: c(321, 331, 311) c("Criminal Justice Reform", "Gun Violence", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Give reparations to the African American community for slave labor and persecution.
body: The Africans that were enslaved at the hands of the United States of America have never received reparations for slavery. Many different ethnicities have been compensated for the atrocities committed against them, yet the African American community has never received any compensation for as long as we have been in this country. Native Americans have received compensation. In fact, thousands of American Indians are now in line to receive part of a $3.4 billion settlement with the federal government. Also , Germany has paid x primarily to Jewish survivors x some $89 billion in compensation overall for Nazi crimes. I believe that it is the U.S governments duty to repay the debt they owe to African Americans for slave labor, and persecution of  Africans during the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: ESTABLISH AN INDEPENDENT TEAM TO INVESTIGATE THE BOMBING OF THE MSF/DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS HOSPITAL IN KUNDUZ
body: Whereas, on October 3, 2015, a US airstrike killed 19 (12 staff and 7 patients, including 3 children and wounded at least 37 at a Doctors Without Borders/Mxdecins Sans Frontixres (MSF) hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan; and whereasMSF repeatedly provided the GPS coordinates of the compound and its buildings as recently as September 29; and, whereasThis hospital is an independent, neutral and impartial trauma center whose work cannot be duplicated in this locale; therefore be it RESOLVED, that the U.S. Government appoint an independent entity to provide a transparent investigation of this attack; and be it furtherRESOLVED, that the detailed results of this investigation be made available to MSF and to the public as soon as possible.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Promote gender equality in employment by empowering the EEOC with stronger enforcement authority.
body: In the United States, sex discrimination is a grave issue that is overlooked by the EEOC. Only 39% of women hold managerial positions, while also being paid less. Women on average make 77% of a man's salary. Many large corporations discriminate based on sex when allocating positions by placing women in pink-collar work as opposed to men who are given white-collar work.We propose that the EEOC should  mandate businesses to create analysis forms that equally compare job ability for each employee during the hiring process and performance for advancement opportunities. The EEOC will also require a diversified hiring/promotion board in order to guarantee diversification for job placement within the corporation.The EEOC will penalize businesses who do not comply with the requirements.
issues: c(336, 311) c("Government & Regulatory Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Launch a federal investigation into the relationship between school shootings and psychiatric drugs.
body: Whereas at least 35 recent school shootings and/or school-related acts of violence were committed by those taking or withdrawing from psychiatric drugs resulting in 169 wounded and 79 killed;Whereas there are 25 non school-related acts of violence committed by individuals taking or withdrawing from psychiatric drugs resulting in 251 dead and 134 wounded;Whereas between 2004 and 2012, there have been over 14,773 reports to the U.S. FDAxs MedWatch system on psychiatric drugs causing violent side effects including: 1,531 cases of homicidal ideation/homicide, 3,287 cases of mania & 8,219 cases of aggression;We the people of the United States demand a formal and public investigation into the relationship between the FDA, the Pharmaceutical industry, psychiatric drugs and treatment.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: I propose that President Obama, as a former Nobel Peace Prize winner, nominate Brandon with Humans of New York.
body: The Humans of New York page on Facebook might seem to many as just another Facebook page.  As President Obama knows, this page is far more reaching than that. Brandon shows us a picture of a person and then, sometimes in just a paragraph, tells us more than we could imagine. From the actual people of New York to the people of Pakistan, Iraq and now the current refugee crisis, we readers experience more than any Facebook page should make us feel and understand. Nominations for the Nobel Peace Prize must come from former winners. We ask President Obama to do nomination Brandon and Humans of New York. With most of the focus on social media being in the negative, we now know the amazing positive experience it can be, and is, thanks to Brandon and Humans of New York.
issues: c(301, 18, 311) c("Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Education", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Pardon the Kettle Falls Five
body: On Oct. 2, 2015, three defendants in the Kettle Falls Five case were sentenced to federal prison terms and fines for cultivating as patients under WAxs medical cannabis program. Despite a Congressional restriction on cannabis prosecutions, the DOJ has committed hundreds of thousands of taxpayer dollars to prosecuting and jailing these patients.We ask for immediate orders of commutation and remission of jail time and fines for Rolland Gregg, his wife Michelle Gregg, and his mother Rhonda Firestack-Harvey. We seek complete pardons of their convictions so that they are no longer considered felons. Allow them to return to being the productive members of society they were, before this ordeal began.Find out more information at Americans for Safe Access: http://bit.ly/KFalls5
issues: c(311, 321, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Health Care")

title: to appoint a special prosecutor to investigate the GOPs deliberate misuse of federal monies to attack Planned Parenthood
body: According to the Huffington Post, Rep. Jason Caffetz (R-UT), who spearheaded the House GOP committee that investigated Planned Parenthood, admitted on Thursday, 10/08/2015, that there was no indication that the womensx health organization had misused its federal funding. By admitting to this literal witch hunt, he admitted that the entire reasoning put forth for the necessity of this committee was false. What's more, The Hill reported on 10/17/2015 that the GOP was in possession of the unedited versions of the Planned Parenthood tapes, but refused to share them even with their colleagues, suggesting further fraudulent behavior on the part of the House GOP committee. Only a special prosecutor can realistically find the unspun truth behind the GOP's actions. We taxpayers are owed the truth.
issues: c(336, 25, 311) c("Government & Regulatory Reform", "Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: recognize Hawai'i as an independent nation and allow self determination for our people and our lands.
body: This petition is a follow up of the Kx'x petitions that our ancestors signed on September 11, 1897.The Kx'x Petitions, also known as the Anti-Annexation Petitions were a collection of over 38,000 signatures (90%of Hawaiian Nationals) who were opposed to the Annexation of Hawaixi to the United States of America. The signatures  were collected island by island by three hui: the Hui Aloha Aina for Women, the Hui Aloha Aina for Men, and the Hui Kalaiaina. These three groups went island to island, holding mass town meetings about annexation and obtaining signatures from those who opposed annexation. The objective of this petition is;- Independence for Hawai`i by ending the prolonged and Illegal U.S. occupation of the Hawaiian Kingdom. Self determination for the people, BY THE PEOPLE.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Publish All FBI, CIA and NYPD-BOSSI Files Relating To The 21st February 1965 Assassination Of Malcolm X.
body: In view of your deeply disappointing 2011 decision not to re-open an investigation into the 21st February 1965 assassination of Malcolm X x and in light of your 2009 memoranda on Transparency and Open Government as it relates to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) x we, the undersigned, appeal to your administration to publish, in full and without redaction, all materials and documents compiled by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), the New York Police Departmentxs Bureau of Special Services and Investigations (BOSSI) and any other federal entity relating to the crime. In addition, we call on your administration to declassify all Presidential Daily Briefs (or PDB's) from the Kennedy and Johnson administrations as they relate to Malcolm X.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Make anoxic brain injuries a statistic, opening the doors to research and rehabilitation.
body: Tell the Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions (H.E.L.P.) Committee to instruct the Center for Disease Control (CDC)-USA to begin surveillance and documentation of anoxic encephalopathy, more commonly known as hypoxic-anoxic injury (HAI) to the brain.An HAI is caused by a partial or total loss of oxygen to the brain. Patients with HAI plead with the H.E.L.P. Committee and the CDC to become statistics. The lack of documentation of anoxic injuries reduces or denies therapeutic opportunities, valuable research, and other medical services to HAI patients. A number of denials for services specifically state the rejection is because the patient is not a TBI.Please sign and tell the Senate H.E.L.P. Committee to instruct the CDC to open the doors to documentation of HAI patients.
issues: c(311, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care")

title: Condemn the killing of innocent Sikh protestors by the Indian Government
body: Today, October 14,2015, the Indian Government launched an attack on peaceful Sikh protestors. The Sikhs were protesting an attack on the holy scripture, Guru Granth Sahib ji. Guru Granth Sahib ji was ripped apart and the pages were thrown on the street. Innocent Sikh civilians gathered together to peacefully protest. The police and the army were called. Excessive force was used. Actual bullets were shot at unarmed protestors. Elderly men and women as well as children were beaten. The crowds were shot at. The protestors were not large in number, yet the army was called in. This is a violation of human rights which shocks the conscience. There is evidence of today's attacks in the form of video, photographs, as well as testimony of those who were present.
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: Investigate Time Warner's network, (CNN), for purposeful public deception regarding the Bernie Sanders campaign.
body: After the Democrat debate aired by CNN on Oct 13, 2015, CNN themselves purposely altered the story, and edited the coverage video afterwards, along with deleting their own public online polls, with what appears to be an intention, to skew the public's perception of who was the actual 'winner' of the debate. Their own poll showed Senator (I) Bernie Sanders clearly ahead of Sec. Hillary Clinton. With over 85% of online pollsters supporting Sen. Sanders, CNN reported, and continues to support the view that Hillary Clinton 'won' the debate. This is a clear deception, and lie to the American public, at a time, when we need the truth regarding our political leaders. It is our belief, that Time Warner, Inc, as a large contributor to the Clinton campaign, is attempting to buy the election!

title: End U.S. Financial Support of International Law Violations, Oppression, and Brutality by the Israeli Government
body: This petition seeks to end U.S. support of Israelxs illegal occupation of Palestinian territories through the use of U.S. tax dollars that support and fund Israelxs hostile takeover, while also supporting its oppression and violent brutality against the Palestinians. In addition to our concern for the lives and well-being of the Palestinians, U.S. support of illegal occupation and brutality of the Palestinians continues to put American lives at risk, and is now being acknowledged by many Israelis as putting their lives in danger due to the illegal occupation and their governmentxs policies that reinforce inhumane treatment of the Palestinians. With our U.S. tax dollars supporting the violation of international law, oppression, and brutality, we are as much to blame as the perpetrators.

title: We the American People Demand President Obama facilitate Secret Service protection to Mr. Donald J. Trump immediately!
body: Mr. Donald J. Trump is leading the 2016 Republican candidates for President of the United States.  He has had many death threats, moreover has a 100 Million dollar bounty on his head.  This is serious and needs to be addressed by the Obama Administration.  All we are asking for is the same consideration be given, that then Senator Obama received when he was running for President in 2008.  If something happens to Mr. Trump due to lack of action from the current Administration the American people will hold President Obama personally responsible.  A Secret Service detail must be granted!It's time to put politics aside, a mans life is at stake.  Mr. Trump is a true patriot to Make America Great Again!  Obama don't make him a mortar!  Show the American people some leadership!

title: Remove Essure x Contraception from all usage!
body: We as women are requesting your help to have our stories heard as this is a national issue of severe complications from the Essure permanent female sterilization coils manufactured by Bayer Health. Following the FDA hearing of 9/24/2015, it is clear that the Essure coils were not subjected to sufficient safety testing at the time of its approval using the FDAxs PMA process. Specifically, the FDA and Bayer did not sufficiently consider the fact that these coils are made using a Nickel alloy and that a substantial number of people in the United States have allergic and hyperimmune reactions to Nickel. We need this out of reach and no longer used for good. Support our rights and our bodies as we fight. We stay in pain physically, mentally, and emotionally. We are victims!

title: SUPPORT TO H.R 3744  VENEZUELAN REFUGEE ASSISTANCE ACT.
body: We petition the Obama Administration to:Support the approval of the project of law (H.R. 3744- Venezuelan Refugee Assistance Act), which will provide immigration assistance to the Venezuelan community which has emigrated to the United States fleeing from an anti-democratic and anti-American regime, For these reasons, under the Obama Administration, Venezuelan officials have been sanctioned for VIOLATING THE CIVIL AND HUMAN RIGHTS of Venezuelan citizens. Currently, many Venezuelans are losing their legal status and are in danger of being deported to Venezuela, where they have fled from with the purpose of seeking freedom, safety, and justice, as well as the guarantee of their lives; rights which have been denied to them in their country.

title: Admonish OCR for its Arbitrary Action and Request that it Withdraw its Directive for Illinois School District 211
body: We hereby petition against the federal directive, issued by OCR, requesting Illinois School District 211 to give transgender students unrestricted access to locker rooms for the gender they identify with.We believe administrators of D211 have done their uttermost to accommodate the special needs of the transgender students, We are here to show our full and unreserved support for the decision of D211. We believe that OCR directives have gravely violated the rights of the large majority of students. It not only creates the opportunity for sex crimes but also invades the rights to privacy of all students. If OCR has its way, it will set a pernicious precedent that will adversely affects the lives of most students in our schools throughout the country. OCR must withdraw its decision.
issues: c(311, 18, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Provide Bernie Sanders Secret Service protection immediately as a leading Democratic presidential candidate & Senator.
body: Bernie Sanders is a sitting U. S. Senator and a leading candidate in the presidential campaign of 2016. Recent disturbances at Bernie Sanders campaign events have shown his vulnerability with regard to potentially violent confrontations with disturbed people. In 2007, at a similar stage in that campaign, Barack Obama was given Secret Service protection by George W. Bush for exactly this reason, and he had not even experienced such disturbances yet, nor was Obama attracting crowds of over 25,000 regularly, as Senator Sanders is. This situation must not be allowed to continue a moment longer. Bernie Sanders must have immediate Secret Service protection, just as the other leading candidate does.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: EMERGENCY :Please STOP the bear hunt that the FWC  is planning in Florida to start October 24.
body: Dear President Obama, We the people of Florida beseech you to intervene and stop the atrocity that is about to happen to the Florida  Black Bear Oct 24 Bears were removed from the endangered species list as recently as 2012,  there is a study currently in progress to determine actual numbers. At all of the meetings and opportunities for public comment, consistently over 75% of the people have been against a hunt. FWC came up with a random number, 320 bears to be "harvested", yet they have sold over 2,500 licenses, and continue. For two DAYS the hunt is unlimited. Then they plan to let the hunters know when the quota has been met by CELL phone and e-mail. In the woods. (possibly no reception or battery)A hunt would be reckless and irresponsible, and could decimate the species.

title: Support the democratic process and civil principle of transition of power in Iraqi Kurdistan, which is in crisis now.
body: We are writing to you in regard to the recent political and legal crisis in Iraqi Kurdistan (Northern Iraq). On October 12, 2015, the security forces of KDP known as the Kurdistan Democratic Party prevented the Speaker of Parliament, Yusef Muhammad, from returning to the capital city of Erbil (Hawler) in order to carry out his legislative duties. This was implemented by the order of the top political officials of KDP as a retaliation and escalation of the deadlock in the negotiation process by the Kurdish political parties; regarding the illegal extension of Masoud Barzanixs term as president of the Kurdistan region. Barzanixs legal term ended on August 19, 2015, after 10 years as president of KRG (Kurdistan Regional Government).

title: Recognise Ashura as a Federal Holiday
body: Ashura is the tenth day of Muharram, the first Month of the Muslim calendar, and is significant for the brutal murder of Hussain Ibne Ali (PBUH), the dearest grandson of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), as well as 72 of his family members and friends by the political tyrant of the era, Yazid ibne Muawiya. This day of inexplicable grief occurred in Karbala, Iraq in 680 AD.Given the timeless nature of his story, it is important that all of us reflect and realize the importance of his struggle. As a result, we urge that the day of Ashura be added to the list of Muslim holidays observed as an official public holiday.Declaring Ashura as a public holiday could strengthen the ability of the US to project itself, as its founding fathers wanted, as a beacon of justice and freedom to the entire world
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: Enforce international anti-slavery laws to free 35 million slaves around the world.
body: Currently, there are 35 million slaves in the world; equivalent to the 2013 population of Canada. Only 0.1% of them are helped annually. No country is free from the torment of slavery, yet only 5,500 traffickers are convicted yearly. Since 2000, the US has established laws against trafficking in person however it is still a $150 billion industry - anti题_slavery programs are only funded by 0.2% of that.These figures are simply astounding. Little is being done for a problem so grave. Hence, youths in Hong Kong, Singapore and Kuala Lumpur have come together to eradicate modern 题_day slavery through a 100% student-led movement. The 24 Hour Race aims to bring justice to the oppressed and reach out to more people who are passionate about the cause and are looking for a way to make a difference

The UN found Human Rights violations. We feel poorly represented by appointees. Our health and schools were jeopardized, questionable contracts entered into and sound contracts broken. title: Send Immediate Aid and Assistance to Combat Indonesia's Fire Crisis
body: Forest fires in Sumatra and Kalimantan have caused air pollution indices to reach twelve times the level deemed hazardous. People are fainting in the streets because of poisonous carbon monoxide levels. Children are dying. Citizens cannot afford masks which can cost 20% of their monthly salary. Fires also threaten to wipe out endangered species and their biodiverse habitats. This is an ecological, climatic, and humanitarian crisis of global proportions. Your recent meeting with President Widodo was promising but more is needed. We implore you to 1) encourage Indonesia to accept help from neighboring countries, 2) send fire-fighting aircraft and ground crews, 3) provide on-site medical assistance, 4) supply fire-fighting equipment and 5) guide Indonesia in improving evacuation procedures.
issues: c(296, 311) c("Energy & Environment", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Eliminate the requirement of home-based cloth menstrual pad makers to pay the exorbitant FDA fee to sell products.
body: Home-based cloth menstrual pad makers are required to pay an  exorbitant fee in excess of several thousand dollars each year to make, sell or even donate cloth pads. These pads are made from material available in local craft stores. They are not laden with chemicals like disposable pads.Currently, cloth menstrual pads are classified as a medical device used in the treatment of a disease. Menstruation is NOT a disease. It is a normal, biological function of the body. To call menstruation a disease that requires treatment would be the same as saying urination or dedication is a disease in need of treatment. Many of the pad makers are home-based women who see around their daily responsibilities and sell on a small scale, making it impossible to make a profit and pay the fee.
issues: c(316, 311) c("Economy & Jobs", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: exempt reusable feminine products from FDA fee so that small businesses can remain open. Keep FDA out of your panties!
body: The FDA has decided that reusable menstrual pads are Class I Medical Devices. That means those who make them must pay an annual fee of 3-4 THOUSAND DOLLARS to continue doing so. Not only must these ladies armed with sewing machines pay taxes on their income, they must pay a fealty charge to the FDA to continue making a living this way. FDA Regulation #884.5435 states that a reusable menstrual pad maker must be xFDA compliantx x which means they must pay a yearly registration fee of $3,646 to remain in business for 2015. Shutting down many small U.S. companies.These products are non-toxic, unlike the bleached white, chemical-laden store-bought varieties and are not clogging up landfills. This is an example of overreach that supports the interests of Big Business.
issues: c(296, 311) c("Energy & Environment", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Publically ask Postmaster General & Congress to create a new  fundraising stamp called Stamp Out PTSD to Honor Veterans
body: In July of this year, 56 members of Congress wrote the US Postmaster a letter asking her to support a new fundraising stamp to help Veterans. The postal service wrote back declining to take action, saying they were afraid a new stamp would hurt sales on existing semi-postals. The USPS should be a part of a solution to help our nation's heroes with PTSD. I don't believe they know how much public support there is for this project & that is why I am requesting your help.In addition to Congress, many cities & towns across our great land have added their consent thru written resolutions & proclamations. Governors & Mayors have written letters of support & thousands of Americans have added their names to Garland Denny's petition at www.veteranspetition.com
issues: c(311, 336, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Veterans & Military")

title: make February National SUDC Awareness Month & February 8th National SUDC Awareness Day.
body: There is no federal recognition, funding or support for Sudden Unexplained Death in Childhood. SUDC affects 1.5 of every 100,000 children*, just .8 away from the mortality rate of America's #1 killer of children by disease, Pediatric Cancer (2.3 of every 100,000**) yet no one, including most doctors giving the diagnosis, have even heard of it. Though there are awareness months and funds for research for SIDS parents and for families struggling with other types of diagnosis, SUDC parents are left without our children, peer or community support or research for cause. Please give us space on the calendar, in the budget, and in the hearts of our country. *http://www.sudc.org/Medical-Forensic-Info/SUDC-Statistics**www.acco.org/about-childhood-cancer/diagnosis/childhood-cancer-statistics
issues: c(18, 316, 311) c("Education", "Economy & Jobs", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Pass Legislation to cover all of infertility treatments under the Affordable Healthcare Act
body: Currently many states do not cover or cover very minimally for infertility.This is a problem for many couples wanting a family but need to have out of pocket expenses to cover treatments. The affordable healthcare act should cover these expenses to give couples and individuals the opportunity to have children.The cost for intrauterine insemination(IUI) costs a patient several thousand dollars for treatment.In vitro Fertilization average cost is $12,000. This makes having families difficult for couples and individuals suffering from infertility.Many MRKH women, women who had their uterus removed should be able to have a family.Legislation needs to be passed to have health insurance cover costs.If birth control and abortions are covered then infertility treatments should be too.
issues: c(316, 25, 311) c("Economy & Jobs", "Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Make Krabbe Disease Testing a Requirement Among Current Mandatory Newborn Testing.
body: Among the mandatory testing for newborns should be the Krabbe disease, also known as globoid cell leukodystrophy.  The disease is inherited and attacks the protective coating of the nerve cells in the brain and throughout the nervous system.  This disease is most common in young children around 6 months old, and most will die at or before age 2.  Krabbe disease can develop in older children, as well as adults.  Approximately 1 in 100,000 people in the U.S. suffer from this disease.  Testing costs approximately 6-7 dollars per test, which is minimal considering medical care for someone with Krabbe disease can escalate into the millions of dollars.  While there is no cure, stem cell transplants have a 90% rate of treatment success in infants if it is performed before the onset of symptoms.
issues: c(311, 316, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Health Care")

title: Include in common core curriculum: DIVERSITY IS A CODE WORD FOR WHITE GENOCIDE
body: Nobody is saying that Africa needs diversity.Nobody is saying that Asia needs diversity.They are already 100% diverse.People are only telling White children in White countries that they need diversity.White Countries will be 100% diverse when there are no White people left.Diversity is a code word for White Genocide.ALL White countries and ONLY White countries are being flooded with third world non-whites, and Whites are forced by law to integrate with them so as to xassimilate,x i.e. intermarry and be blended out of existence.Those who support this genocide of Whites say theyxre anti-racist. What they are is anti-white.Anti-racist is a code word for anti-white.goo.gl/zdUqffgoo.gl/f0hiwSgoo.gl/rG0KAagoo.gl/IUenlgoo.gl/cMsbsj
