title: Reinstate South Carolina Deputy Ben Fields.
body: Ben Fields was wrongfully terminated for removing a disruptive, aggressive student from a South Carolina classroom. The student was asked to leave peacefully several times by multiple Spring Valley high school employees and disregarded their request, she was also warned she would be forcefully removed but did not heed deupty Fields warning. Upon removing her she became combative and resisted arrest. The true nature of his actions have been twisted by the Media and unfortunately Sheriff Leon Lott did not stand up for his officer. By Deputy Fields being fired we are showing the youth of America that disrespecting authority is appropriate and making officers nation wide scared to due their duties due to media backlash. Ben Fields needs to be reinstated immediately.
issues: c(311, 321, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Education")

title: create an unconditionalVeteran medical gold card where our veterans can go wherever they wish for medical care .
body: If this country can spend billions for weapons and defense, recruiting new troops and training them , asking them to pay the ultimate sacrifice if needed , then we can take care of our veterans finally without walls and conditions - in the best way possible with a gold medical card .If we want a volunteer military - we need to take care of our vets when they come home . More than 22 per day commit suicide . That is 8030 per year . We need to show our vets they actually DO matter .
issues: c(311, 25, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care", "Veterans & Military")

title: Reject presidential candidate Bob Whitaker's demand for tax audits of institutions that promote DIVERSITY!
body: Diversity is NOT a code word for "white genocide"!Diversity does NOT mean "chasing down white people"!Anti-racist is NOT a "code word" for "anti-white"!But it IS true that "White self-hatred is SICK"!What is more self-hating than fearing new people coming into our country and marrying our children? How little confidence can we have in ourselves and our familes to fear something so natural?If Mr. Bob Whitaker had a generous heart and a mind for the future, he would appreciate the public funding of groups that promote multiculturalism and diversity, not try to end that funding.It's from diversity that our future American identity and unity will emerge. We march into the future under the banner "Love conquers all," NOT under the slogan "Diversity is a code word for White Genocide"!
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Pressure the NFL to remove the SuperBowl from Houston in February 2017 due to lack of Equal Rights Ordinance
body: Due to the over reach of the Texas State Legislature, blatant lies of members of the Houston community and recent defeat of the Equal Rights Ordinance on the ballot election of November 3, 2015, we ask that the NFL rescind the awarding of the Superbowl to Houston, Texas for 2017.  The lack of protections for all Houstonians and visitors to the city warrant that the NFL find a more suitable, inclusive host for the 2017 Superbowl.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Declare October 10th National ChooseKIND day
body: Support our youth by telling government to declare October 10th National ChooseKIND Day.Kindness is free.  Kindness is contagious.  Kindness is accessible to everyone.  We all have the power to choose kindness every day in everything we do.Students around the world are reading the young-adult book Wonder by R.J. Palacio and embracing it's message to "Choose Kind." October 10th is the birthday of the book's main character.  Since it's publication in 2012, there has been a grassroots movement on social media to make that a day to celebrate random acts of kindness.Lead by example and show our youth government in action. Sign and share this petition. We need 100,000 signatures by December 7th to keep the kindness petition moving forward.
issues: c(311, 18, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Make preventing genocide in Burundi an urgent diplomatic priority.
body: Horrifically, Burundi is on the brink of genocide.US Ambassador to the UN Samantha Power wrote on 11/5: "We are deeply concerned by President Nkurunzizaxs...pledge to use violent methods to have security forces search homes for weapons and opposition figures within five days...Whether in Kirundi or English, this language is terrifying...'you have to pulverize, you have to exterminatexthese people are only good for dying.'"Burundi is beautiful. Conflict there is not a reality; it is a fate that the country and international community can change. We request that President Obama make the moral choice: condemn recent events, support Ambassador Power, and make preventing genocide an urgent diplomatic priority.We know where this goes. Rwanda is next door. Will we let another 1994 happen?
issues: c(24, 311) c("Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Get the University of Missouri Tigers OUT of the SEC.
body: Because the Southeastern Conference is about more than football, it is about culture.Because the University of Missouri has not and will never assimilate into the rich and vibrant culture of the SEC, and instead makes a mockery of said culture through its aberrant and divisive political grandstanding in the case involving President Wolfe.We hereby petition President Obama to kick Mizzou OUT of the SEC to preserve the time honored culture and tradition of the Southeastern Conference.Resolved: This, the 9th day of November, 2015 Anno Domini
issues: c(296, 301, 311) c("Energy & Environment", "Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: put a female on the $20 bill instead of the $10 bill. Change Andrew Jackson instead of Alexander Hamilton.
body: Instead of having a female on the 10 dollar bill, have the female figure selected on the 20 dollar bill. Alexander Hamilton, as the first Secretary of the Treasury and the founder of the National Bank, belongs on a dollar bill more so than Andrew Jackson, who was against paper money in general- he felt that only gold and silver coins should be American currency. Despite Jackson's great achievements as the seventh President of the United States, the 20 dollar bill is a more suitable choice for the honorable recognition of women earning the right to vote. Alexander Hamilton should remain the face of the 10 dollar bill. This would honor both Hamilton's achievements for the American economy and women's great achievements throughout American history.
issues: c(316, 311) c("Economy & Jobs", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Declare stillbirth a national health crisis and develop guidelines to advocate better screening.
body: Each year, nearly 26,000 babies are born stillbirth.  Most of these babies are of a viable gestational age.  Umbilical cord accidents account for 5-30% of all stillbirths, but because of lack of funding, accurate statistics vary greatly.  Because of this, the cause and preventative measures are not fully understood.  What we do know, however, is the number of stillbirths continue to increase each year in this country.  We encourage the federal government to declare stillbirths a national health crisis, provide proper funding to study cord issues, create guidelines for OB doctors to implement additional screening for high risk pregnancies, and abandon the 39 week delivery policy that reduces preterm birth rates, but create the unintended consequences of increases stillbirths.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Remove the words "In God we trust" from U.S. currency and as the official national motto of the United States.
body: We live in a time when more and more citizens hail from diverse religious and also many diverse non-religious backgrounds. It is important to consider the negative aspects of focusing on a single religion and its principals in government business, namely the obvious conflict with the constitutional concept of separation of church and state. Many Americans (in ever growing numbers) indentify as non-religious. The time is now to make the adjustment and change back to the pre 1956 motto of "E Pluribus Unum" or "out of many, one" which truly represents the United States of America without being partial to a single group or religion.By many estimations some 30% of Americans, nearly 100 million of us, do not trust in God. The national motto and our currency need to reflect that.
issues: c(311, 316, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: declare the Transgender Day of Remembrance a national holiday, in recognition of the loss of life to discrimination.
body: Over 20 people have been murdered in the United States this year alone just because they were transgender. Their deaths go largely unreported and unsolved.The homicide rate of transgender people is roughly 1 in 12, as opposed to 4.7 in 100,000 for the general population.Since 1998 the transgender community and our allies have gathered on November 20th to honor the victims of these vicious crimes with the Transgender Day of Remembrance. Last year, one of those victims was a twelve year old girl, beaten to death by her father.It's time for the injustice to stop, it's time for our deaths to be acknowledged, and for this nation to commit to equality and visibility for the transgender community. We have a voice, and we are asking you to hear us.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: impeach Governor Jay Inslee of Washington State for allowing refugees in the state
body: Governor Jay Inslee has openly supported allowing Syrian Refugees in Washington State. This is a major security hole that our enemies can use to get into the states.WA is home to 3 large military installations JBLM, Kitsap Naval Station, McChord Airfield. Our Service Members are not allowed to carry antiquate means of protection while in Uniform and are the biggest target to ISIS.Jay Inslee is putting the public in danger and it will not be tolerated.
issues: c(311, 24, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Mandate paid maternity leave in the US!
body: The U.S. is the only industrialized and developed nation that does not mandate that parents of newborns get paid leave. In the U.S., federal law allows parents to take three unpaid months, and some employers will allow for more, unpaid. But the law does not mandate that companies pay anyone time to spend with their babies x and many people cannot afford to take time off. Among the countries included in international studies, America is the worst country for maternity leave. The U.S. is one of two of the 185 countries or territories in the world surveyed by the United Nationxs International Labor Organization that does not mandate some form of paid maternity leave for its citizens. By contrast, in France, women on maternity leave receive their full salary for 16 weeks.
issues: c(316, 336, 311) c("Economy & Jobs", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Resettle at least 10,000 Syrian refugees in the United States in FY 2016, as he promised on September 10, 2015.
body: "Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free."Those familiar words of the poet Emma Lazarus are engraved at the pedestal of the Statue of Liberty.They represent the promise of the United States of America to be a home to immigrants and refugees from all over the world."Now is not the time for demagoguery and fear mongering. What terrorism is about is trying to instill terror and fear into the hearts of people. And we will not let that happen. We will not be terrorized or live in fear. During these difficult times, we will not succumb to Islamophobia. We will not turn our backs on the refugees who are fleeing Syria and Afghanistan. We will do what we do best and that is be Americans x fighting racism, fighting xenophobia, fighting fear." - Senator Sanders
issues: c(24, 311, 29) c("Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Immigration")

title: Classify the Ku Klux Klan as a Domestic Terrorist Group
body: President Obama,Classify the Ku Klux Klan as a Domestic Terrorist Organization because of its historical and current extremist ideals that have demonstrated countless unprovoked acts of terror and hate fueled violence on minority groups, these kind of repeated atrocities against people of African descent and other non European minority populations and groups should not have to be tolerated any further. We have the right to be safe in the United States of America.
issues: c(336, 311) c("Government & Regulatory Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Get better Prince George's County Public Schools lunch
body: To find a way for Prince George's County Schools to have better food.
issues: c(296, 25, 311) c("Energy & Environment", "Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Recognize Dec. 6 as the official Abolition Day spotlighting final ratification of the 13th Amendment abolishing slavery.
body: December 6, 1865, is perhaps the most significant date in African-American history, marking the ratification of the 13th Amendment, which legally abolished slavery in the United States. In celebration of the 150th anniversary, this year is an ideal opportunity for our government to formally honor this significant date in history by officially recognizing December 6 as Abolition Day.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Adjust the First Amendment to the U.S. Constitution. It was not written to protect paedophiles.
body: Freedom of religion has long been a hallmark of the U.S. constitution. But over the past several decades it has become an Amendment that favors the protection of paedophiles from criminal prosecution. Was this really why the First Amendment was written?Many paedophile Catholic priests have escaped punishment simply because they are clergy members. Muhammad, the founder of Islam, was a paedophile, and so were his companions. And the Qur'an openly permits paedophilia for Muslims. Jehovah's Witness elders have thousands of times allowed paedophiles among their members to go unreported, and allowed continued association with children. And there are more examples.The First Amendment should not be used as a tool for protecting child abusers. Please adjust it, and hold religions accountable.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Investigate the human and civil rights atrocities committed by the State of Utah in regards to adoption/Fathers rights.
body: We the People demand a civil and criminal investigation into human and civil rights atrocities committed by the State of Utah in regards to Fathers rights. The state of Utah has repeatedly violated the Constitutional Rights and Supreme court precedents of Fathers by denying them rights to their own children. The case of Colby Nielsen is the final straw. When a child can be ripped out of the loving arms of a devoted father against his will and consent for the sake of giving the baby to someone else, when the State makes it extremely difficult and wildly unfair for a father to have his natural rights to his own child, when they knowingly violate all federal laws in regards to parents and children, something must be done and the practice stopped. Kaylee needs to be returned to her father!
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: An emergency call to the International Organization to help the victim NGUYxN MAI TRUNG TUxN 15 years old who is jailed
body: Dear Mr PresidentWe are sending to you this Petition regarding the case of NGUYEN MAI TRUNG TUAN, who was born on March 31, 2000, the son of Mr. Nguyen Trung Cang and Mrs. Mai Thi Kim Huong.These two people are citizens from Thanh Hoa province who were trying to protect themselves against the authorities who wanted to steal their properties and land on April 14, 2015.This tragedy happened when the communist authorities of Thanh Hoa province put lots of pressure, menaced them and brutally stole all of the properties of Mr. Nguyen Trung Cang.Recently they have all been imprisoned at Long An City,Viet Nam since April 14, 2015.They were imprisoned along with ten other citizens who were all asking for and fighting for their own justice.The authorities of Thanh Hoa province jailed him.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Petition urging the Congress and President Obama to intervene to stop violations of children's rights in Vietnam.
body: On Nov/24th/2015, Vietnamese authorities have sentenced a 15-year-old boy Nguyen Mai Trung Tuan for 4 years and 6 months for protesting against land grabs.The boy once tried to say "Long live South Vietnam" at a protest in front of his home.Many citizens believed the boy was sent to jail for his political belief. They came to the court to support him, but were blocked at the door by police.Four-years and six-months prison sentence for his political beliefs is a serious violation of the Childrenxs Rights.We, the undersigned, urge the Congress and President Obama to raise his case with Vietnamese Government for the immediate release of Nguyen Mai Trung Tuan.Kind regards.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Puerto Rico demands action Now !Freedom from maritime laws that stifle economic growth, by controlling trade rights.
body: We call on the President to act decisively to help the 3.5 million American citizens living in Puerto Rico, by bypassing congress to restructure or eliminate the Jones Act law (La ley del Cabotaje.) Because the law, monopolizes and restricts our ability to import and negotiate 90% of all items that the Island consumes, augmenting the cost of all products up to 40%, therefore asphyxiating and enslaving our economy for the last 95 years.  In an emergency situation, Puerto Rico will have food for only three days.Puerto Rico faces its worst economic crisis in more than a century due to a $72 billion debt burden that is unpayable, and is causing the largest exodus in the island's history. By acting now U.S. can avoid Puerto Rico becoming the next version of Greece.
issues: c(311, 316, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Remove the PKK (Kurdistan Worker's Party) from the Terrorist Organizations List.
body: PKK (Kurdistan Worker's Party, Kurdish: Partxya Karkerxn Kurdistanx) is fighting ISIS/ISIL/Daesh on ground, along with the YPG fighters in Syria and the Peshmerga from the Kurdistan Autonomous region in Northern Iraq. The PKK have shown extraordinary military effectiveness in defeating ISIS and are protecting the Kurds and surrounding communities from the barbarity of the terrorist group. The PKK, along with other Kurdish fighters, are the only ground force that have demonstrated success in overcoming the ISIS militia.  The US government should be supporting the PKK, not proscribing it.
issues: c(326, 24, 311) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Join presidential candidate Bob Whitaker in approving Donald Trump to head Department of Deportation NOW!
body: Make Donald Trump Secretary of that new Department to do the job NOW!Mr. Trump understands what candidate Bob Whitaker says:ALL White countries and ONLY White countries are being flooded with third world non-Whites, and Whites are forced by law to integrate with them so as to "assimilate," i.e. intermarry and be blended out of existence.Mr. Trump's legal staff will have informed him that that's genocide by UN Convention:"Deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part"Join with candidates Whitaker and Trump to stop anti-Whites flooding third world non-Whites into every White town, neighborhood, school, etc."Diversity" means chasing down the last White person!"Diversity" is a code word for White Genocide!
issues: c(326, 311, 29) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Immigration")

title: BERNIE SANDERS Requires SECRET SERVICE Protection, NOW! BERNIE SANDERS Qualifies for SECRET SERVICE Protection, NOW!
body: BERNIE SANDERS both Requires and Qualifies for SECRET SERVICE Protection, NOW!* Two Republican Candidates for President have already been granted SECRET SERVICE Protection. Polls show NEITHER of these two candidates have as much voter support as BERNIE SANDERS! * One Democratic Candidate for President already has SECRET SERVICE Protection! Polls show that BERNIE SANDERS has received voter support Parity, thus, Qualifies and Requires SECRET SERVICE Protection, NOW!* Barack Obama was granted SECRET SERVICE Protection in MAY 2007! That was the year BEFORE the Election! BERNIE SANDERS is way Overdue for receiving SECRET SERVICE  Protection!* This is about Protecting the People's Right to Choose!* This is about Protecting Our Democracy!BERNIE SANDERS SECRET SERVICE Protection, NOW!
issues: c(311, 321, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Keep Alexander Hamilton as the only face of the $10 note.
body: Alexander Hamilton is one of the greatest and most influential figures in America's history. To remove him or make him share the face of the $10 note on the very  financial system he created for this country is a disgrace.  He helped shape this country from its beginnings. Alexander Hamilton was founding father, chief staff aide to General George Washington, first Secretary of the Treasury, founder of the Federalist Party, an influential interpreters and promoters of the U.S. Constitution, Father of the United States Coast Guard,  Lawyer and much more.This petition is to keep Alexander Hamilton as the only face of the $10 note.
issues: c(311, 316, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Prosecute Joshua Feuerstein for attempting to incite violence.
body: Joshua Feuerstein recently posted a video calling on "Christians" to use violence and terrorism against legal Abortion providers.In the light of recent events., this behavior should not be tolerated in our society.He posted this call to action in a Video which has since been removed (which might also be considered destroying evidence)Details about his crime are detailed here:http://www.patheos.com/blogs/progressivesecularhumanist/2015/11/evangelist-calls-on-christians-to-assassinate-abortion-providers/and this is a mirror if part of his offensive and highly illegal "call to action" which someone else managed to post, in which he clearly calls for violence and terrorism.How can we be seen as a force against terrorism when we allow this kind of terrorist to exist?
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Publicly call for Rahm Emanuel to resign as Mayor of Chicago for the cover up of the shooting of Laquan McDonald.
body: On October 20, 2014, Laquan McDonald was shot and killed by Officer Jason Van Dyke. In the following days, the Police Department, under Rahm Emanuel's direction as Mayor, proceeded to cover up the facts of the case at hand. Over a year later, and only after the courts got involved, the evidence was released to the public. The video evidence is damning and clearly proves that the Police Department, as well as the Mayor, covered up a very serious case of excessive force by an officer.Today, December 1, 2015, Rahm fired Superintendent Garry McCarthy. This is not enough. Rahm knew the facts of the case and assisted in preventing release of evidence at an opportune time when his re-election was at hand.Rahm Emanuel should resign as Mayor of Chicago for violating the public's trust.
issues: c(311, 321, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Simeon Booker for courageous journalism during the civil rights movement.
body: Congressman Tim Ryan and Senators Sherrod Brown and Rob Portman have urged President Obama to award African-American journalist Simeon Booker the Presidential Medal of Freedom x the highest civilian honor in the U.S. x for his pioneering achievements in journalism and his work to advance the civil rights movement.Notable historical moments:1955: his coverage of the Emmett Till murder and trial turned a common occurrence in the Deep South into a national tragedy that united the African American community and advanced the civil rights movement.1961: rode with the Freedom Riders through the Deep South on public busses. When they were firebombed and beaten by the Ku Klux Klan in Alabama, Booker called Attorney General Robert Kennedy to save the Riders from the angry white mobs.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: LIST ERDOGANxS TURKEY AS STATE SPONSOR OF TERRORISM; VOID U.S. ALLIANCE WITH TURKEY
body: Following Turkeyxs downing of a Russian jet striking the Islamic State (IS), it is undeniable that Pres. Recep Tayyip Erdogan supports jihad terrorism in Syria.  IS exports oil via Turkey and terrorists of IS, al-Qaeda, and other jihad groups transit the border.This builds upon a pattern of Ankaraxs support for terrorists in other countries: Russia (Chechnya), China (Xinjiang), Israel/Gaza (Hamas), Yugoslavia (Bosnia), Serbia (Kosovo), Georgia (Pankisi), Egypt (Muslim Brotherhood); aggression against neighbors (invasion and occupation of Cyprus, violation of Greecexs airspace, blockade of Armenia); and denial of genocides against Christian Armenians, Greeks, and Assyrians.Turkey should be listed as a State Sponsor of Terrorism. The U.S. alliance with Turkey under NATO should be voided
issues: c(326, 24, 311) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Amend the selective service to include women age 18 to 25 if the DoD allows women to serve in front line combat units.
body: Men are able to serve in any military occupational specialty in our armed forces if they meet predetermined, nongender specific, prerequisites.While women have traditionally been barred from front line combat unit service (i.e. Infantry, armor, artillery, special operations, and others) specifically due to their gender, the Secretary of Defense in Dec 2015 announced that those occupational exceptions would be lifted. All American men age 18 to 25 are required to register for the selective service. If women are now allowed to serve in all military occupational specialties without limit, then they should also be subject to the same civic requirements as men.  Therefore all age appropriate women should be required to register for the selective service as well.
issues: c(326, 351, 311) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Veterans & Military", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: cut all ties with Najib Razak, prime minister of Malaysia in light of the tabling and passing of the NSC Bill.
body: Najib Razak, current prime minister of Malaysia, who was never voted by the people, has now rushed the National Security Council Bill through Parliament when other more pressing matters of concern to the people's welfare was ignored.This Bill gives him dictatorial powers over the people and even the constitutional rulers, the Sultans and Rajas of Malaysia as well as the governers of certain states.He has the power to declare a state of emergency anywhere after which the military will have the right to search, arrest and even kill any civilian without the need for accountability.This bill is a desperate attempt to remain in power as investigations into numerous acts of corruption are being carried out in countries worldwide while those in Malaysia are being silenced.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Cyclists are dying in Puerto Rico. We call on PR government for safer and better cycling infrastructure/more awareness.
body: Too many cyclists have been injured on our streets or are mourning the death of a loved one due to poor cycling infrastructure, ignorance of the law and distracted, drunk or negligent motorists. Protecting all people who ride bikes, walk, run, and work on P.R's streets is vital to making our community a better place to live. To the Governor and Members of the Legislature and Senate in PR we, the undersigned, say that cycling is a legitimate recreational and practical use of public roads with demonstrated benefits to the community. We are calling for urgent action to accelerate their plans, and to be clear about their intentions for cycle safety. Cyclists are losing their lives at the expense of slow progress on cycle safety. We are calling for an urgent action from the government.
issues: c(316, 311, 346) c("Economy & Jobs", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Transportation & Infrastructure")

title: Remove the nonprofit status of the National Rifle Association for enabling terrorism, both Foreign and Domestic
body: The National Rifle Association is enabling both foreign and domestic terrorism by its unreasonable opposition to any and all gun laws, including refusing to consider putting known terrorists on the background check list. Too much of Congress is in thrall to the NRA, and they must lose their non-profit status. Any monies raised should be allocated to relief of people wounded in domestic terrorist incidents.
issues: c(311, 331, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Gun Violence", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Stop Letting the USWNT's Games be Played on Artificial Turf!
body: "It's not the same game." Shannon Boxx."It plays totally different. You have to scoop [the ball] instead of chip. Your touch is different; the way you dribble is different." Megan Rapinoe "The bounce is never consistent, how it's going to skip. It takes away my ability to read the ball. I'm not as confident playing on turf." Hope Solo "I like to defend and tackle and slide-tackle. You're hesitant on turf. I play a bit different.  You walk away with scrapes and burns. It's just not fun." Carli Lloyd"You have to reconsider doing something for fear of injuring yourself." Abby Wambach.These are a few of the many quotes USWNT players have said in regards to their games being played on artificial turf. Please sign the petition to ask FIFA to stop letting the USWNT play on fake grass.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: To recognize Donald Trump Statements about Muslims and Islam as a hate speech.
body: It has been widely reported that Donald Trump called a ban for all muslims entering in United States of America (http://www.nytimes.com/politics/first-draft/2015/12/07/donald-trump-calls-for-banning-muslims-from-entering-u-s/?hp&action=click&pgtype=Homepage&clickSource=story-heading&module=a-lede-package-region&region=top-news&WT.nav=top-news&_r=0)This statement is unconstitutional. Even though Mr. Trump has the right to free speech, this is a hate speech that has no place in America. United We Stand and Divided We Fall.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Block Donald Trump from running for presidency.
body: The signatories believe that Donald Trump should not be allowed to run for president in 2016, as he has violated and continues to violate the Constitution.
issues: c(336, 326, 311) c("Government & Regulatory Reform", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: To remove and disbar justice Scalia from the panel of the Supreme Court for racial animus and conflict of interest.
body: Quoted by Supreme court justice Antonin Scalia"xIt does not benefit African-Americans to x to get them into the University of Texas where they do not do well, as opposed to having them go to a less-advanced school, a less x a slower-track school where they do well.xHe also voted to alter provision VII of the 1964 "Voting rights act" to allow states with a history of racial bias and unfairness to make changes to election laws without oversight from the justice department. This has led to the disenfranchisement of millions of rightful voters.He is unfit for making decisions on constitutional law and does not have the right to serve as a justice on the panel of the Supreme Court.This petition is to have him disbarred from practice, and removed from the seat of the Supreme court.
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: nominate Brandon Stanton, creator of HumansofNewYork.com, for the Nobel Peace Prize.
body: Brandon Stanton created Humans of New York to give the world a glimpse into the lives of everyday New Yorkers, but his website at humansofnewyork.com, book, and facebook presence do so much more.  Mr Stanton's photographs are accompanied by a quotation from his subjects.  But they are so much more- the community he has created is one of peace and understanding that transcends borders.  The crowdfunding he has inspired has helped disadvantaged schools, raised money for struggling families, and, most importantly, given hope to the thousands of people who see his posts that people in this world can and will come together for the common good and to share love with one another.  He has built something truly remarkable from photographs and the stories of the people he captures.
issues: c(311, 301) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Innovation: Arts & Technology")

title: Stop the mandate of electronic log books and speed limiters in Commercial Motor Vehicle
body: I don't not believe that federal government should be able to mandate electric log books and speed limiters in Commercial Motor Vehicles. Myself being in the livestock hauling industry I cannot control traffic backups and bad road conditions. I will not allow a computer to tell me to stop if I cannot reach my destination in the time allowed by the Hours of Service regulations. Further more I will not stop if my arrival time home is 2 to 3 hours past the HOS regulations. I run a paper log and enjoy a relatively easy day and more home time than I would with an electric log. I plan my trip every day the best I can, but sometimes unforseen circumstances  mess them up and I need my paper log to change a few things to continue to do my job the best I can. All above applies to speed limiters
issues: c(311, 316, 346) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Transportation & Infrastructure")

title: To recognise the Russian state power as an international terrorist organisation.
body: Terrorism, wars, economic crisis, mass emigration, famine, terror and chaos in the world will gradually cease, if we recognise the Russian state power as the international terrorist organisation.Evil will decrease for humanity as a whole and it will become possible to improve the state of our planet and ensure the normal human existence for many peoples of the world.
issues: c(311, 321, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Include a federal autism mandate to cover ABA therapy for all children with autism, regardless of insurance or location
body: Our son is covered through a self-insurance plan so although we live in a state with a mandated autism coverage (including ABA therapy), our insurance company is not mandated to cover it. Federal/state employees and those on Medicaid are eligible for the mandate, however most families that are covered through their employer are not. Many are not poor enough for Medicaid but also not rich enough to afford to pay for out of pocket therapies that can run up to $80,000 per year. The MD waiver system for Medicaid has a waiting list of over 3000 families, children will wait for years for coverage. It has been established that ABA therapy is essential for all children with autism, so I implore each of you  to research the effectiveness of ABA and sign this petition.
issues: c(311, 18, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Health Care")

title: raise the case with Ukrainian authorities for a fast and lawfulness justice for Sergey Lobza
body: In 2010 Ukrainian authorities have accused Sergey Lobza of committing a serious crime, but Mr.Lobza hasnxt got justice in the criminal case so far.During the proceedings three times the Court ascertained the absence of the evidence that proved the guilt, but instead of the acquittal, the Court returned invariably the case to the Prosecutor for finding an additional evidence of Lobzaxs guilt; once Mr.Lobza was found guilty on the charges (subsequently the sentence was vacated as groundless) and once Mr.Lobza was acquitted, but the acquittal was reversed due to the procedural violations admitted by the same Court.We, the undersigned, urge the Congress and President Obama to raise the case with Ukrainian authorities for a justice for Sergey Lobza in the criminal case x183/8081/13-x.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Create nongender restrooms. Beginning with schools, then working up to public restrooms. Stopping discomfort is my goal.
body: Creating non-gender restrooms not only helps alleviate discomfort for transgender, bigender, or others' discomfort but also may help to lower chances of bullying, fights, and even sexual encounters. This also should be applied to locker rooms. This way, those who identify as a different gender may take care of business and change in peace. Parents no longer need to worry about lawsuits over their child's different body parts being seen if their child has not undergone therapy. Please join me in petitioning the government to invest in this solution to many children and adults' daily conflicts. Thank you.
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: Stop the "Assault Weapons Ban of 2015" proposed by Congressman David Cicilline.
body: The purpose of this petition is to stop the Assault Weapons Ban of 2015 as proposed by Congressman David Cicilline and supported by other elected government officials. This ban is in violation of the 2nd Amendment. Based on recent polls this move by our elected Government is in direct conflict of the wishes of the majority of U.S. citizens.

title: Veto the budget bill with CISA law in it.
body: We cannot allow CISA to be passed. This is a law that removes many of our privacy policies on online information and is nothing more then an improved version of the Patriot act.We ask President Obama to veto this law and tell the American people that this CISA requirement is the reason why.
issues: c(311, 301) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Innovation: Arts & Technology")

title: Remove Debbie Wasserman Schultz As DNC Chair
body: Mr. President,It is crystal clear to America that Wasserman-Shultz is trampling the American democratic process in the manic attempt to eliminate any and all competition to her friend Hillary Clinton's campaign. You, and millions of Americans are aware of this travesty of democracy and we are also aware that YOU are the only person who can stop this madness. It's time for you to step up to the plate and do the right thing. Remove Debbie Wasserman-Shultz immediately and restore American Democracy to the ideal that our founding fathers fought, died and willingly suffered poverty for. Please. Push to remove her from her position and reform the Democrat Party to have a more Democratic primary process that benefits the people.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: WE PETITION THE OBAMA ADMINISTRATION TO:Provide Bernie Sanders Secret Service Protection Immediately.
body: Bernie Sanders is a sitting U. S. Senator and The Champion of Everyday Americans.   Recent national polls show him to be a leading Presidential candidate.  We The People, call for the immediate provision of Secret Service protection for him and his family.  Many powerful people regard his campaign, as a threat to their financial interests.  We fear for his safety. He deserves Secret Service protection, as much as any other candidate.

title: Commute the sentences of Dwight Lincoln Hammond Jr and Steven Dwight Hammond, both of Harney County Oregon.
body: Dwight and Steven Hammond were tried in Federal Court for arson on Federal Lands. The trial judge at sentencing felt the mandatory 5 year sentence was cruel and unusual and gave them lesser sentences. The Hammond's served that sentence and went home. The Federal Prosecutor appealed that sentence and won in Appeals Court to re-sentence the Hammond's to the Mandatory 5 years (with time served). The residents of Harney County believe that they have served enough time and are asking the President for a commute of sentence for the remainder of the Appeals Court Sentence. Other citizens of these United States, also believing the Hammond's have served enough time, are also signing this petition.
issues: c(311, 296, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Honor these American World War II soldiers on a US commemorative postage stamp, #StampOurStory #NiseiStamp
body: We respectfully ask that the President green light a commemorative postage stamp honoring the Japanese American World War II soldiers, known as xthe Nisei soldiers.x The USPS has delayed this stamp subject for ten years.This heroic group suffered great loss fighting for freedom abroad while the US government denied their families freedom at home in the internment camps. When the US went to war with Japan, people doubted them only because their parents came from Japan. Their valor would prove their loyalty and earn them the distinction of one of the most decorated groups in our history. This small stamp will be large in its reach as an iconic image to help define what it means to be an American. Please preserve the legacy of these historic American veterans through a stamp. Thank you!
issues: c(311, 336, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Veterans & Military")

title: condemn and make void the "Comfort Women Deal" reached between the Japanese government and the Korean government.
body: The Korean comfort women were physically raped by the Japanese. Recently, the Korean Foreign Minister agreed to a settlement of $1 billion yen in non-official reparations given as humanitarian contribution and a simple new apology in exchange for a South Korean promise not to press any future claims for the Japanese committing such horrible and dastardly war crimes against the Comfort Women of Korean and other nations, including China and the Philippines. The Japanese government will now ignore all further seeking of acknowledgement and reparations for the the publicly but not officially acknowledged raping of thousands of women decades ago with only 46 of them alive today in their 80s and 90s.http://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/30/world/asia/south-korea-japan-comfort-women.html

title: Change the official United States Motto from "In God We Trust" to "E Pluribus Unum". Out of many, we are one.
body: E Pluribus Unum. Out of many, one. Out of the many unique people who all have different beliefs and different skin tones and come from different backgrounds, we are one. That is what makes our country what it is: a melting pot. And we can only stand as a solid nation if all these different people can stand together without discrimination, and I feel like this is a step in the right direction. It is time that we take a stand against the discriminators in our country and let them know that we will no longer tolerate their behavior that promotes an Us vs. Them mentality.Our current motto is long outdated. "In God We Trust" presents the assumption that the whole country believes in a god, which, for starters, goes against the Establishment Clause.E Pluribus Unum. Out of Many, One.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Fort McClellan Health Act: Seeks to create a registry for veterans stationed at the base to help them get VA coverage.
body: Until it was shut down by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Fort McClellan Army base in Anniston, Alabama, among its many functions, served as a site for the Armyxs Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear Corps. But one function which remained constant throughout its tenure was the housing and disposal of chemical weapons. In 1999, the EPA closed the base, labeling it a hazardous site due to chemical waste which had leached into the ground, contaminating the soil and water supply.A bill introduced in 2013 called the Fort McClellan Health Act sought to create a registry for veterans stationed at the base to help them get coverage for health issues stemming from their exposure to toxins, and open up disability payments. The bill remains in committee and has yet to advance.
issues: c(311, 296, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment", "Veterans & Military")

title: Allow the TTB to issue Home Distiller Permits for at home distillation under 25 gallons per adult just like home brewing
body: I propose that the TTB create a new Distillation permit for small home hobby enthusiasts to allow them to distill up to 25 gallons of home distilled spirits by any method per personal and private consumption.  This permit will in no way allow someone to sell their home distilled spirits, but instead will satisfy the Governmental interest in collecting taxes on distilled spirits.  I propose the price of this permit be $50 per annual permit and can be ordered by internet on the www.ttb.gov website by entering your name, home address, and a credit card to pay the $50 tax for the permit, which will be sent to you in the mail by the TTB.  This small home use permit will allow many people across the country to make their home hobbies legal and pay their taxes.
issues: c(311, 321, 133) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Rural Policy")

title: Controversial Hong Kong bookseller becomes fifth man to go missing in mysterious circumstances.
body: "Major shareholder of store which specialised in reading material critical of Communist Party had gone to collect books at Chai Wan warehouse.A controversial Hong Kong bookseller who specialises in reading material critical of the Chinese Communist Party has gone missing x just weeks after four of his associates disappeared in mysterious circumstances."China's Police do not have any jurisdiction in Hong Kong under "One Country Two System".  This is an unlawful arrest, against the human right of Mr. Lee and others.Please check the link to read more of the story from South China Morning Post:http://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-crime/article/1897366/controversial-hong-kong-bookseller-becomes-fifth-man-go
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Recognize Endometriosis as a qualifying disability.
body: Endometriosis is a painful, chronic disease affecting over 170million women. It is a disease in which endometrium tissue grows outside the uterus forming lesions. The lesions are most commonly found in the abdomen and bowel, but have been found in every major organ. Endometriosis has also been known to fuse organs together causing major impairment in function: Immune system, Bowels & urination, excessive bleeding, fatigue, depression & anxiety, diarrhea, constipation, bloating, nausea, scar tissue formation, & adhesions. Chronic stabbing pain and verypainful menses are the most common symptoms causing many women to be unable to perform their occupational duties. Most symptoms are found in the SSA's Listing of Impairments Part A. Endo is leaving women unprotected under the ADA & unemployed
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Close the Guantxnamo detention site and end indefinite detention
body: President Obama, I support closing the Guantxnamo detention site and ending indefinite detention and urge you to get the job done before you leave office.  Instead of justice for the September 11 attacks, Guantxnamo has given the world torture, indefinite detention and unfair trials.  Closing it must be a top priority. Otherwise, the next president could try to fill Guantxnamo with new detainees. Especially in the current climate of fear and bigotry, future presidents could try to expand indefinite detention on vague, xnational securityx grounds. As Guantxnamo enters its 15th year of operation, each Guantxnamo detainee must either be charged and fairly tried in federal court, or be released to countries that will respect their human rights.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Direct the U.S. Department of Justice to promptly release the ADA Internet regulations
body: President Obama:On the 20th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, you said that you would issue regulations implementing the requirement for accessible websites, noting that they would be xthe most important updates to the ADA since its original enactment.x You now say that the regulations wonxt come out until 2018, after you leave office. But the need for these regulations is now more urgent.People with disabilities struggle to do everyday tasks such as banking, purchasing goods, and more. Inaccessible websites also hinder our education and employment. Website developers need guidance on how to comply with the law. Failing to provide that guidance is irresponsible and inconsistent with your commitment to civil rights. We demand that you issue the regulations immediately.
issues: c(311, 301) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Innovation: Arts & Technology")

title: Block president Obama from using executive order to bypass congress for any and all new gun laws.
body: We the people of the United States that are responsible gun  Owners are sick and tired of our rights being threatened due to the actions of others. We the people demand that president Obama's executive actions for gun control be deemed unlawful and deemed against the second amendment.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: pardon the Hammonds who have been convicted on terror charges for an accidental brush fire.
body: The Hammonds served their time for setting a back-fire to stop a larger wildfire which scorched some BLM land. They are being taken back to jail based on a charge of an act of terror for what was clearly an accident. The prosecutors will not explain how they justified a terror charge carrying a five year prison sentence. This is clearly a miscarriage of justice.
issues: c(311, 336, 133) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Rural Policy")

title: [HK] Hong Kong Declaration of Independence
body: In the 18 years after the transfer of sovereignty, China shows no respect and violating several aspects on the Sino-British Joint Declaration, which is the ground and requirement for the transfer of sovereignty (1).China, instead of proper governing, invades Hong Kong by disturbing well-established cultures, languages, public infrastructure, economy, politics, etc, utilizing Hong Kong as a tool for China's own benefits.Hong Kong as an international city will soon cease to exist.Thus, according to (1) we herein consider the Sino-British Joint Declaration is no longer effective and we execute our rights to declare the independence of Hong Kong.Dear President Obama, we want your response and review on the US-HK Policy Act, with Hong Kong treated as fully independent nation.
issues: c(24, 336, 311) c("Foreign Policy", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Reform Family Courts/Law. All over the United States millions of children are living life without a fit loving parent!
body: Reform Family Law - Millions of children all over the United States live their lives with only one parent. For those that do not know Family Court's all across America are corrupt! Reform is greatly needed.  Fit loving parents are being ordered out of the life of their child! Recently a landmark case just filed in the U.S. Supreme Court Adkins Vs. Adkins (Mich). A fit loving Mother stripped of her constitutional right to parent her child. My case very similar! The Government Must Be Banned From Interfering In Parenting Rights Of Fit Parents! Title IV-D Funds must be abolished. Family Court litigation must be trial by jury! Child custody must be shared-physical and legal custody! False accusations must be punishable by law! Immunity for Judges must be eliminated! Our children matter!
issues: c(311, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: End the brutal repression of the Oromo people by the Ethiopian government.
body: During the last four weeks, the Oromo students and farmers are protesting peacefully against the land grab policy of the (EPRDF) regime which is evicting and displacing millions of farmers from their ancestral land all over Oromia region. However, Ethiopian government responded to the protestors by using excessive forcexkilled about 125, injured hundreds of students severely, and jailed and imprisoned thousands of protesters who are still languishing in Ethiopian prisons and hidden concentration camps.As the US provides 100's of millions of dollars in aid each year we urge the US to put pressure on Ethiopia and stop the violent crackdown against these peaceful protesters.More information along with media coverage can be found in the link below.http://oromiatimes.org/2016/01/08/7827/#
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: transfer ownership of the Malheur Wildlife Refuge in Oregon to the Burns Paiute Tribe.
body: The occupation of the administration building of the Malheur Wildlife Refuge building by armed protestors reminds us that this land was part of a much larger tract that was to have been secured for the Paiute Indians according to a treaty of 1868, which Congress failed to ratify.  To address the protestors' assertion that what they desire is "local control" of this land, a transfer of these 187,757 acres to the Burns Paiute Tribe would honor the spirit of the 1868 treaty which the U.S. Government failed to enact, provide significant resources to the tribe, and directly address the protestors purported grievances.The transfer of the land should be made with the stipulation that the territory be managed as a wildlife refuge, consistent with existing United States law and policy.
issues: c(311, 296, 133) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment", "Rural Policy")

title: Initiate a Federal DOJ Review of the legal institutions involved in the conviction and appeals concerning Steven Avery.
body: The Obama Administration previously responded that they could not pardon Steven Avery due to the fact that this wasn't a state crime.As such, this petition asks the White House to initiate a Department of Justice review of all legal institutions involved in the conviction and appeal of Steven Avery.Without passing judgment as to Avery's guilt, the documentary 'Making a Murder' raises serious questions about the ethics concerning said city and state legal institutions.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Open DOJ investigation into Manitowoc County Sheriff Depart for convictions of Steven Avery and Brendan Dassey
body: Open a DOJ investigation into the conduct and role of the Manitowoc County Sheriff Department and the Manitowoc County District Attorneys Office in the convictions of Steven Avery and Brendan Dassey in the events surrounding Teresa Halbach's murder, and investigate the Wisconsin Department of Justice, Attorney General Office's review of the merits of the 1985 wrongful conviction of Steven Avery.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Initiate a Federal Investigation of the Sheriff's Offices of Manitowoc County and Calumet County, Wisconsin
body: This petition calls for a federal investigation of the Sheriff's Offices of Manitowoc County and Calumet County, Wisconsin, regarding their handling of the Teresa Halbach investigation and their prosecution of Steven Avery and Brendan Dassey, as featured in the documentary entitled "Making a Murderer."We the people believe that justice has not been served by the counties' investigations and prosecution, which were irreparably and grievously flawed by corruption, coercion, and conflict of interest.  We the people assert that an investigation into these agencies is necessary in order to demonstrate the Obama Administration's commitment to restoring a sense of fairness at the heart of our justice system.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Immediately release Dwight Lincoln Hammond, Jr. and his son, Steven Dwight Hammond from prison for time served.
body: Since Dwight Lincoln Hammond, Jr., and his son, Steven Dwight Hammond already served their original sentence and were released from prison, we see no reason for them to have to serve an additional length of time. The original judge in the trial (Judge Hogan) overruled the minimum terrorist sentence that is now being used as the justification for their reimprisonment. He wrote that if the full five years were required, it would be a violation of the 8th amendment (cruel and unusual punishment).
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: TAKE ACTION ON BEHALF OF THE UNITED STATES CITIZENS OF THE ISLAND OF VIEQUES, PUERTO RICO
body: We, the US Citizens of Vieques, are extremely sick with  Cancer, Diabetes, Cirrhosis, & Hypertension caused by the military's environmental contamination since WWII.  Thousands have died & will die from the heavy metals, agent orange, napalm, & other toxic compounds found on the Island. We have claims against the Secretary of Health for the negligent science & damaging conclusions reached by the ATSDR.  We need a hospital, a research center to understand the effects of the toxins, & compensation to rebuild our lives.  We must address the critical health issues, the environmental contamination, & the economic & property injustice suffered by the Citizens.  Please instruct the Secretary of Health to settle our claims & work with us to solve this crisis & save our children.

title: Federally Investigate the Manitowoc County Sheriffs Department and the County Court System for Criminal Behavior.
body: It is our belief that the Manitowoc County Sheriff's department, the entire Manitowoc County Judicial System & the Calumet County DA office should be federally investigated for criminal misconduct. These entities have a history of making wrongful arrests & wrongful convictions of crimes together while operating unchecked outside the boundaries of law - Unjustly depriving Americans of life, liberty & their pursuit of happiness.The series "Making a Murderer" revealed said parties have wrongfully prosecuted Steven Avery. Further concerns include the suspicious death of Teresa Halbach, strong evidence pointing to tampering in the case, coercing a confession from a juvenile special ed student & a taped admittance of considering a homicide strategy to eliminate a plaintiff in a civil lawsuit.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Provide food and medical aid to starving civilians in Madaya, Syria.
body: We must help the starving children and families in Madaya, Syria who have been besieged for months. The Syrian government has prevented the entry of food and aid.  And the civilians are prevented from leaving, trapped in a mountainous region, surrounded by land mines and snipers. Doctors without Borders reports that at least 23 have died in December alone, and many more will likely be at risk of death and severe illness as winter sets in.  We the People implore our administration to immediately provide food & access to medical care to the 30,000 civilians who are being starved to death. We also need to ensure that there are safe passages for ongoing humanitarian aid.
issues: c(24, 326, 311) c("Foreign Policy", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Grant individuals with Down's syndrome monthly disability benefits, regardless of parents income (up to 100k yearly).
body: We believe individuals with Down's syndrome are entitled to their benefits regardless of their parents income. Individuals with Down's syndrome are disabled, their parents income should not determine how disabled they are, it should not determine how much help, insurance and benefits they can receive. Benefits should be granted until the individuals with the disability reach adulthood. At which their level of disability can be determined.Parents of children with Down's syndrome, some of which have heart disease, should not have to worry about their medical bills and exspenses. They are disabled and entitled to their benefits, a number shouldnt determine how disabled they are.There is a wide range of disability with Down's syndrome and the severity can not be determined until adult age.
issues: c(311, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: issue a statement demanding the restoration of Milo Yiannopoulos's Twitter verification badge.
body: On Friday 8 January 2016, Twitter unverified the account of Breitbart technology editor Milo Yiannopoulos, effectively declaring war on libertarian and millennial voices by punishing the outspoken commentator for his views. This comes despite CEO Jack Dorsey declaring that Twitter xstands for freedom of expressionx just a few months ago.The Obama Administration should issue a strong statement of support for freedom of speech. Give Milo back his badge! #JeSuisMilohttp://money.cnn.com/2016/01/10/technology/twitter-hate-speech-crackdown-milo-yiannopoulos/http://www.buzzfeed.com/alexkantrowitz/twitter-unverifies-milo-yiannopoulos-leading-to-speech-polic?utm_term=.ek52Aqxl0#.hdezgBypmhttp://www.mediaite.com/online/twitter-punishment-of-breitbart-journalist-sparks-revolt/
issues: c(301, 311) c("Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: make January 11th a national holiday in honor of Alexander Hamilton's birthday.
body: In honor of one of our greatest founding fathers, January 11th should be recognized as a national holiday to celebrate the life and success of Alexander Hamilton. Until recently, Hamilton's accomplishments were not widely known by the general public. This day (Hamilton's birthday) should be recognized by all Americans to respect and honor the financial system (and in turn the current monetary system) that we live and abide by today.
issues: c(301, 18, 311) c("Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Education", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Grant Posthumous Full Pardons to the 156 Soldiers of Camp Logan (1917) Prosecuted on the charges of Mutiny and Murder
body: In 1917 a group of African American men, comprising the 24th Infantry, who had dedicated their lives to the USA were stationed in Houston, Texas. They were met with brutality and abuse by citizens and the police alike, their rights as federal soldiers and citizens were trampled upon. In one fateful night violence boiled over when rumor spread that the local police had killed one of their fellow soldiers. Following this night the 156 of the soldiers were prosecuted.  19 were sentenced to hang and 41 were given life. The trail was full of biases, procedural violations and weak efforts to defend the soldiers. These soldiers were not protected nor treated as they should have been, they were forsaken. Please sign this petition and give them a small token of justice
issues: c(311, 321, 175) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Urban Policy")

title: Nationally recognize February 7-14 as Congenital Heart Defect Awareness Week.
body: Congenital heart defects are the #1 birth defect worldwide. Nearly 1 of every 100 babies is born with a CHD.CHDs are the #1 cause of birth defect related deaths.CHDs are the leading cause of all infant deaths in the US.Each year approximately 40,000 babies are born in the US with a CHD.Each year over 1,000,000 babies are born worldwide with a CHD. 100,000 will not live to see their first birthday; 1,000s more die before they reach adulthood.There are an estimated 2,000,000 CHD survivors in the US.There are more than 40 types of CHDs,there is no known prevention or cure for any of them.In the US, twice as many children die from CHDs annually than from all forms of childhood cancer, yet funding for pediatric cancer remains five times higher than for CHDs.
issues: c(311, 316, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Health Care")

title: Accept the challenge from the NRA's Executive Vice President, Wayne LaPierre, to a fair and public debate.
body: On January 14th (01/14/2016), the NRA released the following statement:"NRA Executive Vice President Wayne LaPierre has challenged President Obama to a one-hour real debate on guns - as opposed to an orchestrated public relations stunt with pre-screened questions. Will the president accept the invitation?"We the people demand a response from the White House and President Obama to accept this challenge of a fair and public debate.
issues: c(311, 321, 331) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Gun Violence")

title: Investigate the Delaware North Corporation's claim to own trademark on historically important Yosemite landmarks.
body: The Delaware North Corporation, a concessionaire in Yosemite National Park for decades, has been replaced with another vendor after a competitive bidding process. Delaware North now insists that they own Trademark for historically significant and precedent park properties as a condition of their original contract with the Nationl Park Service - although they made no attempt to register the Trademarks until 2002. Delaware North is now demanding that the taxpayer pay over $50 million for the rights to these national treasures.We petition the USPTO to investigate and invalidate Delaware North's claims and prevent the extortion of the public and renaming of park landmarks that have been run by a succession of third party vendors for over 100 years in some cases.
issues: c(311, 296) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment")

title: EXECUTIVE ORDER Rare Disease Day as February 29, 2016. A Rare Disease is one that affects fewer than 200,000 Americans.
body: A Rare Disease is one that affects fewer than 200,000 Americans.  There are nearly 7,000 such diseases affecting nearly 30 million Americans,  according to the National Institute of Health  (NIH). Two-Thirds of those affected are children, and the diseases tend to be serious and lifelong.  Evenso, most rare diseases have no approved treatment, and many are not being studied by medical researchers. Often, research on Rare Diseases is funded by families and friends of patients or by patient organizations.  On February 29, 2016, millions around the world will be celebrating for public awareness.  WE are requesting for an Executive Order that every last day of February be observed as Rare Disease Day in the United States of America Mr. President. Thank you in-advance for your consideration.
issues: c(311, 18, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Health Care")

title: Host a STOP WHITE GENOCIDE "Beer Summit" to keep Donald Trump and the Southern Poverty Law Center "on message"
body: The Southern Poverty Law Center is often charged with being an anti-White organization that promotes White Genocide.But the SPLC and its media followers actually broadcast these STOP WHITE GENOCIDE truths far and wide:xAsia for the Asians, Africa for the Africans, White countries for EVERYBODYx"'Diversity' means chasing down Whites""'Diversity' means chasing down the last White person""White self-hatred is SICK!!!""Anti-racist is a code word for anti-White"Donald Trump has been doing great work fighting White Genocide also, but sadly, the SPLC attacks him.Host a "beer summit" at the White House to urge both the Donald and the SPLC to not bicker, but to stay on message:"DIVERSITY IS A CODE WORD FOR WHITE GENOCIDE!"goo.gl/AQr3Fqgoo.gl/Mhz4vgoo.gl/rG0KAa

title: Lift Sudan Sanctions, They are Oppressing the Poor and Killing Innocent People
body: The poor and helpless in Sudan are bearing the brunt of the economic sanctions imposed on the country by the United States 23 years ago. The intended goal of the sanctions might have been to weaken the oppressive government of Sudan, but they are producing exactly the opposite result. They are weakening and impoverishing the people of Sudan and strengthening the grip of the regime on the country. They are depriving the whole nation of basic and life-saving health care (as detailed in a resent article by the Foreign Policy Magazine: http://foreignpolicy.com/2016/01/14/sudan-sanctions-deprive-whole-nation-of-health-care/)We plead with president Obama to do the right and humane thing by ordering an immediate end to the Sudan sanctions.
issues: c(24, 311, 316) c("Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: support a "x-rated" ver. of Deadpool. The movie was blocked by China & we should set a worldwide example of free speech.
body: I pay my bills. I go to work. I have health insurance for my entire household. The family volunteers and we believe in STEM education. I'd like to be able to support the local economy by hiring a babysitter so I can go watch a completely vulgar and violent x-rated edition of Deadpool. Tell FLOTUS I will eat raw carrots, celery, and broccoli, while drinking water at the showing. I'll even only purchase weapons that are registered if I ever felt the need to buy one. Please make America great again.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Reaffirm commitments to Taiwan (R.O.C.) and work toward recognizing it as an independent and sovereign country
body: In 1928, the USA was the first government to recognize the Republic of China. Now in Taiwan, the government has become a beacon of democracy and freedom in Asia. The people have elected the first woman president, Tsai Ing-wen, and have given a majority to the opposition, the Democratic Progressive Party. This shows Taiwan is a free democracy, allows peaceful transition of powers, promotes human rights and gender equality. Because of the People's Republic of China, few countries have formal relations with Taiwan. China threatens with military exercises, bullies Taiwanese people when they display national pride, and bullies the world into believing there can be only "one China." The USA should reaffirm its commitment to Taiwan, and should stand on the side of democracy, not coercion.
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: Change the U.S. National Anthem to Star Wars theme "The Imperial March"
body: This petition calls for the Federal Government to change the National Anthem of the United States of America to Star Wars theme "The Imperial March".
issues: c(311, 24, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Immediately  Impeach President Barack Obama, and Vice President Joe Biden for Significant Malfeasance, and Misfeasance.
body: Faithless Execution of, Article II, Section 3 of the Constitution requires the President to xtake Care that the Laws be faithfully executed.x;Faithless Execution, Significant Misfeasance, and Misfeasance,  illegal and unilateral changing of federal statutes, from several components within Obamacare to scrapping codified welfare work requirements to amending immigration laws and enacting policies Congress did not approve;Seven cases in which Obama has xamendedx Obamacare without legislative action, thereby usurping the powers reserved to Congress by Article 1 of the Constitution;Unilateral xamendmentsx to the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act;Unilateral amendment of the welfare-work requirement;Five instances of Obamaxs unilateral xamendmentsx of immigration law;
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Help get the SMU Mustangs into the NCAA Tournament
body: The NCAA has wrongly and unfairly barred the SMU Mustangs from the NCAA basketball tournament because of the indiscretions of one player and a former administrator.That administrator and player and no longer with the program, and now it's time to do what's right. It's time to stop punishing the innocent.It's time to free SMU.And it's time to allow the Mustangs into the 2016 NCAA Tournament
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Order the lowering of the American Flag in respect for the 12 US Marines lost in the Hawaii helicopter crash.
body: The lowering of the United States National Flag is a sign of respect for the passing of government officials and dignitaries, such as Memorial Day, the flag shall be lowered to half mast until noon.    The death of the 12 United States Marines in the horrific helicopter crash off the coast of Hawaii should be an example of how dangerous the jobs of our service members are on a daily basis, whether training in the United States or fighting the war overseas.  It is imperative that we pay our respects as those Marines, who selflessly gave their lives for our freedom.  In accordance with the United States National Code, Title 36, Section 175, subsection (m), this situation meets the criteria to have the flag flown at half mast.    We, The People, demand a response in this regard.
issues: c(311, 326, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Veterans & Military")

title: Free the Hammonds
body: Father and son, Dwight L. Hammond, 74, and Steven D. Hammond, 46, are currently serving a 5 year sentence under the Anti-terrorism and Effective Death Penalty Act of 1996 for having started two range fires on their property that spread onto less than 140 acres of their own BLM range. They have paid over $400,000 in civil fees and have already spent time in federal prison for the fires, but were recently resentenced after an appeal by the Federal prosecutor. Please free the Hammonds and right this injustice.
issues: c(311, 133) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Rural Policy")

title: Initiate a Federal Investigation into the death of John Lang, a suspected murder by Fresno Police Department.
body: This petition calls for a federal investigation into the Fresno Police Department of Fresno, California, regarding the death of John Lang, a known activist within the Fresno community.  We the people believe that a Federal investigation into the conduct of the Fresno Police Department, leading up to the death of John Lang, warrants federal review.We the people assert that an investigation into these agencies is necessary in order to demonstrate the Obama Administration's commitment to restoring transparency within the justice system.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Full investigation of the death of LaVoy Finicum by Federal Agents on January 26 2016, by the United States AG
body: This petition requests that a full investigation by federal prosecutors and the Attorney General in the events that resulted in the death of LaVoy Finicum whom was shot dead by federal agents in route to a meet with the City Concil and Harney County Sheriff's Department on Tuesday January 26, 2016.Eyewitness accounts have LaVoy Finicum with his hands up and unarmed at the time he was shot by federal officers representing the Federal Bureau of Investigations.It is petitioned a full transparent investigation by the Attorney General's office take place to determine if any official in the line of duty acted against federal law in the death of LaVoy Finicum and if found so be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.
issues: c(311, 321, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

body: "Diversity" means chasing down the last White person.Anti-Whites flood White communities with non-Whites, and Whites are forced by law to integrate with the non-Whites so as to "assimilate," i.e. intermarry and be blended out of existence.Donald Trump's "Stop White Genocide Wall" will slow the extinction of Whites in the genocidal assimilation chambers that formerly were White communities.Donald Trump's "Stop White Genocide Wall" says no to "Asia for the Asians, Africa for the Africans, White countries for EVERYBODY."Donald Trump's "Stop White Genocide Wall" shouts, "WHITE SELF-HATRED IS SICK!!!"Those who welcome White Genocide say they're anti-racist. What they are is anti-White.Anti-racist is a code word for anti-white.Diversity is a code word for White Genocide.goo.gl/Mhz4v
