title: Put an end to the "Superdelegate" system, which obstructs, undermines and counters our democracy.
body: Despite winning a whopping 81.6 percent of the people's vote, Kim Metcalfe, among other representatives in Alaska are giving their Superdelegate vote to Hillary Clinton. This is not democracy, this is impeding democracy. It is voter suppression. It is treason. We MUST do away with the Superdelegate system, making it illegal and unconstitutional, as it violates and undermines the people's will. WE the PEOPLE. This is America.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Honor Anna Marie Duke-Pearce, known to the world as Patty Duke.
body: To have the President of the United States formally recognize the life and accomplishments of the woman knows as Patty Duke. Mental Health advocate, military families advocate, US veteran advocate and an American entertainer with talents beyond description.  Her real name was Anna Marie Duke-Pearce but she used her stage name of Patty Duke to bring attention to issues that really mattered to Americans.  Mental health awareness, using her own mental health issues as a way to inform others that mental health care was and is paramount for those who cannot speak for themselves. She personally provided words of support to those she encountered and she has provided testimony to members and committees of the US Congress. She was "America's Sweetheart". She was a TRUE Miracle Worker.
issues: c(301, 311, 351) c("Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Veterans & Military")

title: Rescind the Navy Contract with Ingalls Shipbuilding due to State Senate Bill 1523 Legalizing Denial of Necessities
body: President Obama please rescind the $618 million dollar Navy contract with Ingalls Shipbuilding in Pascagoula Mississippi. The state of Mississippi is in the process of passing Senate Bill 1523 which would legalize the denial of goods and services based on religious bigotry. This law will even legalize the denial of basic needs such food, water, clothing and housing. Many groups will be protected by the Civil Rights Act of 1964. However, GLBT's among others are not protected by that law. The intent of Senate Bill 1523 is to harm unprotected groups of Americans. The federal government should not contribute to the economy of states like Mississippi that are harming American citizens.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Investigate the death of India Cummings and change federal laws allowing PDs to conduct internal inquiries.
body: On February 1, 2016 India Cummings was arrested and taken into custody, where she died. The circumstances of her death remain unclear. Indiaxs mother claims that her daughter was denied medical assistance which led to her death. We, the undersigned, require:-	Independent inquiry into the conditions and circumstances surrounding the death of India Cummings.-	Punishment for everyone involved in Indiaxs death.-	Reformation of the laws that allow police departments to conduct internal investigations regarding deaths of the detainees. Such investigations must be made by the state government agencies.
issues: c(321, 336, 311) c("Criminal Justice Reform", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Utilize part of the $1-billion granted toward the opioid epidemic to help the chronic pain pandemic in America.
body: We request that a portion of the $1 billion allocated toward the opioid abuse epidemic be utilized to help the chronic pain pandemic, through funding for improved prevention, treatment, research, provider and patient education and public awareness. Chronic Pain is a major health problem in the United States. According to the American Academy of Pain Medicine, 100 million adult Americans have chronic pain conditions, not including acute or pediatric pain. Pain affects more Americans than diabetes, heart disease and cancer combined. Pain costs society at least $560-$635 annually, equal to $2,000 for everyone living in the U.S. The total incremental cost of health care due to pain ranges between $261-$300 billion and $297-$336 billion due to lost productivity.
issues: c(306, 311, 25) c("Budget & Taxes", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care")

title: pardon Edward Snowden
body: A petition for President Obama to pardon Edward Snowden.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Make North Carolina ineligible for federal funding until they repeal HB2 and start protecting everyone's rights!
body: North Carolina's anti-LGBT law, HB2, makes the Tar Heel State ineligible for federal funds across a wide swath of programs, including highways and transportation, education, and housing, because they discriminate against individuals and strip them of their constitutional rights.All residents and visitors to NC should not have to be forced into areas where their lives are put in danger because of Trans-misogynistic biases.Support LGBT, women's and veteran's rights! Please do not allow the hatred to spread. Send the message loud and clear. Everyone has equal rights! Anti-LGBT laws are unconstitutional!
issues: c(306, 321, 311) c("Budget & Taxes", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Remove derogatory statements from transgender soldiers' DD-214, Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty.
body: Figures from the Williams Institute declare that trans people are twice as likely as to serve in our armed services than non-trans peole, that there are currently 15,500 active duty trans soldiers and up to 134,300 trans veterans.Many employers and state agencies require veterans to submit their DD-214 when applying for work or social benefits. Veterans that have served honorably, should have a DD-214 free of derogatory statements. Section 28 of my DD-214, for example, contains the statement, "Conditions That Interfere With Military Service - Not Disability - Mental Disorders".Please help our trans veterans regain their lost dignity by directing the Department of Defense to remove derogatory statements from trans veterans' discharge forms.
issues: c(311, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Veterans & Military")

title: Award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Claudette Colvin
body: Recognize Claudette Colvin's enormous contributions to civil rights by giving her the nation's highest civilian honor, the Presidential Medal of Freedom.   Claudette Colvin is an African-American woman who at the age of 15 in 1955, refused to surrender her public bus seat to a white passenger.  She was jailed. Ms. Colvin obtained a lawyer and challenged the charges in court.  This nearly a year before Rosa Parks made the same protest in the same city.  Moreover the  following year Claudette Colvin and three other womenxnot including Mrs. Parks-- risked their lives by becoming plaintiffs in the successful federal court  challenge BROWDER V. GAYLE which ended racially segregated seating on public buses in Alabama. We ask President Obama to honor a woman who made giant steps for freedom.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Put a Woman on the FRONT of the New $10 Bill. #NotGoingBack
body: We want a woman on the front of the new $10 bill.In June 2015, the U.S. Treasury announced that the new $10 would feature the portrait of a woman. A recent interview with Secretary of Treasury Jack Lew said Hamilton would remain on the bill, which leads us to ask xis the woman on the back?xWe are committed to creating visibility for women and believe it's fundamental to achieving equality for all. Featuring a woman on the back of the bill does not represent equality for women today, nor does it honor the courageous women who have shaped our nation.  We stand for fairness, opportunity and equality, including equal representation for equal contributions. The time is now for female visibility-- on the front of our $10 bill. Please sign the petition to ensure that we're #NotGoingBack.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Support 2016 National Champions Ribault High School Lady Trojans to visit President Obama.
body: On Saturday, April 2, 2016, Jean Ribault High School, Lady Trojans Girls Basketball team made history by becoming the 2016 National Champions of the Dick's Sporting Goods National Tournament. Coming into the national tournament as the underdogs was no different for these young ladies than attending school on a regular day or growing up in their neighborhoods. These young ladies displayed poise, class and faith to persevere to a great achievement. For this reason, we'd like the 2016 National Champion Running and Gunning Lady Trojans of Jean Ribault High School in Jacksonville, FL to have the esteemed pleasure of visiting the White House and meeting President Barack Obama and the First Family to show what it looks like when you believe in yourself and make everyone else believe in you, too.
issues: c(18, 311) c("Education", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: grant clemency to non-violent drug offender Oshan Cook, a community leader who has dedicated his life to service.
body: Oshan Cook is a well-loved community advocate and a lifelong social justice activist from the San Francisco Bay Area. He introduced thousands of people to the magic and beauty of tea culture through his teahouse, mobile tea setups, tea workshops, and non-profit community activities. On April 26, 2013, a judge decreed a xmandatory minimumx sentence of 12.5 years in federal prison on charges of distributing psychedelics, with no right to parole. Oshanxs conviction followed two jury trials, with the first ending in a hung jury, and he is currently serving time at Taft Correctional Camp in Taft, California, near Bakersfield.Since Oshan has not committed any violent crimes and since he is a benefit to community and society, we seek a Presidential Pardon and clemency from President Obama.
issues: c(321, 311) c("Criminal Justice Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: #FreeSandow from the oppression of a ruthless dictator. Force WWE to give Damien Sandow TV time.
body: We the People want to see Damien Sandow on RAW, Smackdown, Superstars, and/or NXT. Mr. Sandow is a huge talent and deserves the right to work in this industry. #FreeSandow #PushSandow #GiveSandowAChance #SandowRevolution #WeThePeople
issues: c(301, 311, 316) c("Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: recognize April 15th as 'ASL Day' because April 15, 1817, the first school for the Deaf opened in the US.
body: National ASL Day is a day of observance celebrating American Sign Language.On April 15, 1817, the first school for the deaf in the United States opened. Students gathered there over the years and at subsequent Deaf schools across our nation. The children intermingled Native American Signs, French Sign Language, and Marthaxs Vineyard Sign Language. This process brought forth modern American Sign Language.We want to honor our unique heritage in ASL, and open opportunities for our community through this holiday.Deaf, hard of hearing, DeafBlind, late Deaf, Children of Deaf Adults(Coda), families of Deaf and hearing ASL Allies use ASL and celebrate it's unique language and connection to Deaf Culture.
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: Close the Guantanamo Bay Detention Center and Turn It Into a Marine Research Lab.
body: We need to study the impact of climate change on our oceans, the loss of marine species and more. Studies of ocean currents are critical to understanding the extent of climate change. The project, which would be co-owned by Cuba and the US also has the potential to improve relations between the countries.Converting Guantanamo to a marine research park would also help end unlawful detentions and eliminate a major recruiting tool for terrorist organizations. According to Defense Department special envoy for Guantxnamo closure, Paul Lewis:"As with our military leaders, foreign leaders regularly cite the Guantxnamo detention facility as an obstacle to counterterrorism efforts."---This app uses the We the People API, but is neither endorsed nor certified by the White House.
issues: c(296, 24, 311) c("Energy & Environment", "Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: To force Mississippi governor Phil Bryant to step down immediately.
body: Mississippi Gov. Phil Bryant has signed a controversial "religious freedom" bill into law. HB 1523, promises that the state government will not punish people who refuse to provide services to people because of a religious opposition to same-sex marriage, extramarital sex or transgender people. However, this law  protects the rights of people who are opposed to homosexuality but who now live in a country where same-sex marriage is a legal right. The bill amounts to a state sanction for open discrimination of which this state has a rampant history and continues to live up to it by the passing of HB 1523. Even without such a law, it is already legal in Mississippi as in most states in the country to discriminate against LGBT people in providing employment, housing, e.c.t.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: ESTABLISH JUSTICE AND PREVENT A GREAT CATASTROPHE
body: - PACE Resolution 2085 stresses the fact of occupation of Nagorno-Karabakh and other territories of Azerbaijan by Armenian state; requests the immediate withdrawal of Armeniaxs armed forces from the occupied region; regards the deliberate creation of environmental crisis against Azerbaijan by Armenia as an environmental aggression; warns that current state of Sarsang reservoir, located in the occupied Azerbaijani territories, could result in a humanitarian disaster,- OSCE Minsk Group has made no progress towards the liberation of our occupied territories,Therefore: The undersigned ask the Administration to support PACE Resolution 2085, to assist in the liberation of the Azerbaijani territories occupied by Armenia and the prevention of a humanitarian catastrophe in the region.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Do Not Allow The Government To Determine If A Person Was Raped
body: If you have paid any attention to the media recently, you know that several cases of rape have been dismissed for 'lack of evidence'. One of the most well known being Kesha Sebert vs. her Producer/Abuser Dr. Luke.On Wednesday, April 6th, 2016, a judge denied Ms. Sebert claim and DISGUSTINGLY stated "Every rape is not a gender-motivated hate crime."A Spain rape victim was asked by judge if she tried 'closing her legs'Is this how 'honorable' judges handle rape today? With disgusting immature comebacks?We the people, are asking something to finally be done. It's time to stop victim shaming due to 'lack of evidence'.Let's change this case, so we can then change the nation, and then, hopefully, the world. Let's not just save Kesha, let's save rape victims everywhere.
issues: c(321, 311) c("Criminal Justice Reform", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: It is the will of the American people that SFC Charles Martland be pardoned of perceived wrongdoing.
body: It is the will of the American people that SFC Charles Martland be reinstated to full Active Duty, and assume his position as a member of The Green Berets. We want SFC Charles Martland reinstated. Any and all administrative action taken against him should be expunged from his Military File. He should wear a badge of honor. SFC Charles Martland truly represents the motto of the Green Berets, "To Free the Oppressed." We respect cultural differences but exploitation of human rights should NEVER be a justified cultural act. Rape, torture, and murder must be stopped. We urge the Obama Administration to reinstate SFC Charles Martland for protecting the sanctity and dignity of the children and women of Afghanistan, against those that prey on them, and treat them inhumanly!
issues: c(326, 311, 351) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Veterans & Military")

title: Stop occupation & children's  carnage by Armenia according to the statement of UN security council.St.No 822 & 853 & 874
body: after Dissolution of the Soviet Union Republic of Azerbaijan was attacked by Armenia and one fifth of Azerbaijan's territory  was occupied by Armenia.During the war Armenia was committed many Massacre's like The Khojaly Massacre, also known as the Khojaly tragedy, was the killing[of at least 161 ethnic Azerbaijani civilians from the town of Khojaly on 25x26 February 1992 by the Armenian.after war Armenia Break ceasefire 119 time continuously. this day Armenia attacked the Azerbaijan again and we worried about that Armenia kill the women an children once more... so we believe that occupancy & killing must be ended and Armenia must expulsion from occupied territory.
issues: c(311, 321, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Foreign Policy")

title: Enforce OSCE Arms Embargo Against Azerbaijan
body: IAI Haropxunmanned combat air vehiclex(UCAV) developed by the MBT division ofxIsrael Aerospace Industries wasxused in combat for the first time, on April 4, 2016, by the militaryxofxAzerbaijan against Nagorno-Karabakh Republic,xresulting in the death of sevenxArmenians during a ceasefire violation by Azerbaijan.In 2012 alone,xAzerbaijanxpurchased $1.6 billion worth of weapons from Israel, including sophisticated reconnaissance and attack drones fromxIsrael Aerospace Industries.We, the people of the United States of America, demand theximmediatexsuspensionxof all U.S. aid toxIsrael until the latter revokesxall arms export permits to Azerbaijan. Israel must cease any arms exports as long as the OSCE arms embargo is in effect and until a peaceful settlement of the conflict is reached.x
issues: c(326, 24, 311) c("Homeland Security & Defense", "Foreign Policy", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: Investigate Clinton Surrogate voting fraud in Wyoming.
body: The Wyoming caucus is yet another caucus where the people who showed up to vote where a majority for Bernie Sanders but Hillary Clinton secured a large margin of victory using surrogate ballots. Only this time the population was so small it exposed the level of implausibility of her strategy. She got over 90% of the surrogate ballots which is unheard of. Just one of her supporters showed up with over 600 surrogate ballots in one county. The likelihood that her supporter collected over 600 ballots from over 600 people in one district who were physically incapable of coming to the caucus is almost impossible to believe. I am creating this petition to ask that the white house order an investigation of this HIGHLY dubious event within 30 days. After 30 days the ballots may be destroyed.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Commit to a truly equal representative democracy and abolish "In God We Trust" as the nation's motto.
body: Thank you for taking an interest in this petition. We are the Secular Student Alliance of Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond, Virginia. We fight for the separation of church and state, and we have created this petition to hopefully do away with a motto that marginalizes a great portion of the people of the United States.  One of the most beautiful aspects of our nation is that is a melting pot of nationalities, ideas, and world views.  Thus in order for our government to accurately represent this patchwork of people, it must be as neutral as possible.  To that end, the current motto should be abolished in favor of the motto for the Seal of the United States: "E Pluribus Unum".  This motto, meaning "one from many", reflects the unparalleled unity that makes this nation so amazing!
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Establish Justice and prevent a great catasrophe
body: Establish Justice and prevent a great catastrophe
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Pass the Anna Westin Act to provide affordable and effective health care to those suffering with eating disorders
body: This petition hopes to show the people's support of the Anna Westin Act of 2015. If this passes, insurance companies will be prohibited from excluding eating disorders and other mental illnesses from treatment coverage. It will also require that treatment includes residential treatment. This will greatly benefit Americans because currently, eating disorders are affecting over 20 million women and 10 million men. Additionally, anorexia nervosa, a type of eating disorder, has the highest mortality rate among all mental illnesses. The Anna Westin Act will be an immense help in encouraging and providing treatment in the United States.
issues: c(25, 311) c("Health Care", "Civil Rights & Equality")

title: We are seeking consideration of Rodney White's request for a Presidential Pardon. Mr. White is helping to change lives.
body: My Petition is to bring about awareness to my request for consideration of my Presidential Pardon. Although this may seem a drastic measure I believe that the pardon application is not user friendly and will eliminate many of the people in the communities that I have served from expressing their support. Accordingly, this petition is seeking to bring attention and allow others that may want to support me to do so if only by your association to the work that I have done in various communities and the many that I helped gain an education and transition back into society.
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Award Homer Plessy the Presidential Medal of Freedom for his significant role in the American Civil Rights Struggle.
body: On June 7, 1892, Plessy a mixed-race shoemaker was jailed for sitting in the xwhitex only car on the East Louisiana railroad in defiance of a local segregation ordinance. He later became the plaintiff in a case before the U.S. Supreme Court where, the Justices decided against him in the landmark Plessy v. Ferguson case of 1896. The loss of the Supreme Court case in 1896 resulted in Plessyxs name being forever associated with the long and oppressive blight of Jim Crow laws and has obscured his contribution to the legal, social and moral movement to abolish those restrictive laws. In 1954, the Brown v. Board of  Education initiated a new era and the gradual dismantling of legalized American apartheid.  Lets restore Homer A Plessyxs name with the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: Do Not give Hillary Clinton a preemptive pardon.  She must stand trial and pay for any crimes as does any other American
body: This is to petition Obama to NOT give Hillary Clinton a preemptive pardon,  /she must be made to stand trial and pay for any crimes committed, just like any other American.
issues: c(311, 321, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Dodgers Announcer Vin Scully in his final season.
body: Vin Scully, is quite simply, a national treasure.  This year marks his 67th and final season as a Dodgers broadcaster, starting his career when they were the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1950.  He is our national pastime's greatest ambassador, an educator who imparts fans with the wealth of knowledge about the game and its players that he has accumulated over his illustrious career, and the voice of not just Dodger baseball, but all of baseball.  No person living today more perfectly symbolizes what is great and admirable about our national pastime, and for this, we request that President Obama honor his indelible contributions to American culture with the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
issues: c(311, 18, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Investigate the background of the regional CEO of Twitter x, who is related to Ministry of State Security of China.
body: Twitter is almost the only one effective platform for Chinese Dissidents and netizens sharing infornation forbidden by China government, and protecting themselves by updating their realtime state about whether they are safe or being arrested by China Government.  However, a female named 'x' who used to be the CEO of a company that is highly related to the Ministry of State Security of China, has recently been appointed to be the regional CEO of Twitter in Greater China. This is a severe threat to the Chinese struggling for free speech. And it is also a penetration to the science and technology society of US.   Imagine there is a ISIS member working in Twitter !  To stop this, a serious investigation of 'x''s background should be started immediately!
issues: c(311, 316) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs")

title: Change Closed/Semi-closed/Semi-Open primaries to Open so everyone can exercise their right to vote
body: Due to the issues that we the people have been facing when attempting to vote, we should open up the remaining primaries so that people do not have their right to vote infringed upon. There have been countless report of people's parties being switched without their knowledge and of people being removed from the system altogether. Opening up the remaining primaries would allow people to have their voice be heard and limit the issues they face at the polling locationsStand up and fight for your right to vote!
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Have the State Department investigate why hundreds of thousands of New York voters were purged from the voter rolls.
body: We want the State Department to investigate how and why hundreds of thousands of registered Democrats were purged from the voter roles or had their voter registrations changed without their knowledge in New York State. We call for a re-vote in New York since the election results are inaccurate. Time and time again inaccurate elections results, like in New York and Arizona, have been certified. This is an affront to democracy and threatens the very fabric of what binds us as a nation. In America our votes need to count and voting should be fair, transparent and easy. If a candidate is elected to the presidency that does not reflect the will of the nation, then this great nation has failed is people.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: RESTORE CONSTITUTIONALLY GUARANTEED VOTER RIGHTS FOR PRIMARY ELECTIONS!!
body: THE CONSTITUTION, in the 15th Amendment, guarantees that the "right of citizens of the United States to vote shall not be DENIED or ABRIDGED by the United States or by any STATE". Although political parties are private entities, the nomination process is clearly a public election event, paid for with tax dollars in most cases and regulated by THE STATE through voter registration.When THE STATE does not allow a legally registered voter to participate in a public election, it clearly is ''DENYING'' that citizen his right to vote.THE STATE, by actively changing voter rolls without the consent of the voter, is clearly ''ABRIDGING'' those rights as well.If voting is a form of speech, the 1st Amendment comes into play as well.We can win this fight! This is round one!
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: have United Nations monitor at primary & general election voting  due to obvious election fraud and voters suppression
body: This petition is to request the United Nation Organization to monitor all United States of America primary and national voting places due to obvious election fraud and voter suppression.  Polling and general election voting places require adequate staffing, forms, and functioning voting apparatus to insure every citizen of the USA is guaranteed their right to vote which is guaranteed by the U S Constitution.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Investigate the New York Primary election and why over 100,000 eligible voters where purged from the voter rolls.
body: We want an investigation on how and why hundreds of thousands of registered Democrats were purged from the voter roles or had their voter registrations changed without their knowledge in New York State. We call for a re-vote in New York since the election results are inaccurate. Time and time again inaccurate elections results, like in New York and Arizona, have been certified. This is an affront to democracy and threatens the very fabric of what binds us as a nation. In America our votes need to count and voting should be fair, transparent and easy. If a candidate is elected to the presidency that does not reflect the will of the nation, then this great nation has failed is people.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: ensure that all of the provisional/affadavit ballots cast in NY are counted in full. Give the people their right to vote
body: NY Primaries were not a symbol of democracy for the world. More than 3 million people were denied their right to vote, and those that had to use the courts to assert their rights to vote may well be disenfranchised as well. Without a full and proper vote, the NY Board of Elections audit will not accomplish anything. Voter suppression in New York is not a new thing, and it shouldn't just be another glossed over debacle. When exit polling is as far off as it was, that requires investigation. With a pattern of election problems we've seen this season, we the people find it more than reasonable that this be investigated, all votes are counted, and no one is denied their right to vote. Thank you Mr. President.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Formally acknowledge that the massacre of 1.5 million Armenians by the Ottoman Empire during WW1 was an act of Genocide
body: A century ago the Ottoman government committed one of the greatest atrocities in our history - an attempt was made to annihilate an entire race. About 1.5 million Armenians and other minorities were murdered via drowning, death marches, burning and poisoning in concentration camps.The extermination was systematic and deliberate, the evidence is plentiful and undeniable; it was a genocide. 29 nations, 44 US States, the European Parliament, scholars, historians and politicians, the European Parliament and Pope Francis himself have all affirmed it. In '05, '06 and '08 Senator Obama also affirmed it, calling the facts "undeniable", and promised to acknowledge the genocide as President.It is time to right this moral wrong. We urge the President to formally acknowledge the Armenian Genocide.
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: Officially declare the month of June as Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month nationally.
body: -President Ronald Reagan recognized the need for Myasthenia Gravis Awareness in Proclamation 5261 in 1984 and today non-profit organizations such as Stomp Out MG, the MGFA, & MDA continue this effort. -Myasthenia Gravis (MG) is a rare neuromuscular auto-immune disease that causes weakness of all voluntary muscles. The symptoms can be treated with medications however there is no cure and MG can be fatal.-Roughly 70,000 Americans live with MG, many undiagnosed and untreated due to lack of awareness in the public and professional sectors.-June is known in the MG community as Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month, and we feel it should be declared on a National level.http://myasthenia.orghttps://reaganlibrary.archives.gov/archives/speeches/1984/101584i.htmhttp://facebook.com/StompOutMG
issues: c(311, 18, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Health Care")

title: Ask Obama to call Pat McCrory and tell him he's a piece of sh*t.
body: We believe that HB2 is a terrible, discriminatory law and we ask that President Obama calls North Carolina Governor Pat McCrory and tells him he's "a piece of sh*t" and then hangs up the phone. We then ask that Obama calls back and says, "Oh yeah, one more thing x I hope God steals your penis and you can't use a public restroom in North Carolina till you repeal your awful law, you hate-pandering Junk-Nugget! I'd call you something worse x but Biden is here and I don't want to swear in front of him."
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: INVESTIGATE THE VOTER FRAUD AND VOTER SUPPRESSION IN NEW YORK 4/19/2016 DEMOCRATIC PARTY PRIMARY
body: Petition to have the Obama Administration investigate the voter fraud and voter suppression on 4/19/2016 in New York. Numerous voters who switched from Independent to Democrat by the Oct. deadline were not on the voter list & could not vote and were turned away or given provisional ballots. Many were even refused provisional ballots and had to fight for them. New voters who had registered by the March deadline, in many cases, did not appear on the voter lists. In Kings County alone 126,000 voters were dropped from the list for no reason at all. We the people of the United States of America find this act alarming and would like a complete investigation to uncover the violations that occurred during the NY Primary and prosecute those responsible to the fullest extent of the law.
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: President Barrack Obama Should Pardon Posthumously Reverend Sun Myung Moon before he leaves Office January 17, 2017!
body: As a member of the Family Federation for World Peace and Unification, I believe the 1984 imprisonment of the founder of my faith, the Reverend Sun Myung Moon was politically motivated, discriminatory, and unfair. I am petitioning for his conviction on willful tax evasion, and conspiracy be pardoned posthumously by President Barrack Obama, and his widow  Mrs. Hak Ja Han Moon receive the pardon.  Reverend Sun Myung Moon, his indictment, prosecution,  conviction and imprisonment and subsequent release was a xnear death sentencex for him, his ministry in America, and the millions of followers around the world, who witnessed the American Government, which prides itxs self on  xbeing the champion of religious freedomx persecute a minority religion.  Please support this petition for this pardon.
issues: c(311, 321, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: States where tax dollars are used for primaries either must be fully open primaries or can not be tax funded.
body: In many states around the nation there are closed primaries that deny millions of voters from being able to partake in the process. This only hurts voter participation. Furthermore, these primaries are funded via tax payer money which results in a problem of taxation without representation. Our founding fathers went to war over the British Empire over such an issue, our states should reflect the Founder's principles and assure that, if they are to get tax payer money for elections or any primary system, that everyone be given the option to vote in EVERY party's primary process. Not just one. The fear of a "sabotage" from the "other" has never been statistically proven, it should not be used here.
issues: c(306, 311, 336) c("Budget & Taxes", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Help the Vietnamese people to prevent environmental disaster in Ha Tinh province, Central Vietnam
body: Ha Tinh province is home to an economic zone which covers numerous industrial plants, including a multi-billion dollar steel plant run by Formosa conglomerate.Tonnes of fish, including rare species which live far offshore and in the deep, have been discovered on beaches along the countryxs central coastal provinces of Ha Tinh, Quang Tri, Quang Binh and Hue.People suspects that the sewage with harmful chemicals released from the steal plants contaminates the coastline causing massive fish deaths along the countryxs central coast in recent days.We the People ask the Federal Government help the people of Vietnam by providing independent Environmental Impact Assessment of the Steel Plant and President Obama to raise the issue with Vietnamese Government in May 2016 visit.
issues: c(311, 296, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: CALL ON CONGRESS TO HOLD A FAIR AND FREE EMERGENCY REVOTE OF THE 2016 DEMOCRATIC PRIMARIES DUE TO PROVEN ELECTION FRAUD
body: Comparing exit polling data to actual results in the democratic primaries, we see a continual pattern where Hillary Clinton outperforms exit polling data. This, coupled with documentation and reports indicating hundreds of thousands of registered dems being purged from electronic systems in multiple states, being forced to vote with affidavit ballots which may or may not be counted, and countless instances of voter suppression such as five hour lines in Arizona, is unacceptable. Therefore We The People demand our government disregard this primary as illegitimate, and hold an emergency REVOTE by paper. We demand answers by May 15. Pursuant to our constitutional rights, the alternative is an immediate dissolving of our federal government for illegitimacy and inaction. Signed: We The People
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Vietnamese fish massacre by the Formosa Steel Company and its impacts on our environment and economy. Please save us!!!
body: Vietnam lies the multi-billion-dollar steel plant in Ha Tinh province, owned by Taiwan Formosa Ha Tinh Steel Corporation. This company has been using unsafe dumping procedures and causing a collapse in the aquatic life along the coasts of the provinces Ha Tinh, Quang Tri, Quang Binh, and Hue and it is still spreading. Thousands of tons of dead fish wash ashore suddenly. As a result, the economical wellbeing of these provinces is damaged. All the related business such as fishermen, fish retailers and restaurant have to stop their business. Formosa  was so arrogant to say that xor choose the factory, or choose the fish". The citizens of Vietnam are worried that the situation will get worse and what if there will be people die. We really need help, and someone to take a stand in our defense.
issues: c(311, 316, 296) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Energy & Environment")

title: CALL TO ACTION: Restore the VRA, open voting primaries in all 50 states and automatic voter registration at 18.
body: Restore Voting Rights Act of 1965: Supreme Court gutted a main part of the law which allows states to make their own voting laws without federal approval. If other states follow suit, we will be seeing more and more corruption. We want the VRA restored for the sake of democracy in America.Open voting primaries all 50 states: Millions of voters are left out of the voting process when primaries are closed, specifically Independents and Unaffiliated. We are proposing to have it federally put into law on a national scale. All 50 states must have open primaries so everyone can vote for the candidate of their choice.Automatic voter registration when you turn 18: We should implement a national system that will automatically register every person on their 18th birthday with no party affiliation.
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Create mandatory 20-year sentence for any law enforcement officer who denies due process by killing an unarmed person.
body: For decades the citizens have been told by the government that long mandatory sentences provide a deterrent to those bent on committing criminal acts. We demand the federal government move to curtail the epidemic of police murders by immediately instituting legislation at a federal level that imposes a twenty-year mandatory minimum sentence upon any law enforcement officer that kills an unarmed citizen under any circumstance and a ten-year mandatory minimum sentence upon any government employee that assists in the cover-up of such a crime. The constant killing of unarmed citizens has lead to an epidemic of US citizens being forcibly denied their inalienable right to due process as outlined by the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments to the United States Constitution.
issues: c(311, 321, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: President Obama: dump Debbie, indict Hillary, endorse Bernie.
body: President Obama: Debbie Wasserman Shultz, under your leadership, is destroying the future of the Democratic Party.  Reconfigure or replace her.  Hillary Clinton, with your support, has and continues to meet and exceed all criticisms you leveled at her when you ran against her for election.  See to it she's held accountable to the highest legal and judicial standards in all investigations involving her, immediately.  Reaffirm why we voted for you, twice.  Hope and change.  Endorse Bernie Sanders.  We need him.  We want him.  We will remember for all time how you chose to respond to us.
issues: c(311, 316, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: End transgender discrimination in all health insurance programs
body: Health is a special concern to transgender Americans. We are faced with routine discrimination in health insurance even after the Affordable Care Act. This discrimination comes in the form of insurance exclusions against procedures and treatments deemed necessary by respected American and international health organizations and transgender healthcare providers. These exclusions exist solely because of philosophical conclusions and not established medical facts regarding the special needs of transgender health care. We ask for nationwide coverage of medically necessary reassignment, facial, and breast surgeries along with coverage for hormone therapy and transgender mental health services. Our insurance should cover the care deemed necessary and in many cases life saving by our physicians.
issues: c(311, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care")

title: End the Genocide against the Igbo people of Nigeria by the Fulani Herdsmen
body: There is a deafening silence by the government of Nigeria on the continuous massacre of Igbo people and some others by the notorious Fulani herdsmen. Hundreds of people are being killed daily and their farmlands being forcefully taken by these murderous herdsmen. The Nigerian government is not protecting these helpless Nigerians. Children, women and men have been killed and properties including churches are being destroyed.
issues: c(311, 24, 331) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Gun Violence")

title: We, Vietnamese Americans and Friends, ask Mr. Obama to address the issue of freedom and basic human rights for  Vietnam
body: In Vietnam, people expressing basic human rights, such as religious freedom, freedom of expression, right to live under a free, clean, and healthy environment are being  suppressed, forbidden and severely prosecuted.We ask Mr. President on his upcoming trip to Vietnam in May 2016 to address these issues with the leading communist authorities in Vietnam.  We demand that the US government does not give any favorable treatment to the communist nation until such basic rights are available to all people who live in Vietnam, just like we have them here in our United States of America and all over the Free World
issues: c(311, 24, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Veterans & Military")

title: We the people ask the federal government to legalize cockfighting in the United States.
body: Cockfighting in the United States has been banned since 1978. It is time we stand up for our rights as American citizens! All the animal right's groups see is the actual fighting. The groups do not see the passion that the men and women put into their birds! They spend countless hours and thousands of dollars getting the birds in tip top shape. The birds are not just yard pets, but to many they are a way of life. I would much rather my son be in the yard playing with roosters and hens, instead of dealing drugs on the street corner! The government is allowed to send our sons and daughters to war with no promise to come back, but we can't do the same with our birds! PLEASE help legalize cockfighting in the United States!
issues: c(306, 311, 133) c("Budget & Taxes", "Civil Rights & Equality", "Rural Policy")

title: Protest no human rights in China!Protest China's judicial's corruption and the collusion of government & enterprise!
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Extend an Invitation to Leicester City to Visit the White House for their Historic Premier League Victory
body: Leicester City's Premiership victory is making shock waves worldwide for the right reasons. Their victory is already hailed as the biggest upset in the history of team sports. The significance of their victory cannot be understated. It has brought happiness and joys to soccer fans worldwide. Inspired by their victory, millions of children will take up this sport. Millions of ordinary people will wake up tomorrow believing that they can defy the odds to realize their dreams. This victory is the triumph of determination, hard work and team spirit over big money that has damaged soccer so much past few years. To invite Leicester to the White House is to recognize their exceptional achievement and to send a message to every corner of the world: Believe In Your Dream - Everything Is Possible.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 316, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Education")

title: Award Prince Rogers Nelson the Presidential Medal of Freedom for his musical, artistic and philanthropic contributions
body: Prince Rogers Nelson, known as xPrincex should be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom. A true revolutionary, his influence on rock, pop, R&B, jazz and funk exploded onto and shaped the musical landscape of the 1980s and beyond. Originator of the xMinneapolis Soundx, Prince used his love of musical instruments and sound production to create a uniqueness all his own. Dubbed xMozart of the Modern Agex, his joyful and prolific outpouring of music culminated in no fewer than 39 albums, 136 music videos and 3 major motion pictures. His quiet philanthropy was boundless; he used his music to contribute to those in need on a local, national and international level. While living, he became an American icon. Princexs inarguable contributions to music are both indelible and immeasurable.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 301) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Innovation: Arts & Technology")

title: Official apology for Chinese Exclusion Act 1882
body: In the spirit of Asian Heritage month of May,  WE the undersigned request Pres Obama to officially apologize on behalf of the United States of America for the Chinese Exclusion Act of 1882.   The Chinese are the only ethnicity ever excluded officially from immigrating to the United States by an act of Congress, though it was repealed in 1943, only 105 Chinese were allowed to enter the country per year,  it wasn't until 1965 that full immigration was afforded the Chinese.  The US Congress led by Rep. Judy Chu passed a resolution of "Regret" in 2012 but it falls well short of an apology to the many families separated for decades because of this "Yellow Peril Era" law.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 29) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Immigration")

title: Trouble Sleeping and Relaxing?
body: There are more people and technology creating a noisier world every consecutive day and night. We the people petition congress and Obama Administration to pass H.R. 3384 Quiet Communities Act of 2015. Millions of Americans are negatively impacted by noise that enters our homes, private property and relaxing public spaces. Passage reopens avenues to minimize the impact that technology and population growth have on our health and freedom to enjoy personal spaces by investigating, understanding, and seeking ways to eliminate all unnecessary noise. Noise pollution impacts our health, our economy, and the American quality of life. Itxs time we joined the enlightened and civilized world that stands up against noise pollution and treats others as they would want to be treated themselves.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 341, 346) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Technology & Innovation", "Transportation & Infrastructure")

title: Vietnamese ask Mr. Obama to raise the issue of environment and human rights on upcoming visit to Vietnam on May 2016
body: Dear Mr. President. Cause of the mass fish die-offs in central seas of Vietnam with the governmentxs slow response and lack of transparency, Vietnamese have used peace demonstration on 1st May and 8th May 2016 in some cities to ask for governmentxs official statements and solutions. In answering, the Vietnam government has used their law-enforcers and peace-keepers to aggressively beat, assault, disperse the protestersx peaceful demonstrations. We are ready to provide evidence of using violence by Vietnam officials. We strongly ask Mr. President to raise these issues in the meeting with the leading communist authorities. Please do not support them presenting in any international events and forums which relates to human rights until they are abided by fundamental human rights. Sincerely
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 296) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment")

title: Assign a Special Prosecutor to the Clinton Investigation - The DOJ holds a conflict of interest
body: Should the FBI move to prosecute Hillary Clinton due to her use of a private email/server, a special prosecutor should be assigned. The DOJ employs a sizeable number of individuals who've donated to the Clinton Campaign. Many of them have donated the maximum allowable amount of $2,700 -(http://www.opensecrets.org/) Loretta Lynch is affiliated with Hillary Clinton  via Bill Clinton; who appointed her  the U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of New York in 1999. Objectively speaking, Loretta Lynch and her history with the Clintons could potentially cause a conflict of interest. To allow Loretta Lynch and the DOJ to handle this is not in the best interests of the American People. We, The American People, demand that this case is handled in a manner  in which true justice is the priority.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 321, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Take your hands off our kids
body: CNN just reported that "Obama administration to issue guidance on transgender access to school bathrooms".As a father of two, I am deeply concerned about what is so called "bathroom law" starts to erode our school system. First of all, I agree with that we should not discriminate against transgender students. However, on the other hand, it is completely wrong to sacrifice the safety of the majority of the non-transgender students to implement this. NO students should be allowed to go to the bathroom opposite to their biological gender. The "bathroom law" will leave space to sex predators and this will cause confusions of our students about sex identities. Please take your hands off our children, if you cannot protect them, at least do NOT hurt them.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education")

title: Uphold International Law! Stop Shielding Dow Chemical from Accountability for Corporate Crimes in Bhopal, India
body: In 1984 a factory majority-owned by Union Carbide (UCC, a US corporation) leaked toxic gas in Bhopal, India, killing 8K-10K people instantly & maiming 500K more. India charged UCC with manslaughter, but UCC refused to show for trial. Dow Chemical bought UCC in 2001 but has not made UCC available to face charges. Under a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty, India sent 4 notices to the US Dept. of Justice to summon Dow to explain UCCxs whereabouts. The DoJ has ignored or obstructed every notice. The same DoJ made BP pay $4 billion in criminal fines and penalties for Deepwater Horizon. 31 years of US protection of UCC and Dow must end. We insist that the US govt. meet its obligations under Treaty & international law by immediately serving notice upon Dow to attend court in Bhopal on July 13, 2016.
petition_type: 276 Tell us what the federal government is doing about an issue
issues: c(311, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy")

title: Support and approve HR3744 The Venezuelan refugee assistance act
body: Please support H.R 3744 to protect the lives of Venezuelans living in the United States of America and grant them permanent residence. These Venezuelans have been forced to remain here undocumented because their lives would be in serious danger if they return to their home country. It has been proven by world organizations such as Human Rights Watch, that the Venezuelan government violates, tortures & kills its own citizens. Within this small group of Venezuelans that would benefit from this law, the majority have completed a higher education and will contribute greatly to this nation if given the chance and they get their Green Card.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 326, 29) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Immigration")

title: Investigation into alleged fraud in presidential elections in Dominican Republic 2016
body: Dominican Republic was celebrating his presidential , congressional and municipal elections. In the first bulletin which gave winner to 30mins closed the electoral process the current president Danilo Medina, and that bulletin had serious errors that once rectified these send to a runoff election. with a very large difference unjustified votes.We need your help to avoid a dictatorship and that our country can have full democracy and security suidadana. we need your intervention.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: A law allowing me to slap anyone who makes a false and hypocritical religious freedom claim
body: A new law should be passed that says that anyone who thinks the Supreme Court was wrong to remove government-mandated prayer and Bible reading from public schools can never, ever talk about religious freedom without me being allowed to slap the crap out of them.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Human Rights Violation: Plea for Justice for Ven. Dhammajayo, Denied Reasonable Accommodation as a Defendant
body: On May 17th, 2016 Thailandxs Department of Special Investigations (DSI) issued an arrest warrant for Ven. Dhammajayo, the abbot of Thailandxs largest buddhist temple. This warrant is grounded on the abbot not appearing for a summons in a controversial case in which many people say he is wrongfully accused. However, the abbot did not ignore the summons but simply requested that DSI interview the abbot at the temple due to doctor verified life-threatening medical illnesses, a basic human right in which he was refused. Because DSI has ignored the rights of ill defendants for reasonable accommodation, we believe the Thai DSI has acted unlawfully and in gross violation of patient and human rights. We respectfully request the White House to look into this issue and condemn this violation.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 321, 24) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Foreign Policy")

title: Get Persons With Disabilities OFF.THE.FLOOR. of Public Restrooms: Accessibility for ALL
body: The problem is the invasion of privacy and risk of physical harm that arises when assisting individuals with disabilities with their toileting needs in public restrooms, specifically toddlers to adults who are non-ambulatory. I have a 12 year old son who is now 76 lbs. and 54 in. tall. He has Spastic Quad Cerebral Palsy. He has a diagnosis of incontinence and requires the use of diapers. He also uses a wheelchair. Baby changing tables in public restrooms are not suitable for those who are unable to use the restroom themselves or those who are still in diapers and cannot use the toilet. Caregivers worldwide are changing their loved ones on filthy restroom floors.  This is unsanitary, dangerous, & undignified. It's discrimination and violates their civil rights. There's no equality!
petition_type: 281 Change an existing Administration policy
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: ADA: Install adult changing tables in public restrooms for incontinent individuals with severe disabilities.
body: Public restrooms should be equipped with adult changing tables for non-ambulatory individuals requiring diaper changes and total care. Airports, hotels, malls, stores, parks, tourist attractions, movie theaters, schools, medical offices and hospitals, do not provide the proper accommodations and modifications for persons with severe disabilities. No child, teen or adult deserves to be placed on a dirty restroom floor or be openly displayed in a public place for a diaper change, nor should they suffer sitting in a soiled diaper for any amount of time, simply because there are no adult changing tables in public restrooms. We need to treat all individuals with disabilities with the dignity they deserve and ensure the ADA civil rights law that was enacted in 1990 to protect them, is enforced.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care")

title: Investigate Stolen Funds Kept in United States by Nigerian Politicians
body: This petition reduces corruption; increases transparency; and indirectly reduces terrorism
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 24, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Fix the federal government's mistake on the immigration status of Adriana Aldana and keep the Aldana-Ramos family intact
body: A government employee made a mistake on the work permit application of one Adriana Aldana in 2012 and she has now had to pay thousands of dollars in efforts to rectify the situation caused by the government under threat of deportation and has been unable to work as she unfairly does not have a work permit, through no fault of her own.  In addition, her husband and children are US citizens and she has lived in this country for 25 years with the correct paperwork.  She filed the forms correctly and on time and is now in legal limbo as a result of a government mistake.  No one in our government will help her or give a straight answer to her question on how to rectify this mistake.
petition_type: 276 Tell us what the federal government is doing about an issue
issues: c(311, 29) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Immigration")

title: STOP THE KREMLIN GANGSTERS!!!!! BRING PUTIN AND HIS HENCHMEN WHO TERRORIZE RUSSIA AND THE WORLD TO JUSTICE!!!
body: We, the citizens of the USA and the world, plead the US administration to take all actions necessary to neutralize the corrupt Kremlin regime  and bring them to justice.Vladimir Putin is a person who orders the murders of his opposition in Russia as well as abroad. He also sponsors international terrorist groups and is a thief and a corrupt politician.We ask for a full investigation into the crimes of the Kremlin,  to put sanctions against all of the Russian government officials, turn off Russia from SWIFT,  and to embargo all trade on oil and other products from Russia.Also we ask to arrest Putin,  Medvedev,  Shoigu, Lavrov and all the others responsible for the destruction of the civilian boeing craft flying over Donbas in July 2014 and bring them to The Hague Court.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 24, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Officially Declare June National Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
body: -President Ronald Reagan recognized the need for Myasthenia Gravis Awareness in Proclamation 5261 in 1984 and today non-profit organizations such as Stomp Out MG, the MGFA, & MDA continue this effort.-Myasthenia Gravis (MG) is a rare neuromuscular auto-immune disease that causes weakness of all voluntary muscles. The symptoms can be treated with medications however there is no cure and MG can be fatal.-Roughly 70,000 Americans live with MG, many undiagnosed and untreated due to lack of awareness in the public and professional sectors.-June is known in the MG community as Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month, and we feel it should be declared on a National level.http://myasthenia.orghttps://reaganlibrary.archives.gov/archives/speeches/1984/101584i.htmhttp://facebook.com/StompOutMG
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 18, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Health Care")

title: No pardons for the Clintons.
body: President Obama,Please publicly affirm that you will not grant any pardons to anyone with the last name "Clinton".This will send a strong message to the World that our justice system can change; that the embarrassing and immoral status quo of "You get the justice you can afford" can be a thing of the past. If any crimes were committed, the American people deserve to see justice applied blindly as intended. If you do the crime, you should do the time regardless of wealth or status. Under the law, all citizens deserve the same protections as well as to face the the same jeopardy.You can set this critical precedent to help (as you are fond of quoting and paraphrasing MLK) bend the arc of history towards justice. I hope you have the courage to take this bold action to do so.

title: EQUAL RIGHTS FOR PATIENTS WITH CHROMOSOMAL ABNORMALITIES
body: Each and every day, mothers are giving birth to special miracle babies with chromosomal abnormalities (specifically Trisomy18), that have beat the odds of being carried full term only to be discriminated against by doctors, hospitals, and especially health insurance companies. Common side effects of T-18 need to be considered for treatment independently from the overall chromosomal abnormality. Too often, T-18 has become the primary reason for denial of critical surgeries and procedures that can save these innocent lives. A prime example of this is Jonah Puruleski who is currently at Motts Childrens Hospital in Ann Arbor Michigan while Priority Health refuses to cover a surgical team in Ohio to perform the life saving surgery that Jonah needs. Facebook: Jonahs Journey with Trisomy 18

title: Disqualify Hillary Clinton from the 2016 Presidential Election for knowingly circumventing and violating FOIA
body: We demand that Hillary Clinton be immediately disqualified for the 2016 Presidential Election. She and complicit persons in her State Dept. knowingly circumvented and violated the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). They did this when: they did not disclose the existence of her server (which was used for government work); when they did not turn over the records of her emails after leaving office; and when they lost and/or possibly omitted records of other emails. This was not simply a problem with record-keeping, as the State Dept. has argued; Clinton and others deliberately disregarded one of the most important pieces of U.S. legislation - FOIA - which provides transparency, allows us to question the behavior and decisions of our representatives, and enables us to better our government.

title: Celebrate and acknowledge millions of multiracial Americans and families by making Loving Day a federal observance
body: There are 22 million multiracial Americans (6.9% from Pew Research), comparable to the Asian American population (5.6%), and growing 3 times faster than the U.S. as a whole.There are 32 million interracial or interethnic married couple households (10% from the U.S. Census). Those numbers have grown 28% over a decade. Despite those numbers, we have struggled with racial discrimination from all sides. We have been underrepresented in public policy, health care issues, media, and more. We ask the federal government to lead the change by acknowledging us.We honor Loving v. Virginia, the 1967 Supreme Court decision that ended laws against multiracial families. Please join our community, government leaders, and organizations by celebrating its June 12th anniversary as Loving Day.

title: Fix our children's Hearing Aid Crisis in the 30 states that don't have mandated hearing aid coverage.
body: Believe it or not 30 of 50 states do not have mandatory hearing aid coverage for children under 18. Families in these states are expected to pay thousands of dollars for their child to have access to speech and environmental awareness. Those hearing aid costs (hearing aid, repairs and molds) also do not apply to a families out of pocket expense. Families have often relied on charities to donate older second-hand/refurbished hearing aids. This leaves children vulnerable to inconsistent access to speech and sound awareness. Several states that lack these hearing aid safe gaurds for deaf and hard of hearing children are proposing a visual langauge (ASL) to fix the language deprivation that is identified in their states. Our children need equal access to speech. Please give our kids a voice!

It does not equally evaluate students because everyone learns in their own way. To resolve this major issue, we must limit the time we spend taking these tests. title: Reinstate the Federal Assault Weapons Ban
body: On September 13, 1994, President Bill Clinton signed the Federal Assault Weapons Ban into law, restricting "the manufacture, transfer, and possession of semi-automatic assault weapons except for: those already in lawful possession at the time of the law's enactment; 660 rifles and shotguns listed by type and name; permanently inoperable, manually operated, or antique firearms; rifles unable to accept a detachable magazine of more than five rounds; shotguns unable to hold more than five rounds in a fixed or detachable magazine; and those made for, transferred to, or owned by the U.S. government or a U.S. law enforcement agency"-Wikipedia. After the horrific events of the Orlando Shootings at both a concert and nightclub, America is crying out for anything that can prevent another tragedy

title: Replace recommendation to lift 1985 ban on blood donation for men who have had sex with men
body: In December of 2015, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration published a report to change their 1985 recommendation to ban blood donation for men who have had sex with men (MSM) since 1977. As an attempt to prevent the spread of HIV through blood donation, the 1985 prohibition has been identified by the American Red Cross as "medically and scientifically unwarranted".  The current FDA recommendation still bans men who have had homosexual intercourse within the past year. The banning of blood donation for MSM can no longer be considered an act of medical concern. It is  an issue of discrimination based on sexual identity. The White House should ask the FDA to revise their updated policy and demand blood banks across the nation to accept donations from healthy gay men.

Shortly thereafter, the Westboro Baptist Church (WBC) endorsed this IS-supported act of domestic terrorism. Under 18 U.S.C. 2339B, any person who gives "material support" to a "designated foreign terrorist organization", of which IS is one, knowing that group is engaged in "terrorism," may be imprisoned up to 20 years, or if the death of a person results, up to life in prison. Probable cause exists that Westboro did provide "material support"; for IS by endorsing its actions, and giving IS "aid and comfort." title: Raise the Rainbow flag alongside the U.S. flag above the White House to honor the victims of Orlando
body: On July 14, 1920 President Wilson took the unprecedented action of flying the U.S. and French flags together above the White House to show solidarity between our two nations following the horror of the first World War.  The terrorizing of innocent people in Orlando -- the worst mass shooting in U.S. history -- has brought unspeakable violence and horror to the LGBT community.  Like President Wilson, President Obama has an  opportunity to adapt our normal flag protocol in response to this horrific event.   He should order the raising of the Rainbow flag to half-staff alongside the American flag above the White House to both honor the fallen in Orlando and symbolize our national pride in all our citizens during this period of great tragedy.

body: This petition is very important to keep the Integrity of our laws and values intact. In the past couple days Harvard University has confirmed that Hillary Clinton and the  DNC Were In Cahoots to steal the demacratic election ( which they have). If nothing is done on this issue it will do nothing but encourage the next person that runs for president to steal the election because they can get away with it. There is 100% undisputable proof that this happened including the leaked documents from the dnc's own database. As americans we must stand up and say NO in the face of corruption and thievery. Another  benefit of doing this would be to show politicians that they cannot still elections anymore.

issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Urge the Chinese Government to allow Human Rights activist Guo Feixiong to get compassionate release and medical care.
body: Guo Feixiong is a human rights activist in China. He was arrested and sentenced to jail for 11 years totally. Now he is ill, but the Chinese authorities took advantage of his sickness and forced a humiliating rectal exam on him, recorded it, and threatened to post it online. This humiliation caused Guo to start a hunger strike on May 9th, and today is the 42th day. He is in a very poor health condition. He has received repeated humiliations in jail, and the jail tries to hide these facts from the public. We donxt want Guo Feixiong to die like Cao Shunli in 2014 due to the lack of medical care. Hence we start a petition to urge President Obama to use the Special Procedures communications to call for a compassionate release of Guo Feixiong so he can get an independent medical treatment.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 24, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Foreign Policy", "Health Care")

title: BILL-H.R.1807- The Reauthorization of the Sickle Cell Disease Prevention and Treatment Demonstration Program
body: The bill amends the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize sickle cell disease(SCD) research, surveillance, prevention and treatment. It also aims to establish full funding for twenty-five (25) Sickle Cell Treatment Centers throughout the US. H.R. 1807 requires continued authorization for community-based organization (CBO) collaborative programs to improve medical and support services delivered to affected individuals, and expanded eligibility beyond Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHC). The bill will provide a better quality of life for an estimated  90,000 individuals in the US who have SCD; and another 3 million trait carriers. This Bill will prevent sickle cell sufferers from traveling hundreds of miles for basic health care and save lives in many unfunded and remote areas.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 25, 175) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care", "Urban Policy")

title: Complete and release the criminal investigation of Hillary Clinton before the Democratic National Convention
body: Now that President Obama has endorsed Hillary Clinton for President, the integrity of the administration, and the FBI, has been put at stake concerning the FBI's criminal investigation of Former Secretary Clinton.  If the FBI completes its investigation, and releases its findings, before the Democratic National Convention, then the delegates chosen by the people will pick the party nominee with full knowledge of this investigation's findings.  If released after the convention, and the party nominee is forced to withdraw as a result, party leaders and internal party procedures will select the nominee.  The integrity of the administration, the FBI, and our entire electoral process is at stake.  The President must ensure that this investigation will be concluded and released before the DNC.
petition_type: 276 Tell us what the federal government is doing about an issue
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Increase the racial diversity in NBA and NFL
body: Recently the Supreme Court upheld UT-Austinxs program for increasing student diversity partly based on race.   We support this action to give students of different race have "equal" opportunity to receive education.  However, we also noticed the extreme racial unbalance in sports leagues like NBA and NFL.  Asians are especially under-represented in these sports leagues.   We noticed that NFL has implemented policy to interview black coaches first when hiring coaches.   As Asian American we love sports and got irritated that these leagues don't recruit more Asian players.   We want the government to pressure these leagues to implement affirmative action to recruit players based on race so that there are equal percentage of Asian players in these leagues.   Asian kids' opportunity counts.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 316, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Education")

title: Stop the reduction of BAH to married military to military couples/ single military members sharing the same residence.
body: The Senate Armed Services Committee has inserted language in its version of the fiscal 2016 defense authorization bill that will directly impact dual-military married couples and single military members that share a residence. The Senate bill, in both circumstances of having dependents or not, would allow only the higher-ranking member in dual-service marriage to draw any BAH, though at the higher with-dependents rate. The other military member would be ineligible for BAH taking away compensation promised upon enlistment. This housing compensation levels military pay with civilian pay. Ultimately this bill would suggest a 2 for 1 deal. That ones service member is less worthy of pay than another. The proposed changes will impact members in a devastating loss of pay impacting the mission.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 326, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Veterans & Military")

title: Allow the Angeles Crest 100 Mile Endurance Run to Maintain and Use Trails in the Pleasant View Ridge Wilderness
body: The Angeles Crest 100 Mile Endurance Run (AC100) has been a community event held in the San Gabriel Mountains for the past 29 years. It brings together runners and volunteers to help maintain trails and run 100 miles on foot from Wrightwood to Altadena, CA. Since 1985, over 20,000 hours of trail work have been completed by AC100. When the President established the San Gabriel Mountains National Monument, the Angeles National Forest changed their position on allowing the foot race to use the trails that they maintain in the Pleasant View Ridge Wilderness. We petition that the President allow an exception for AC100 to use these trails and to continue its conservation efforts in maintaining the trails and using them to build character and camaraderie through running and volunteering.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 296, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Ensure Inclusive and Equitable Quality Sexual Education in the United States!
body: I want schools in the United States to implement LGBT education into their health education courses. It is of great importance for future generations of our youth that education and information are provided for the LGBT youth across the United States, as a whole. If a new policy were to be set in place by congress in regards to this issue, the overall health and well being of many of the LGBT youth will increase. In addition to that, the heterosexual youth will understand the struggles that the LGBT community face. If the US government does not act on this issue, than many of our youth today and in future generations will be in the dark when it comes to LGBT matters; additionally, bullying and discrimination will continue in our schools against the LGBT community.

title: A CALL ON CONGRESS TO ACT TO ENSURE ABORTION FACILITIES MEET THE STANDARDS OF AMBULATORY SURGICAL CENTERS
body: As human rights activists and former abortion industry workers, we know the deplorable conditions of unregulated abortion facilities. We the undersigned ask the White House to call on Congress to act to ensure that abortion facilities meet the standards of Ambulatory Surgical Centers. This is common sense and pro-woman.  Action is needed because:1. Making all surgery as safe as possible for women is common sense and pro-woman.2. Every woman undergoing a highly invasive surgery should be assured by law that it is being performed safely, and that the doctor has admitting privileges at a local hospital in case something goes wrong. 3. Abortion facilities should not be allowed to subject women to subpar safety standards.

issues: c(311, 18, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Health Care")

title: Cats as a service animal
body: Trained Service Cats should have the same level of status as a service dog or horse.  A cat has many of the same abilities of a dog but for a lot of people they are easier to maintain.  Not everyone needs an animal to guide them, pull them or pick up items.  A cat can do such important things such as warn a person if they are going to have a seizure, alert those with hearing impairments, if someone has low or high blood sugar.  This is just a few examples of what a service cat can provide.  For some good examples of trained cats please visit YouTube and search xTrained Catsx. By signing this petition we can get cats certified as a service animal and this would open up the world to many people that now are restricted from enjoying the life others take for granted.

issues: c(311, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Health Care")
