title: Declassify cloth menstrual pads as medical devices!
body: Since the 1990s, reusable cloth menstrual pads have been legally considered a medical device by the FDA.  This means that, in order to be a compliant seller, any person who sells cloth pads must pay the FDA upwards of $4,000 a year. The vast majority of cloth menstrual pad seamstresses are work at home persons, typically mothers and disabled persons. Not only must we pay taxes on our handmade products, but we are expected to cover outrageous fees as well. This fee shuts down many U.S. small businesses & prevents WAHPs from making a living. Cloth pads are nothing more than underwear inserts. They are not medical devices. They should be considered the same as selling clothing. We ask that you declassify cloth pads from being considered medical devices and remove the FDA's  fee.
petition_type: 281 Change an existing Administration policy
issues: c(311, 316, 25) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Economy & Jobs", "Health Care")

title: Posthumously award the Presidential Medal of Freedom to the 29 Thiokol Chemical Plant Workers.
body: Twenty-nine civilian Thiokol Chemical Plant workers sacrificed their lives in Woodbine, Georgia on February 3, 1971 and are deserving of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.  This brave, predominately female workforce was dedicated to the mission of manufacturing and supplying US soldiers with munitions for conflict in Vietnam.   The 81mm, trip flares, CS-gas, and other materials of their hazardous labor caused the escalation of a small fire resulting in an explosion that claimed the 29 lives. Their effort in the defense of democracy and the liberation of South Vietnam exemplifies their resilience, patriotism and dedication.  They are role models who leave a valued legacy of love and respect for the freedom of all mankind.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 18, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Veterans & Military")

We are calling on our President to send the Justice department as soon as possible , to spearhead and oversee every single aspect of this investigation , the prosecution, and all things related to the Alton Sterling's murder. title: Revoke Hillary Clinton's security clearance and cease providing Hillary Clinton with customary intelligence briefings
body: In a tradition dating back to 1952, Presidential candidates receive their own top-secret intelligence briefings. We call on the Obama administration to: 1) cease providing Hillary Clinton with these customary briefings; 2) clarify whether Presidential candidates require security clearance in order to receive these briefings; 3) and revoke Hillary Clinton's security clearance.While the FBI has declined to recommend criminal prosecution of Clinton, Director Comey made it clear that extreme carelessness in handling very sensitive , highly classified information often subjects the individual to security or administrative sanctions. Clinton's mishandling of information, and lying about that mishandling to the American people, requires swift, stern, non-partisan action by the Administration.

issues: c(311, 336, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Petition to create a nationwide, elected, and publicly reviewed Police Oversight Agency
body: As of this writing, 559 American civilians have been killed by police officers in the year 2016. The American people have had enough. We propose the creation of a nationwide, elected, and publicly reviewed Police Oversight Agency to set new standards and protocols for police conduct and enforce said standards and protocols.The proposed Police Oversight Agency will be responsible for:- Overseeing the hiring of police officers of all ranks to ensure that each police department has a diverse staff to reflect the constituents of its county;- Establishing and enforcing new standards and protocols for police conduct;- Publishing hirings, standards/protocols, enforcements, and updates to a publicly accessible website.Sign this petition if you believe the police need oversight.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 336, 331) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Gun Violence")

title: Police Brutality | State of Emergency
body: On 7/5/16 Alton Sterling of Baton Rouge, LA was shot, while pinned to the ground, by officers Blane Salamoni and Howie Lake II of the BRPD. In less than 48-hours, on 7/6/16, Philando Castile was shot, through his car window, by a police officer in Falcon Heights, MN. Both victims were Black men, and their aggressors white police officers. Both tragedies were recorded, and viewed with international outrage.In light of the disproportionate killings of Black Americans at the hands of police officers, yearly, these underwriters petition the Federal Government to declare a State of Emergency on police brutality against Black citizens - if current conditions continue as they are we risk the state of a complete erosion of faith in the very government that was created in order to keep us safe.

title: Incorporate the United States Digital Service as the technology component of the Puerto Rico Fiscal Control Board
body: Puerto Rico is facing serious financial and political challenges.  With the recently passed Puerto Rico Oversight, Management, and Economic Stability Act, there is no bigger inflection point to take advantage of building new digital institutions that will genuinely allow the effective redesign of government operations.The Federal Government must include members with the technological expertise and cultural sensitivity to understand Puerto Ricoxs social and economic hardships and translate those into tangible solutions.  Architecting modern digital services as part of the assistance initiatives for Puerto Rico represents a clear chance to work together to build an awesome future for Puerto Rico, and set a real example of disruptive -yet very necessary- technological collaboration.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 336, 341) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Technology & Innovation")

title: Replace Paid Administrative Leave with Unpaid Suspension For Law Enforcement Officers Involved in Shootings
body: We are calling for all States and Law Enforcement agencies to enact a new policy. If a Law Enforcement Officer discharges his weapon and it results in bodily harm and/or death; rather than being placed on xPaid Administrative Leavex the Officer should be immediately placed on an xUnpaid Suspensionx. At the conclusion of an investigation if it is found that the Law Enforcement Officerxs use of force was justifiable, then and only at that time should they be approved to receive their compensation (retroactively).

title: After being found guilty of negligence, officers should be permanently removed from the police force.
body: After the recent murder of Alton Sterling, a concern has been raised. Confirmed reports were released that an officer involved in the Sterling shooting was suspended in 2014. Two years ago, Officer Howie Lake was suspended for his involvement in the shooting of an African American man. Americans are frustrated that officers who were placed on administrative leave for negligence can return to their jobs and presumably put more lives at risk. Concerned Americans, like myself, are asking the federal government to propose a new administrative policy which guarantees that officers found guilty of negligence, should be indefinitely removed from the police force and prohibited from working in any law enforcement agency in the future. No more lives should be taken due to blatant neglect.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 336, 331) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Gun Violence")

title: Petition For Universal Recognition of Statexs Concealed Weapon Permits and an Interim Federal Concealed  Weapon Permit
body: We respectfully request a call to Congress for legislation that would require every state to recognize and honor licenses for concealed firearms carry issued by every other state.  A Concealed Weapons Permit issued by one state needs to be recognized universally within all states in the same way that all states recognize every other states' driverxs licenses. We also ask the President to create a federal Concealed Weapons Permit (CWP) by Executive Order.  The CWP would be issued to citizens until, or in lieu of, legislation requiring universal recognition of state concealed carry licenses.  In doing so, the government should adopt the 'shall carry' standard. CWP issuance should be based on ATF Form 4473 criteria and must not be based on income, race, occupation, or sexual orientation
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 336, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Light up the White House in the Iraqi Flag Colors in Memory of the Victims of Terrorism in Iraq
body: Terrorism kills Iraqi people every day. Everywhere smells like death in Iraq and nothing has been done to stop it. Lighting up the White House in Iraqxs colors will show the world that the United States is a strong ally and Iraq can still be united. Every signature will be like a bullet in the heart of terrorism. Every signature will honor the sacrifices Iraqis have been making since 2003. It will be a remembrance of  the children who died in their sleep, the families who were obliterated, the individuals burned beyond recognition, the surviving friends and relatives looking for answers in the still-smoldering ruins, and the mothers whose hearts are broken and are weeping in wave upon wave of inconsolable grief. As we unite, Terrorism can be defeated!

title: Pass legislation to address the issue of police brutality throughout the United States
body: For years, headlines have filled the airwaves with stories of people being killed by police in the United States.  Many of these individuals have been unarmed and appear to be clear uses of excessive force to the average citizen.  African-American men are disproportionately affected by this trend and it is beyond time for Congress to act in solving this issue. To date, multiple bills have been introduced with none of those passing out of committee.  Congress should move to enact legislation that requires reform for all state and local recipients of federal grant dollars. Such legislation shall require reforms in training, equipment purchase and use-of-force in addition to requiring federal review of officer-involved shootings that result in a death.

title: VETO THE DARK ACT (S.764)
body: On July 7,  the Senate passed a bill to label genetically modified foods allowing companies to use QR codes instead of words on the package. It discriminates against low income families, minorities, mothers, seniors, the disabled & those without smartphones.In 2007 President Obama said, xWexll let folks know whether their food has been genetically modified because Americans should know what theyxre buying.xALL Americans should know what they're buying, not just the privileged.Only 21% of Americans surveyed have scanned QR codes; QR code software must be downloaded. Just 27% of seniors & 50% of low income Americans own smartphones. 42% of Blacks & 36% of Latinos have had to let their smartphone service lapse. President Obama: Stand up for ALL Americans. Veto this discriminatory bill.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: c(311, 296) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment")

title: Stop violence of media freedom and political repressions in Ukraine
body: In modern Ukraine during the last 2 years the right of freedom of speech and expression opinion was violated. Nowadays, there are only two opinions in Ukraine: the opinion of the authorities and the wrong one. Dozens of journalists and activists who strongly opposed the government were imprisoned on charges of "separatism", "support of terrorism"and "state treason." These people declared the opposition point of view and strongly criticized the policy of the authorities. For this they were deprived of freedom and prosecuted by state machine. In this regard, we ask government of the United States of America to influence on the Ukrainian authorities, forcing them to respect actually the right of freedom of speech and to stop political persecution of opposition journalists and activists.

title: Formally recognize the Ku Klux Klan (KKK) as a domestic terror group
body: The KKK has lynched a multitude of black people, they burn crosses, and they publicly threaten death or other physical harm upon black people - that is terrorism. The very definition of terrorism confirms that: terrorism - the use of violence and intimidation in the pursuit of political aims. The KKK uses the "freedom of speech" excuse to defend hate speech and violent threats, none of which are protected by the first amendment. The KKK terrorizes people, most notably the black community, and hinders progress for blacks as a whole through oppression and threats.Please - join me, and countless others, in uniting against a group that should have never even started to begin with.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 326) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense")

title: Formally recognize the KKK and all connected entities as a terriost organization.
body: terrorism is defined as "the use of violence and intimidation in pursuit of political aims". This definition is the same definition used to declare ISIS and other groups, as terrorist organizations. The KKK (Ku Klux Klan) and all entities related has earned this title due to its actions over decades over racial injustice and genocide. It is time for the pentagon to be consistent in its actions - and just as they rightfully declared ISIS a terror group, they must declare the KKK a terror group - on the grounds of principle, integrity, morality, and safety.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 321, 18) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Education")

This definition is the same definition used to declare ISIS and other groups as terrorist organisations. The KKK has a history marked by the fear, discrimination, abuse, and killing of African Americans and all other minority groups that do not fit its hateful ideology. In its violent pursuit of white supremacy, the organisation threatens our very American ideals of peace, freedom, and tolerance. It is time the government formally recognise the KKK for what it is, terror.

title: No Respite for Highly-skilled Americans-in-Waiting. Need Portable Work Authorization & Recapture 500K Green Cards
body: On Nov 25th 2014, President Obama signed an executive action (https://goo.gl/wPP4K9) that would make it possible for the highly-skilled workers to obtain portable work authorization (I140 EAD and AP). Close to two years since then, there have been no updates on this action. Thousands of green cards are being wasted every year, with an estimated 500,000 green cards wasted so far, while the highly-skilled workers continue to wait in a queue that may take 20-50 years. We urge you to review and take necessary actions to recapture unused green cards, and provide portable work authorization. We want what American workers want x No H-1B worker increases and an equal opportunity to help us build our careers, innovate, and contribute towards the American economy.
petition_type: 276 Tell us what the federal government is doing about an issue
issues: c(311, 326, 29) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Immigration")

title: Support the Black Lives Matter movement
body: Whereas, from the beginning of the United States of America, the government has sanctioned differential value of human life -and lower value for Black lives in particular (see 3/5 clause in U.S. Constitution, legalization of chattel slavery in some states, Supreme Court rulings such as Dread Scott vs. Sandford, and other examples), we the people of the United States call for acknowledgement and affirmation by the U.S. Government that Black life matters. We petition the White House to formally support the cause of the Black Lives Matter movement by issuing a statement affirming that the United States of America pledges from this day forward to grant full and equal protection, value, dignity, liberty and justice to Black people and their descendants, as it does to all citizens of America.

title: Fathers Have Rights Too!!! Make 50/50 Shared Parenting an Absolute Presumption For All Fathers!!!!
body: "We need fathers to realize that responsibility does not end at conception. We need them to realize that what makes you a man is not the ability to have a child - its the courage to raise one."-- President Barack Obama Yet, in this day and age too many fathers are denied the ability to be fathers to their children due to a gender biased Family Court System in all 50 States. Too many times fathers are being turned into visitors and our children are suffering for it. Making 50/50 Presumed Shared Parenting a National Law brings fathers back to the forefront and allows them to be the role models they were always intended to be. Our children benefit emotionally, psychologically, mentally as well as physically. Level the playing field for Dads. Our kids depend on it.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: AUTOMATIC 10 YEARS FOR COPS KILLING AN UNARMED PERSON W/OUT REASONABLE CAUSE
body: For the past few years, it seems like Law Enforcement Officers are getting away with Killing unarmed Individuals and nothing is being done. Yes, 1 out of every 10 officers "may" be prosecuted, but it should be clear across the board. There is a lot of injustice happening in our country and nothing is being done about it. People are scared to encounter police officers, afraid of what may be done, whether or not they will make it out of that situation. Law Enforcement Officers are supposed to help us, not hurt us. We are not supposed to fear them, but to know if we need help they will be there to protect us. I am forming this petition to help put an end to the unlawful killing between police officers and unarmed Civilians.

title: Convene a National Summit to Address Systemic Racism in America.
body: The Purpose for Convening a 2016 National Summit on Systemic Racism in America is to first acknowledge the existence of Systemic Racism in America and that it is injurious and/or fatal to people of color daily, then admit that Systemic Racism in America is in direct conflict with the Preamble of the U.S. Constitution and finally address Systemic Racism in America through effective education, enforcement, eradication and advocacy. Through these three our nation can continue the effort to eradicate racism in America.This petition is calling for President Obama, Speaker Ryan and President McConnell to convene a 2016 National Summit to Address Systemic Racism in America, acknowledging, admitting and addressing racisms negative consequences on every person living in America.

issues: c(311, 321, 331) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Gun Violence")

title: Petition to require that all police officers go through racial bias training
body: Physicians for Criminal Justice Reform, Inc. (www.pfcjreform.org) is calling for the federal government to require Implicit Racial Bias Training for police departments nationwide as a condition of eligibility for federal grant funding.At least 9 people were killed last week as a result of our policing crisis.  CDC data shows that Native Americans, Blacks, and Latinos are killed during police interactions at higher rates than Whites. Perceived criminality and implicit racial bias are significant drivers of this problem.Research shows that police who are made aware of their implicit biases are motivated and able to implement unbiased policing behavior.The federal government should immediately require all police departments to implement implicit racial bias training for their officers.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 321, 331) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform", "Gun Violence")

title: Call on the FCC to Immediately Require Third-Party Inclusion in Presidential Debates
body: Therexs nothing in the constitution that says that America is a two party system, and that all other parties need to be excluded. In fact our Founding Fathers warned us about the threat of faction. John Adams said, xThere is nothing which I dread so much as a division of the republic into two great parties, each arranged under its leader, and concerting measures in opposition to each other.xThe public own the airwaves, and the President appoints the head of the FCC. President Obama must insist the FCC immediately revise their rules so the American public has access to the airwaves which we own. On issues of great public importancexlike Presidential electionsxthe public has the right to hear from and engage with all the ballot-qualified candidates in all broadcast events.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: EQUAL ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY
body: We need a bill that will stabilize and create Black businesses in urban areas.  At the town hall meeting 7/14/16 w/POTUS, police chief Flynn said communities of color were "disadvantaged."  The POTUS said we must "invest in those communities." Small business employs 49-52% of the workforce in this country. This initiative: creates jobs, helps pay down the deficit, contributes taxes benefiting schools and gov. services, will grow the middle class, will decrease crime.  This initiative provides 1000, $10,000 business grants in each of 56 targeted areas every year for 20 yrs. This will cost $11.2B. This is a grant paid back by successful businesses in taxes.  This is a solid investment. This initiative should not deny anyone based on educ, econ status or criminal background.

title: The African/African American - Voice of Freedom Proclamation
body: We, the people, petition President Barack Obama to reaffirm the promise of inalienable rights to all Americans, inclusive of African Americans. We are requesting a Presidential Proclamation that acknowledges the significance of African Americans to American historical and contemporary progress and recognizes their intrinsic value as vital members of the global human family.  Formerly enslaved and segregated, African Americans exhibited greatness despite reproach, indignities, impoverishment, shame and mass rejection. Their stunning accomplishments in science, civics, religion, government, literature, arts and sports during years of inhumane oppression speak of   African American intellectual prowess, heroism and nobility.

issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: PROTECTION FOR RESPONSIBLE CHRONIC PAIN PTS. & DOCTORS WHO REQUIRE USE OF OPIOID MEDICINES FOR CHRONIC NON-CANCER PAIN
body: Millions of legitimate, responsible, chronic pain patients with non-cancer pain are suffering greatly because of the massive Government spotlight placed only on the dark side of opioid medications in an effort to address addiction & abuse. Drs are now stopping or drastically reducing these medications to the point that many patients' quality of life is GONE! The stigma surrounding opioid medications is now taking away this viable, last resort option for pts all across the country. Furthermore, it has resulted in chronic pain pts without physicians willing to treat their pain. It is especially hard for the pts. with long, complex histories who have not benefitted from other treatments or surgeries and, therefore, require these medications in order to maintain their quality of life!

title: Require that all states have the same candidates for President on their respective ballots
body: This November, citizens of the United States will be voting to determine the next President. However, not all citizens will be privy to the same choices. Beyond the Democratic and Republican party candidates lie the candidates of several third parties that will struggle to make the ballot in some, or potentially even a majority of, states. This list includes the Libertarian and Green Party candidates, both of which have consistently collected 5-10% of the vote in national polls. This is not democracy.If we are voting on a government office that represents the entire country, we should all have the same options. We, the undersigned, demand that all states list, and acknowledge votes for, all candidates for President of the United States garnering at least 5% in national polls.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: STOP federal fumigation of 3.5 American citizens in Puerto Rico with pesticide Naled as effort to combat Zika virus.
body: A legitimate health concern regarding Zika virus exists for many US jurisdictions including Puerto Rico. However, PR has been particularly singled out by the federal government. The CDC, EPA & some local PR govnt authorities, in an effort to xcontrol the spread of the virusx, have plans to spray the pesticide Naled over large swaths of PRxs population. There is an absolute lack of transparency and credibility from decision makers. Over 80% of the people oppose harmful Naled fumigation. We demand transparency.  We ask the President's intervention to stop this action against citizens of our nation. The rights of life, liberty &  pursuit of happiness are not mere words, but rather a protection against unwanted govnt actions.  These rights are as essential as the air we breathe. STOP NALED.

The newest dictator of the world, staged a fake coup and blamed it on the defenseless citizens following Gulen's teachings. Over 100,000 lost jobs, property and dignity. Some fleed early and came to the U.S. some may still be able to flee, though Erdogan cancelled passports of all Gulen followers. We urge the Congress to act swiftly to grant immediate asylum to Gulen followers in or entering U.S. Over 10,000 currently jailed by Erdogan regime and are under heavy torture without any rights to due process. This is terribly in line with the rise of the Third Reich and we must do everything in our power to help save human dignity.

title: Create a Congressional Sub-Committee to Address the Employment Status of Workers in the xGig Economyx
body: Many companies that take advantage of the xgigx (or xsharingx) economy (particularly TNCs) treat their workers in a manner consistent with The Department of Laborxs definition of true employees, while still designating them as independent contractors. WE THE PEOPLE feel that these citizens deserve protections such as health care, workerxs compensation, and proper insurance coverage. A company that provides a fully branded service end to end and stipulates every aspect of a workerxs behavior, should be fully committed to making sure that these EMPLOYEES receive the benefits that they are due. Mr. President, we ask that you create a Congressional Sub-committee to investigate the practices of major players in the sharing economy, and ensure that the American worker remains protected.

title: Elimination of the electronic voting machines nation wide
body: It has been demonstrated that the current electronic voting machines can be easily hacked and an election essentially taken from the rightful choice by we the people. In a free nation, this is unacceptable and must be removed if a free and open society is to continue in America.  We cannot allow candidates to be appointed by a programmed system of voting, it must truly be the choice of the people to decide elections and not the highest campaign earner to be awarded the position of president of these united states of America.

title: Keep the ban on police departments receiving surplus military equipment from the Pentagon
body: During Ferguson,  the world viewed American policing style, where it seemed that American citizens were enemies on foreign soil, and the police, an occupying force.  The White House intervened, and The Pentagon policy of not destroying surplus weaponry, and giving it to police departments, was banned. This policy is now under review. They are not an occupying army. We are not the enemy. These same officers can't be trusted with handguns, tasers, and pepper spray.  They do not need military gear. They're not soldiers in a war zone, they are servants of the community.  Until police departments have overhauled their policies, their training, and their hiring procedures,  we the people demand that they continue to not have access to weapons of war. Do not lift the ban on police militarization.

title: Apology for Abuses at US Indian Boarding Schools
body: We the People ask the Administration to give a public apology for the abuse of Native American children in US Indian boarding schools. We ask that our President take the next step in the Native American Apology Resolution S. J. RES. 14 Section I, which he signed on December 19, 2009. The US government funded 500 boarding schools for Native American children in order to integrate them into dominate culture. Children were taken away from their families and stripped of their identities and their cultures and were mentally, emotionally and physically abused. The trauma they faced has been passed down from generation to generation. This intergenerational trauma is directly connected as a cause for many social issues today. This apology will accelerate the healing.
petition_type: 271 Take or explain a position on an issue or policy
issues: 311 Civil Rights & Equality

title: Declare September 8th, a National Day of Celebration for 50 Years of Star Trek.
body: Star Trek was about hope and change. It was a vision of a future that included everyone, with no one and nothing left out. It was a possibility that has inspired millions of people, perhaps billions, worldwide.September 8th of this year will be the 50th anniversary of the premiere of the original series. We the undersigned are asking the President to declare that day xNational Star Trek Dayx to honor the most iconic television series in history. Invite the surviving members of the original cast to the White House. Invite Gene Roddenberry's son. Invite the writers who created the most iconic stories. A celebration of Star Trek would restore the spirit of the nation, reminding us of who we are and what we can accomplish as a people.
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 301, 341) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Technology & Innovation")

title: Rename the United States Navy Ship USS Harvey Milk to USS Harambe
body: While there is no doubt that Harvey Milk died in the service of his country, his contribution to American history pales in comparison to the Silverback magnificence that was Harambe. Harambe who gave his life in a volley of friendly fire. Harambe.It also offers a strategic advantage:  the name Harambe x even whispered x will demand respect, obeisance, and awe. A USS Harambe will strike fear in the hearts of our enemies in a way that the name "Milkx never could. USS Harambe will remind the world that America never forgets its heroes. USS Harambe,  this who we are.

title: Do Not Marginalize The Public's Voice

title: Celebrate and Honor the "Greatest of All Time" with a Commemorative MUHAMMAD ALI Coin
body: His wife Lonnie once said that Muhammad belongs to the world. Muhammad Ali was the People's Champion, one of the most recognized and beloved individuals on the face of the earth, co-founder of the Muhammad Ali Center, and an inspiration to all. He proved that one person can change the world. He will be remembered for his love for all people, his athleticism, his humanitarian deeds, his social justice, and perhaps mostly...his courage in and outside the ring.Muhammad transcended athleticism to become a symbol of larger social issues. It is the totality of his life and the core principles that have guided him that make him on of the most beloved symbols of peace and well-being in our nation and the world. A Commemorative MUHAMMAD ALI Coin reminds all of us to be the greatest we can be.

title: Lift Travel Restrictions on Syrian UN Amb. Jaafari; Reopen the Syrian Consulate; and Restore Full US-Syria Ties

This request has not been granted.SAWA seeks a better relationship between Syria and the US. Both countries should work together to defeat illegal, anti-humanity groups and end the conflict that has been destroying Syria for over five years. This is in the national interest of the United States.Allowing Dr. Jaafari to travel would contribute to essential understanding and help bring the conflict to an end. He should be allowed to travel to meet with Syrian Americans and the US public across the country. The US should also reopen the Syrian Consulate and restore full diplomatic ties.

title: Petition for Obama to Ensure Abortion Services for Girls and Women Raped in War
body: In conflicts around the world today, rape is routinely used as a tactic of warfare and terror against women and girls. Already brutalized, these women deserve, and are entitled to, comprehensive medical care. For those that become pregnant, this must include the option of abortion. Due to this Administrationxs failure to reinterpret the Helms amendment to, at a minimum, permit exceptions for rape, life endangerment and incest, girls and women around the world are left without access to the services they need.  This is not only wrong; it also denies them their right to complete medical care under the Geneva Conventions and international human rights law. We ask President Obama to issue an executive order lifting this abortion ban.

title: Let Disabled Veterans Serve in the Military
body: The Americans with Disabilities Act requires all major businesses and corporations to hire people with disabilities. This applies to most government agencies as well, with one glaring exceptionxthe U.S. military, which is not required to comply with the ADA.Currently if you are wounded while serving, the only way you can remain in the military is if you heal completely from your wounds and can continue to do the job you were trained to do.  Wexd like to see a policy change that will insure a path of rehabilitation and retraining, if necessary,  for some wounded and disabled soldiers, so many of them can still have a chance at a military career and a life of dignity. This will eventually lead to a reduction in Veteran suicides and increase in the morale among soldiers who become disabled.

title: We the people of the United States want to give President Obama a (non-creepy) thank you hug before he leaves office.
body: It's been a tough year to focus on what's going right. Everything feels wrong, wrong, wrong. And President Obama leaving office is a tough pill for a lot of us to swallow. He's fought for the middle class, protected the rights of the LGBT community, passed healthcare reform, believes in science and isn't afraid who knows it, ended the Iraq war, implemented the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act, saved the auto industry as well as, you know, the economy. He did all of this and so much more with heart, intelligence, humor, and a sense of fairness and respect for the people he governs. He's put fatherhood front and center in American life. And he's made us believe that decency and integrity can actually exist in the highest office in the land. That deserves a thank you hug, don't you think?

title: We The People call for 100% paper ballots. Electronic voter machines have been proven non-secure.
body: At the Center for Information Technology Policy at Princeton University, researchers have been able to reprogram the voting machine without even breaking the xtamper evidentx seals. Over the years, the team at Princeton, cooperating with other researchers, has managed to disable and tamper with many direct recording electronic systems that use touch-screen computers without a verifiable paper trail.This month August 2016, Jeh Johnson, the secretary of Homeland Security, said his department was concerned about infiltration of the nationxs electoral systems. Experts have warned about voting machine vulnerability for years, but nothing has changed.The United States needs to return, as soon as possible, to a paper-based, auditable voting system in all jurisdictions. (NYT)

title: Stop construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline which endangers the water supply to Native American reservations.
body: The Dakota Access pipeline is set to be constructed near the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota, crossing under the Missouri River which is the only source of water to the reservation. The pipeline is planned to transport approximately 470,000 barrels of crude oil per day. The potential of oil leaks would contaminate the only source of water for the reservation. While Dakota Access claims oil leaks are unlikely, an oil leak from a separate pipeline in North Dakota was discovered (8/15/16) to have leaked over 500 barrels of oil since the leak began on July 19, 2016. You can read the article here: http://bit.ly/2aVm5cv. A leak like this from the Dakota Access pipeline would leave the Standing Rock Sioux without any clean water.

title: Make September Dystonia Awareness Month because it is not a country, It is a disorder!
body: Affecting over 500,000 people in North America, Dystonia sounds to most like a country. To those diagnosed, Dystonia is a painful and debilitating movement disorder that causes the brain to send improper signals to musclesxcausing twisting and distortions of various muscles in the body. This can make simple tasks like walking, talking, eating/drinking, seeing and even breathing difficult to perform. Those diagnosed have to explain the disorder to their doctors, nurses, friends, family and strangers even though it is the 3rd most common movement disorder. Dystonia affects people of all ages and there currently is not a cure. Please take a minute, sign and finish by verifying your email! Please help so persons with Dystonia can live without having to explain themselves.

title: Infertility should be covered under insurance  !
body: No one expects to receive a diagnosis of infertility, or in even more crippling times, unexplained infertility, but they do. Then we reach out to the insurance companies WE pay to help us, not expecting to be turned away, and we are. Infertility is a disease that men and women do not choose, nor do we welcome the depression, shame, and anxiety that accompany it.It is referred to as a "pre-existing condition" that requires months, to years, of care, but how is being diagnosed with the inability to do what you were BORN to do, different than someone who has diabetes and seeks possible lifetime assistance through their insurance?Mandate infertility coverage on a state level, so those who already suffer do not have to spend more on a second policy, just to have a dream come to life.

title: Juneteenth designated as a National Day of Observance
body: The "19th of June" or Juneteenth commemorates when the slaves in Texas were formally notified of the freedom granted by the Emancipation Proclamation issued by President Lincoln more than 2.5 years later on June 19, 1865 by General Gordon Granger on Galveston Island. The historical significance affects not only African Americans in Texas, but also the many others who have stood for racial equality nationally and around the world.  In recognition of the fact that 45 states celebrate Juneteenth as a state holiday, we believe that designating it as a National Day of Observance like Flag Day in U.S. Code: Title 36 will provide an opportunity for all Americans to learn more about our common past and to better understand the experiences that have shaped our Nation.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue

title: Grant Marcus Mosiah Garvey a Posthumous Presidential Pardon of His Wrongful 1923 Conviction
body: Marcus Garvey should be posthumously pardoned for his wrongful conviction for use of the mails in furtherance of a scheme to defraud. During a time when Blacks were seen as second class citizens, Garvey led a mass movement to elevate the Black community through economic empowerment and independence. He was convicted after being targeted by J. Edgar Hoover and deprived of a fair trial. His sentence was later commuted by President Calvin Coolidge on recommendation by the U.S. Attorney General and with the support of 9 of the 12 jurors who voted to convict. Garvey never abandoned his movement to empower people of the African diaspora and he was recognized as a forebearer of the Civil Rights Movement by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., and Malcolm X. Today, his legacy is celebrated the world over.

title: Give Chelsea Manning the care and dignity she deserves
body: Chelsea Manning is currently on a hunger strike in order to get fair treatment and the care she deserves. Fight for the Future has issued this statement regarding the treatment of Chelsea Manning:"Chelsea [Manning] is demanding written assurances from the Army she will receive all of the medically prescribed recommendations for her gender dysphoria and that the 'high tech bullying' will stop," Fight for the Future said in the statement. "'High tech bullying,' is what Chelsea describes as 'the constant, deliberate and overzealous administrative scrutiny by prison and military officials.' We, the undersigned, ask for the President to intervene in this matter. Many of the undersigned are also committing to individual hunger strikes in support of Chelsea Manning. We demand justice.

title: Maternity leave should be 3 months 100% Paid (in addition to annual leave, sick leave and short term disability leave)
body: Maternity leave for mothers should be 3 months 100% paid for all employees i.e. for ALL corporate employees, federal employees, non-profit employees, church employees etc.It should be paid leave in addition to annual leave, sick leave and short term disability leave since a mother should still have annual leave available to spend time with family and friends. She should also have sick leave available to take care of herself and/or her newborn in the event she or the child gets sick during the year. Short-term (and long-term) disability should only be used for true disabilities and not be encouraged to be used as 'maternity leave' since it should rather be available and used for unforeseen circumstances, if they were to arise in the immediate future and not need to have to worry about it.

title: Replace the warlike bald eagle symbol with a green frog of peace
body: The United States, like many countries, uses predatory symbols to convey an image of strength and a warlike nature. In 2016 we feel it is no longer appropriate for our nation to use oppressive symbolism like the bald eagle. We request that the current administration change the national symbol from a bald eagle to a green frog. The frog is a peaceful, jovial animal whose mythological context is transformation into a prince. It's multicultural, honoring fortuitous foreign figures from Ch'ing-Wa Sheng to Kek. We kindly ask that you shift the symbol of the United States from one of oppression and violence to a green frog of peace and love.

title: Drop or reduce charges against Deric Lostutter, the Anonymous hacker who exposed the violent rape of an underage girl

He faces a federal trial and up to 16 years in prison while the rapists walk free.  His trial will begin on November 8th.  The people of the US want the justice system to go after criminals not those who help bring them to justice.  The courts have been setting a bad precedent by punishing criminals who can aford large amounts of money for defence lawyers with little or no prison time,  while those without means are punished more harshly.  In this case the possible prison time doesn't match the crime.  This young man's actions brought brutal rapists to trial.  We ask that the punishment fit the crime and that the government take action.

title: Supercell Clash of Clans Permanent Ban
body: Supercell (SC), the maker of Clash of Clans, has permanently banned many players.  The reason for the ban is related to their fair use policy. The ban came without any temporary ban and is permanent. Many users have spent hundreds or thousands of dollars and several years growing their accounts.  Many people were banned on 8/31/16, which still fell under the old ToS, stating 1st time ban would be a 2 week ban. However, SC permanently banned us and then changed its ToS on 9/1/16 to reflect the permanent ban.We are asking SC to restore the accounts. We believe changing ToS after banning us is unjust. The new policy is too harsh and Supercell should give its users a 2nd chance to remove any third party software that they feel affects "fair game use".  Please sign our petition. Thank you!
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 301, 341) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Innovation: Arts & Technology", "Technology & Innovation")

title: Enforce requested halt of Dakota Access pending the appeal. Stop protestors held w/out bail NOW.
body: Standing Rock tribe and reservation North Dakota has filed an appeal to the injunction denied to stop the Dakota Access Pipeline thru Earth Justice. After a Washington district court judge denied the injunction,  President Obama administration stepped in and sent a request to the Oil companies to voluntarily pause construction and denied construction 20 miles of Lake Oahae. However, the Oil companies have stated they will and have proceeded with construction, many peaceful protestors are being held days without bail, and law enforcement now has loaded  semi-automatic weapons and tear gas aimed at individuals. We request enforced haltby the Federal government while the appeal is pending, and ask that this enforcement would continue until a full Environmental Impact Statement is completed.
petition_type: 281 Change an existing Administration policy
issues: c(311, 296, 346) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Energy & Environment", "Transportation & Infrastructure")

title: Cease Unconstitutional Effort to Grant Homeland Security Jurisdiction Over Elections via Critical Infrastructure Clause
body: It has been recently reported that the Department of Homeland Security is considering designating US elections 'Critical Infrastructure', a move that will give authority for DHS to seize jurisdiction over US election systems.   According to Article 1, Section 4, Clause 1 of the the United States Constitution; only individual states have authority to implement and execute US elections and only Congress has authority to make changes to how this authority is implemented.   We demand that DHS immediately cease any/all plans to unconstitutionally claim jurisdiction over any aspect of United State Elections & cease formation of preliminary committees to facilitate such transfer.  The DHS has no right to circumvent Congress to seize authority from states.  Cease and desist.

title: Discrimination against locs
body: This petition is important to me because I have an  8 year old daughter that has locs. My daughter has had locs since the age of 5 years old and is very proud and happy to have them. This law is  violation of my constitutional rights.  I thought this was a country where individuals are free to be themselves express their culture their identity thats what makes it a beautiful melting pot.  As an American I have freedom of speech, the right to bear arms, freedom of the press,  but I cant wear my hair locs because its associated with my culture ? What's next telling Jews they cannt wear there there long curls (peyot )on the sides of their head ? Because that is directly associated with Jews.  When will the discrimination end. I AM AN AMERICAN CITIZEN AND THIS IS A DISGRACE !

title: Veto the Energy Modernization bill (s.2012) if it includes the sportsmen's SHARE act and de-listing wolves from ESA.
body: Hunters and trappers added de-listing the gray wolves in the Great Lakes and Wyoming to the Energy Modernization Act (S.2012) as a rider. For years they have failed to pass stand-alone legislation to remove protection (of the 1964 Wilderness Act) for millions of acres of our pristine lands and wildlife-to allow killing, trapping, shooting with polluting lead shot, federal government xfinanced shooting ranges, running packs of dogs on deer and all wildlife, building roads and allowing motorized vehicles on public lands to access wildlife for trophy killing.De-listing wolves from the scientific protection of the Endangered Species Act would NOT allow the ESA to protect wolves now or at any time in the future AND bars the courts from intervening. S.2012 MUST be vetoed if it has this rider.

title: Support Kashmir solution as per United Nations resolutions to bring lasting peace between Pakistan & India

Both Pakistan-India are nuclear armed neighbours, therefore, Kashmir can become flashpoint for nuclear war between Pakistan-India leading to start of 3rd World War. Kashmir is an unfinished agenda of partition of Pakistan-India and it must be resolved as per United Nations resolutions, which provide good guidelines towards solution. World powers such as USA need to play their role in nudging both Pakistan-India to follow UN resolutions. Kashmiris are presently suffering one of the worst humanitarian crises in Indian Occupied Kashmir (IOK) at the hands of Indian forces. Human rights violations must be stopped immediately followed by posting of UN observers followed by plebiscite so that people of Kashmir can decide their own destiny.

title: Juneteenth designated as a National Day of Observance
body: The 19th of June or Juneteenth commemorates when the slaves in Galveston, Texas were formally notified of the freedom granted by the Emancipation Proclamation. On June 19, 1865, more than 2.5 years later, General Gordon Granger posted General Order #3. The historical significance affects not only African Americans in Texas, but also the many others who have stood for racial equality helping where they could, lobbying and lecturing nationally and around the world. In recognition of the fact that 45 states celebrate Juneteenth as a state holiday, we believe that designating it a National Day of Observance like Flag Day in U.S. Code: Title 36 will provide an opportunity for all Americans to learn more about our common past and to better understand the experiences that have shaped our Nation.
petition_type: 291 Call on Congress to act on an issue
issues: c(311, 18, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Education", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Grant Marcus Mosiah Garvey a Posthumous Presidential Pardon of His Wrongful 1923 Conviction
body: Marcus Garvey should be posthumously pardoned for his wrongful conviction for use of the mails in furtherance of a scheme to defraud. During a time when Blacks were seen as second class citizens, Garvey led a mass movement to elevate the Black community through economic empowerment and independence. He was convicted after being targeted by J. Edgar Hoover and deprived of a fair trial. His sentence was later commuted by President Calvin Coolidge on recommendation by the U.S. Attorney General and with the support of 9 of the 12 jurors who voted to convict. Garvey never abandoned his movement to empower people of the African diaspora and he was recognized as a forebearer of the Civil Rights Movement by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., and Malcolm X. Today, his legacy is celebrated the world over.
petition_type: 281 Change an existing Administration policy
issues: c(311, 321) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Criminal Justice Reform")

title: Overturn Buck v. Bell
body: In 1929, an era in which the treatment of people with disabilities was horrid at best, the United States Supreme Court upheld "a statute instituting compulsory sterilization of the unfit..."In this case, "unfit" was the term used to describe people with intellectual disabilities, along with "imbecile".  In other words, this ruling legalized the forceful sterilization of people with disabilities.  It sparked the eugenics movement in the United States, which led to an unprecedented  of sterilizations/murders. It also directly influenced Adolf Hitler, Aktion T4, and the Holocaust.As of September 28th, 2016, this decision has never been officially overturned by the United States Supreme Court. On behalf of every American with a disability, I implore you to officially overturn this ruling.
petition_type: 281 Change an existing Administration policy
issues: c(311, 336) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Government & Regulatory Reform")

title: Tell President Obama to Reverse Deportation Policy Against Haitian Refugees!
body: On September 22, 2016, DHS Secretary Jeh Johnson announced that DHS will resume Haiti deportations because xthe situation in Haiti has improved sufficiently to permit the US government to remove Haitian nationals.x That's disingenuous and wrong; Haiti hasn't recovered from the devastating 2010 quake which killed 250,000 and destroyed most of its infrastructure; Haiti can't receive more deportees now given political and economic turmoil and an unchecked cholera epidemic caused by irresponsible United Nations actions which has killed 10,000 and sickened 1,000,000.  President Obama should promptly reinstate the Haiti deportations halt and, further, broadly expand the currently much-too-limited Haitian Family Reunification Program to cover all beneficiaries on the waiting list.

title: Reverse decision made by SECNAV to remove Rating system for Sailors.
body: SECNAV, CNO, and the current and previous MCPON have spat in the face of 241 years of Naval tradition and heritage by removing the rating system. Sailors have always identified with their Rate, from Master At Arms, Gunners Mate, Hospital Corpsman etc, these titles are an integral part of everyday life in the Navy. The shortening of titles to MA1, GM2 or HM3 had allowed succinct, simple and respectful communication between sailors. Removing these titles and abbreviations is not honorable. There is no courage in bowing to political pressure to be "PC". There is no commitment to your Sailors in voiding 241 years of history to make titles sound better. This decision is contrary to the core values of the Navy. Order SECNAV to reverse course immediately and poll every sailor for an opinion first
petition_type: 286 Propose a new Administration policy
issues: c(311, 326, 351) c("Civil Rights & Equality", "Homeland Security & Defense", "Veterans & Military")

There are mechanisms between India and Pakistan to return them.However, at this hour Pakistan doesn't seem in a mood to obey the conventions.Even in Pakistan's own admission, Chandu wasn't a spy but he was apprehended in full battle gear as a soldier. title: We want Dr. Bhim Rao Ambedkar as World Father...Preeta Harit IRSPresidentBahujan Samyak Sangathan
body: Bhimrao Ramji Ambedkar (14 April 1891 x 6 December 1956), popularly known as Babasaheb, was an Indian jurist, economist, politician and social reformer who inspired the Dalit Buddhist Movement and campaigned against social discrimination against Untouchables (Dalits), while also supporting the rights of women and labour. He was Independent India's first law minister and the principal architect of the Constitution of India.
